column1: ","Giallo Disco Records

Is a limited 12"" and Digital record label dedicated to the genre of 'Horror Disco' - A style of music taking influence from Disco, Italo, House, New Beat, Techno and the horror soundtracks of the 70s and 80s.
GD002 - Antoni Maiovvi - Stockholm Synthdrone EP
After the success of our first campaign to start the label, Giallo Disco return with gd002: Antoni Maiovvi – Stockholm Synthdrone EP
This is a pre-order campaign, digital release will be available immediately, 12"" release date will be November 26th.
As with last time, we offer the 12” version & Digital Download (including delivery) together exclusively to our customers for only $20 / £13 / EUR15 – This is the cheapest way to get the record.
or an immediate download of the EP for $7
But not only that, we are offering some special perks, only through us...
SPECIAL OFFER 1

for $30 you will receive the 12”, the Digital Download (via code through bandcamp) and a limited edition CD of the compilation “French Synth Lovers” containing exclusive tracks by Antoni Maiovvi, Soma Holiday, Art & Technique, X-Ray Pop and Philippe Laurent (AKA Hot Bip)
SPECIAL OFFER 2
for $30 you can have the 12”, the Digital Download (via code through bandcamp) and a CD version of Antoni Maiovvi's 3rd album “The Thorns Of Love”
SPECIAL OFFER 3
in addition for $40 you can have the 12”, The digital download (via bandcamp) and Antoni Maiovvi's 3rd album “The Thorns Of Love” on 2 x 12”
SPECIAL OFFER 4
also for $40 you can pre-order the new 12"", recieve the digital download (via bandcamp) AND recieve one of the last copies of giallo disco records' first release the Black Gloves EP
About The EP

From within fog and street lamps, Giallo Disco Records return continuing their journey into the mouth of madness with Antoni Maiovvi's Stockholm Synthdrone EP. Six tracks of sleazed out voodoo soundtracks for the dancefloors of no named clubs in strange cities. Including remixes by Cage & Aviary’s (DFA / The Walls Have Ears) Jamie Paton, New York Bloodwave pioneer Mircalla (Phantasma Disques) and Giallo Disco's own Vercetti Technicolor.

Darkroom's electro-tech slimes along the floor like leather clad ectoplasmic spectres, furthering Maiovvi's own New Beat / Early Detroit fetish. Prisoner Nightdrive is a slow motion cinematic epic. Brooding FM Bass and polyrhythmic arps recall John Carpenter at his most tense. Voodoo Voodoo's Frizzi-Does-Dirty-House atmospheres could bring the dead back to life through battered floor toms, occult chants and a ghostly piano seemingly detuning itself. Lastly on the 12” EP is a dubbed out rework of Darkroom by Cage & Aviary’s Jamie Paton, right for a subtle and sordid place at 3am for those about to become lovers...

On the digital only version, we include two more remixes, first up a darkwave re-imagining of Prisoner Nightdrive by New York's Mircalla and a futurist 606 terror-tech remix of Voodoo Voodoo by Vercetti Technicolor
Limited to 200 Copies
Tracklist
Antoni Maiovvi – Stockholm Synthdrone EP (Vinyl Edition)
A1 – Darkroom
A2 – Prisoner Nightdrive
B1 – Voodoo Vodoo
B2 – Darkroom (Jamie Paton Dub Mix)
Antoni Maiovvi – Stockholm Synthdrone EP (Digital Version)
01 – Darkroom
02 – Prisoner Nightdrive
03 – Voodoo Voodoo
04 – Darkroom (Jamie Paton Dub)
05 – Prisoner Nightdrive (Mircalla Remix)
06 – Voodoo Voodoo (Vercetti Technicolor's Space Voodoo Remix)",0.0,0,"4 Campaigns

Gnome Grown wnts to go in the studio!
This campaign has been launched to help members of Gnome Grown get into a studio and record a album.
When you contribute to the campaign you are giving small band with a big sound the chance to be heard. Gnome grown is a Northern Virginia based  band with huge talent.
The $2,000 will go towards a professinal studio recording. If the goal is not reached then a Demo will be recorded professionally with a handful of songs.
If you cannot contribute but want to help, spread this campaign by sharing on facebook and share the videos from youtube. It is a great way to be apart of this campaign.
Thank you

Gnome Grown

column1: To tour this great country requires funding. There are endless expenses on the road from lodging to gas to renting necessary transportation. column1: ABOUT THE PERKS

column1: This is it! Where I say, ""just one more thing."" Tell your friends. Tell your co-workers.  Dance to my tunes in the street. When people honk, yell ""It's Shira E's fault!"" Tell your lover, in every language you speak. Whisper it, Tweet it, post it on Facebook, spread the word. Know that your actions and love reverberate. This is one very large culmination of my life's work, and I just can't go it alone. This is where i say please, and I say thank you. And mean it from the bottom of my toes.
Yours in spirit,
Shira E
IN OTHER WORDS

“Throughout my career no other artists has inspired me to create art more often than Shira E. No other artist has inspired me to fill up the rooms of my own echoing heart more often than Shira E. I can’t imagine better medicine for this world than her music. Supporting this project is building a lighthouse!” - Andrea Gibson, poet

""Shira E is a new type of artist. Or maybe it’s a very old type. It’s a style that I’m sure is going to take over the future. She is a generator of all media. Words, songs, clothing, movement, moments, she is an engine of these things and more. She is creating a world for herself and the rest of us to inhabit. A new universe seemingly brought from nowhere, which has appeared to have been there all along, as if by magic. I’ve heard people used that word, magic, in reference to Shira E many times. I think it couldn’t be more literal. Sometimes you meet someone or hear something and you understand in the animal way why the word magic was invented and the proper use of the tool that is that word. We made up the idea for magic just in case something like this happened. The laws of the universe need to be continually bent to make allowance for the continuance of the universe and that’s what Shira E does for us. She does all this while making it seem effortless, an act of humor, an act of joy. I truly believe that she is a genius.”  - Brian Ellis, Author of ""American Dust Revisited""
","ABOUT SHIRA E

Hello wild & beautiful people! My name is Shira E & I am a Brooklyn-based musician, poet & visual artist. I play electro-soul through the roaring mouths of electric guitars, a sampler, & nutritiously thick beats. I've released albums independently for a decade & opened for TuNe-YaRdS, Coco Rosie, & Mirah. Music is what connects me to the hearts of strangers. There are times when I am writing a song that I am sent soaring, weightless, into utter aliveness.

I have been ferociously & independently producing art on my own for over 10 years. While that’s meant an intimacy with my fans that is heart-nourishing, as well as complete control over my sound, it has also meant limited resources, lack of funding for production, promotion & shipping, & often, compiling CDs on my bedroom floor.

As an artist, I am in so many good ways never satisfied. From my core I feel a whisper: evolve. In the last year, I have taken numerous leaps, from learning a brand new instrument, to writing a new record swimming with sounds I had only dreamt of, to recording my first studio album “Shouts & Sparks” decked with the care & glitter it deserves.
The album is done, & it shines. “Shouts & Sparks” is 7 bold tracks from the ocean floor of my chest to the tippy-rooftop of my imaginings. It is experimental & gentle with its raw.

I have no label. I need your help to get “Shouts & Sparks” printed & produced. I need your push to send me on my first solo cross-country tour (2 months from East to West & back) to promote this music. I want to reach you, to sing to you in your living room as well as the ballrooms, in every city you desire. This tour is a step into the life I dream of, a life as a touring artist
column2: it’s a commitment to push myself further than I’ve ever gone before.

column1: ABOUT THE PROJECT

I need to raise $8,000 to put “Shouts & Sparks” in your hands & to send me out on the road. So much goes into making a record. I worked with the incredibly talented James Zaner of Blue Jay Studios & I am buzzing with pride at our collaboration. Now I just need the funding to print, produce, ship, & promote the album independently.

I also worked with the incredible photographer Alessandra Genovese & the unparalleled visual artist & designer (& cousin!) Daniel Benayun on album art. What they've created is so delicious, so hot air balloon bright. I need to pay Daniel for his incredible promotional design, which includes posters & a limited edition art book of my poems & drawings.

To tour this great country requires funding. There are endless expenses on the road from lodging to gas to renting necessary transportation. But just imagine: a $40 donation fills the gas tank from Cincinnati, OH to Ann Arbor, MI. (Check out the map above to see where your donation could send me!) You will be adding shows to my tour, putting wind in my sails & launching me for two brilliant months on the road.
ABOUT THE PERKS

Art guru Daniel and I have brewed up an array of shimmering treats to thank you for your financial support of this project. Everything from 2-sided signed posters, to a limited edition art book of my poems alongside never-seen-before drawings (with a personalized fortune right from Shira E’s pen to you), to a “creativity party” on Skype where we can dance & share a dream or two, to an unforgettable, intimate house show in your city!

Every single donation, of any amount, is truly appreciated & will be put to good use. In etymology, to inspire literally means “to fill (the mind, heart, with grace)” & “to prompt or induce someone to do something” &“to animate with purpose.” So often it is the artist that is seen as the inspiration, but within these definitions we can see the living symbiosis of giving. Your donation will fill me with grace, prompt me on my path, & enliven me with purpose & (literal) direction, as I head out on the open road with a sonic spark in my hands.

This is it! Where I say, ""just one more thing."" Tell your friends. Tell your co-workers.  Dance to my tunes in the street. When people honk, yell ""It's Shira E's fault!"" Tell your lover, in every language you speak. Whisper it, Tweet it, post it on Facebook, spread the word. Know that your actions and love reverberate. This is one very large culmination of my life's work, and I just can't go it alone. This is where i say please, and I say thank you. And mean it from the bottom of my toes.
Yours in spirit,
Shira E
IN OTHER WORDS

“Throughout my career no other artists has inspired me to create art more often than Shira E. No other artist has inspired me to fill up the rooms of my own echoing heart more often than Shira E. I can’t imagine better medicine for this world than her music. Supporting this project is building a lighthouse!” - Andrea Gibson, poet

Shira E is a new type of artist. Or maybe it’s a very old type. It’s a style that I’m sure is going to take over the future. She is a generator of all media. Words, songs, clothing, movement, moments, she is an engine of these things and more. She is creating a world for herself and the rest of us to inhabit. A new universe seemingly brought from nowhere, which has appeared to have been there all along, as if by magic. I’ve heard people used that word, magic, in reference to Shira E many times. I think it couldn’t be more literal. Sometimes you meet someone or hear something and you understand in the animal way why the word magic was invented and the proper use of the tool that is that word. We made up the idea for magic just in case something like this happened. The laws of the universe need to be continually bent to make allowance for the continuance of the universe and that’s what Shira E does for us. She does all this while making it seem effortless, an act of humor, an act of joy. I truly believe that she is a genius.”  - Brian Ellis, Author of ""American Dust Revisited""",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

THANKS FOR CHECKING OUT OUR INDIEGOGO PAGE
""QWILL &
column2: The Soul Review Project"" will be recording a live music video and album in collaboration with Big Old Big One and DeSant Productions. Those of us involved in this project are excited to have the opportunity to record with such a group of amazing artists and musicians. We hope you can help us make this a reality.

column1: OUR MISSION:
To produce a one-of-a-kind live video and studio recording.

We will be recording at Dimension Sound Studio with engineer Dan Cardinal. Along with the live CD, Big Old Big One and DeSant Prod. will be producing live videos of the production. This is a true Indie effort bringing together many different musical artists, and videographers. We are hoping this model will help to promote and enable other artists to broaden their audience.
SO HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Support Independent Music! We have put together some items for purchase to help us reach our goal of covering project costs.  In appreciation of your support and for visting this page, we are offering a free download of QWILL ""Series Mixed Tape volume 1""
Please check out items on our Perks page.  We will have more cool stuff and updates throughout the campaign.
THE PLAN
We are hoping to raise $4300 in 40 days to make an amazing LIVE record AND video to be shared, discovered and enjoyed for years to come.
Some of the costs going into this project are studio time, engineering, video editing, marketing, promotion tools, design and duplication.
The money we raise will not go to us, but will allow us to have a viable recording to share with all of you!
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP?

Share this project on Twitter, Facebook, your blog, your website, with friends, and fellow music lovers. So please help us spread the news about this project and the link to this page with your friends: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/qwill-the-soul-review-project-live-at-dimension-sound/x/2142899
We appreciate your support of this project and helping us with a truly Indie project.
ABOUT

QWILL  is the musical vehicle of Salem, MA based singer/songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and producer, Jesse Ciarmataro whose music layers indie, soul, roots, and electronic. He has shared the stage with such notable acts as Amos Lee, Lucinda Williams, Richie Havens, Kaki King, The Violent Femmes, The Samples, and was the founding member of soul rock trio The Resonance and downtempo jazz inspired group Polyquin.  His recordings have appeared on MTV productions.  Throughout his career he has recorded and performed with numerous musicians such as The Ryan Montbleau Band, Christian McNeill and Sea Monsters and Jesse Dee. He has toured as part of the Christine Baze Band with Duncan Sheik, Ben Folds Five and K’s Choice.  Qwill continues to collaborate with musicians such as MC Esoteric and Michael Feingold, guitarist for Jay Z.
On April 7th 2013 QWILL will be joined by The Soul Review Project featuring Dennis Monagle
Big Old Big One’s founders – Eran Shaysh (Videographer, drummer &
column2: percussionist) and Daniel DP Perry (Videographer, composer &amp
column3: Producer) moved from Israel to Boston in 2007/8 to attend Berklee College Of Music. After graduating they combined forces and founded BOBO as a way to help both new and seasoned artists to have unique online videos to share with their crowd. Their unique “Off Stage Show” series features videos of musicians playing stripped-down versions of their music in unexpected locations. In a year and a half BOBO filmed more then 30 shows in two different continents with artists like Nicole Nelson (The Voice), Zach Deputy, Jesse D, Will Dailey, Yermi Kaplan, Shlomo Gronich among others and quickly attract a large online attention.

column1: DeSant Productions is a Boston-based full-service media production company, specializing in video and editorial services for the web and beyond. From music videos to corporate promos, live events to documentary film, DeSant Productions combines a passion for story telling with professional and high quality execution.
Owner Chris DeSanty is an accomplished videographer, director &
column2: editor, with a unique brand of creative and original content for artists/clients in the New England area. Chris holds a Bachelor of Arts in Communications &amp
column3: Cinema Studies from Stonehill College and a Master of Arts in Fiction Narrative from Emerson College.

column1:
Dimension Sound Studios is the reincarnation of a classic Boston recording facility of the same name, open from the 1950′s to the late 1980′s. In early 2011, partners Tom Dube, Matt Malikowski, and Dan Cardinal, all Boston based studio and touring engineers, decided to give the old space a fresh start. While maintaining a lot of the original vibe, Dimension received a technical overhaul. It now has a 32 input Pro Tools HD system, with an uncompromising microphone and outboard gear selection. An 1891 Steinway Model A grand piano was brought in, and two additional isolation rooms were constructed.  Historically, great songs like George Thoroughgood’s “Bad To The Bone,”  have been recorded in this space.

My Story

Hello Loves my name is Christine Nicole. I'm a pop songwriter/artist in Lubbock, Texas or as I like to call it, BuddyHollywood. My passion for my music is intense. I've been working on this album from the moment I graduated with my music degrees which has been since 2010. This project has been in the works for two years. It's been a crazy &

I had decided a long time ago that pop music wasn't just going to be what I did but I would make it my lifestyle. In January 2010 I had all these songs I had written ready to go into recording but I wanted a writing session with my producer Teel Merrick of Polk Street Studios in Amarillo, Texas. It was supposed to be a quick session that turned into eight hours of pouring my heart &

column1: Hello Loves my name is Christine Nicole. I'm a pop songwriter/artist in Lubbock, Texas or as I like to call it, BuddyHollywood. My passion for my music is intense. I've been working on this album from the moment I graduated with my music degrees which has been since 2010. This project has been in the works for two years. It's been a crazy & amazing journey.

I had decided a long time ago that pop music wasn't just going to be what I did but I would make it my lifestyle. In January 2010 I had all these songs I had written ready to go into recording but I wanted a writing session with my producer Teel Merrick of Polk Street Studios in Amarillo, Texas. It was supposed to be a quick session that turned into eight hours of pouring my heart & soul into these songs. Teel helped me chisel away at the songs so that they would be exactly how I intended them to be. I write all my songs based on very personal experiences & situations so I wanted them to be very telling & very intimate. I wanted them to be able to be identified with. I wanted it to feel as though you are getting to know me through my music.

In April of that same year I went into the studio to start the recording process. I spent a lot of time in the studio making sure that each song was exactly how I had wanted it to be & plus some. I had some of the best musicians working with me on the project so I knew I was in good hands. We finished the last song on the album in June 2011. I was sitting in the control room just in awe. I had put so much into every single song on the album. I went through every single emotion imaginable during the process of recording the album. I grew & I learned & I became a stronger person as well as artist. I am so incredibly happy with this album. I've been keeping things so hush hush but now it is time to get it into you all's hands!
So this is where you all come in...
The Impact

If I get the full $2000 all seven songs on the album will be able to be mixed/mastered & ready to distribute on Itunes & other paid music sharing sites. I am only $2000 away from getting the music to you in digital form at least! So the faster we raise the money the faster it gets to you.
What I Need & What You Get

Alright, so the easiest way to explain this is I am just trying to get the post production of mixing & mastering my album completed. This is so I can digitally release/distribute the album online. If I were to want to do distribute the album physically I would need around $5000 but I figure to get the music to you guys lets start out by at least getting it online so that you all can get the music.

Whatever money I raise will go straight to mixing & mastering the album in Charlottesville, Virgina. If I don't raise all the money the album will just take much longer to get done but it will somehow someway get done. I've put my heart into this project & since it has been in the works so long I am so excited to get it into the public's hands!

Other Ways You Can HelpSpread the word! The best way to get this fundraiser going is word of mouth. I believe that we can get this to spread like wildfire. If you feel like you can't give at the moment spread the word to your friends, family, neighbors, acquaintances, etc! Send out emails, post the link to your Facebook wall or in a message, tweet, & blog it. Every time you mention this campaign you are helping me get closer to my goal. I can't do this without you all. I appreciate the love & support. How I got here
Akory, my name is Marvin.

Three years ago I went on a journey to find something that I was missing in my life:
a band that is like a family, experiences that broaden your horizon and a new way of making and living with music. I have always been a musician but wanted a different approach, maybe a way of doing the best thing in the world I did not yet know of.
I brought with me some blues and experiences in rock and classical guitar, when I went to live with the folk and singer / songwriter of Australia, discovered the melodies and rhythms from South America and finally found happiness, drive and passion in Madagascar.
I went there at the end of 2011 to work as a volunteer in a school („College d´enseignement general de Loukintsy“), teaching English and sports (physical education) to the children, when I met three brothers that have spent their lifetime only playing music.
Where they came from

Their father regulary played his guitar and sang in the hotels of the small island „Sainte–Marie“ and as soon as they were old enough, he always took his children to perform with him.
All the brothers had, was their voice and a traditional drum, but over time further instruments complemented their equipment. Our coming together was as overwhelming as inspiring. Day and night we wrote numerous songs and started to record them in a small studio on the island. The repertoire was large enough to easily create our first album together... and here comes the part were we need your help:
Where we are heading

Due to the small size of the studio in Sainte-Marie and the vague business policies in the studios of the main cities of Madagascar, Antananarivo and Tamatave, overdubs, mixing and mastering need to be done in larger studios in Germany that have the capacity for the recording of bigger percussion and drums.

We already have requests to play live as well. E.g. the festival ""Die Breminale"", Bremen, Germany just reserved a slot for us for Saturday the 13th of July 8pm. If the campaign will be succesful, this would be a great date to publish our album.
What has to be afforded

Flights, Visas, insurances, studio-time, website construction, promotion, food, living, rehearsal room and instruments unfortunately don´t pay themselves and the income of a musician in Madagascar is by far insufficient to cover the expenses of just one of the points mentioned.
What can be achieved

Please help us to finish our album and to bring Raoky to Germany.
In fact it will be way more than just helping a band finishing an album, but also a great cultural exchange: Bringing artists from one of the poorest countries in the world to a European country for 3 months will be a great achievement that does not happen every day.
What you can get

What we offer in return for your support is of course a hardcopy of our album as soon as it is finished. We will also give you the opportunity to benefit from the treasures of Madagascar. Therfore, as an add-on to the music, you can chose between hand made cinnamon, beautiful traditional cloths, vanilla and malagasy pepper. Or all together as a package. 

If you like to see a video of us performing one of your favorite songs in Raoky manner, you can chose Perk number 7. Or you would like us to play a private acoustic session for 2 hours once we are near you? If you cover travel costs we would even go the long distance chose bundle number 8.

And last but not least: 2 weeks in Sainte-Marie. Come live with us and let us show you the incredible Sainte-Marie, the package includes the flight, housing, food in all it´s malagasy richness, transport on the island and us showing all the beautiful spots as well as bringing you closer the malagasy culture.
How you can support as well

Even without any money you can help!! Talk about it. Let your friends, family, collegues and everyone else know about what is happening with Raoky. Share the link on your Facebook page and be our friend.
We are open for all feedback and creative input. Maybe you want to book us for a show or we inspired you for a drawing...!? Here´s our Mailadress:
raokymusic@gmail.com
Misoatra bezaka!

Hailing from northern Calvert County Maryland, Awake the Atrium is band who deserves your attention.

This rocking quartet has been together for less than a year and has already impressed many ears and picked up a rolling momentum. Each member understands what it takes to create quality music. For Awake the Atrium, quality music means, music you can relate to, feel, and be a part of. Music runs in our veins, pours into our hearts, and is finally exerted out our minds onto our instruments.
The economy has hit everyone. Each member has done their best to support the band in every way they could, artistically, financially, and physically. Like you, Awake the Atrium has their responsibilities outside the band. Whether its diapers, mortgages, or utility bills, Awake the Atrium has fought for almost a year to keep itself afloat during these hard times.

Over the last year, Awake the Atrium has made great strides from being on the radio to playing a mainstream gig at Rams Head Live in Baltimore Maryland. Next on the agenda is our first CD release. For every musician, professionally recording music is one of the most fun yet stressful things to be a part of. It takes sacrificing time at work and with our families, along with a great deal of patience. For Awake the Atrium, this is something we’ve been doing for almost a year.

For our first EP, the only things that stand in our way are our stretched thin wallets. We don’t have merchandise to generate additional income or a ton of shows lined up, so it’s up to us to fine alternative solutions.

So here we are. We are asking you to help us record our first CD. This CD will help us generate fans, exposure, and income that will lead to merchandise. This is a business and without capital, you can’t take off.

To us, Awake the Atrium, isn’t just some weekend hobby and we aren’t some mediocre garage band your buddy is starting just to get popular at your local bar. We are here to bring you professional entertainment. All of us have been through bands with troublesome members and chemistry that just wouldn’t bind. For the members of Awake the Atrium, T-BO (Singer), Jordan (Guitar), Sherman (Bass), and Jesse (Drummer), this is the final push out of the struggle, out of uncertainty, and out of the paycheck to paycheck lifestyle.
With your help, the next great band just may take off.
Thank you for your time,

Awake the Atrium
T-BO, Jordan, Sherman, and Jesse.

Hi Make Believers.  This is Rhoneil from the band Rhoneil.  I'm about to release a brand new LP entitled 'Make Believe' in mid-September.  In celebration of this special moment, I have cobbled together my DIY dream tour.  I live in a rural area, I don't get many chances to share my live music with people in faraway places.

I booked most of the tour myself so we are operating on abit of a tight budget.  We've covered most of our expenses up until this point.  We're just trying to raise the last $2500 for our van rental and then we are set!  Woot woot!
If you believe in what we do please support us by sharing this campaign, by sending us love, and by buying our art.
We're also looking for the following items:
- a microKorg
- a guitelele *no longer needed.  Donated by La.
- a guitar pickup * no longer needed.
- an autoharp case
- an ipod touch
- a delay pedal * No longer needed.  Donated by Tyler.
Thanks again pals!

story
Hi, my name is Simona Smirnova. Iâ€™m a professional
jazz singer from a small Baltic country named Lithuania. And I want to tell YOU - my story.
I grew up in the countryside. Even as a young
elementary school student, I was full of new and crazy ideas â€“ ones which were
unusual for the people in my village back then: I organized rock festivals,
theatre performances, I played in a rock band and at the same time I played a
Lithuanian traditional stringed instrument.
As you can see, music has been my life from the very beginning.  But rock and folk music were not enough. I
was seeking something that would contain improvisation, a strong harmony
system, and unlimited music language. So, I decided to study jazz. But people
kept telling me: you are a star here, but as soon as you leave this village
youâ€™re gonna be nothing, nobody. They just didnâ€™t believe in me. But I have
always believed in my dream.
I was admitted to the Lithuanian Academy of Music
and Theatre in jazz vocals. I have worked really hard, practicing and studying
from 8 a.m to 10 p.m.  You might be aware
that Lithuania has been a free country for only 20 years - and during the
Soviet occupation, jazz was prohibited.
This is why we still donâ€™t have an appropriate environment for studying
jazz music. This is where we study. But despite, all this Iâ€™ve achieved
unbelievable results. Because, I have
always believed in my dream. In these four years of my studies I
participated in different international jazz competitions
(http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5kMyJ7iCoGE ) and made a lot of projects: main
stream jazz you heard at the beginning, theatre performances, video
performances, social experiments and lots of different concerts.
When I decided to apply for the Berklee College of
Music in Boston people told me it was impossible because Berklee is the best
jazz college in the whole world. For example in 2011, Berklee students and
alumni won 13 Grammys (http://www.berklee.edu/awards/awards-grammy.html).
But
I have always believed in my dream.
I have been accepted in jazz vocal department and
gotten a special scholarship of 16,000 dollars a year. But the whole tuition
for the year is almost 29,000 dollars. So, I need about 13,000 dollars for my
studies and beside this I also need money for the health insurance, the
mandatory laptop, for the flight, the visa and the living costsâ€¦ In total It
makes 30 000 dollars for the year that I need and donâ€™t have. In Lithuania it
is impossible to earn that muchâ€¦. The average salary in Lithuania is about 500
dollars a monthâ€¦.
Berklee College is arguably the best place in the
world for studying jazz music. My teachers and colleagues say that Iâ€™m a
talented and promising jazz singer, and that Iâ€™ll fit wonderfully into
Berkleeâ€™s learning environment.  However,
I wonder if the general public knows what it takes to rise to the top in the
field of jazz.
Let me list for you some of the qualities that make
me stand out above and beyond the rest of my peers: Iâ€™m hard working and main
integrity while practicing and performing, I have an enormous amount of
professional experience within the Vilnius jazz scene, I have tremendous
flexibility and possibility within the capacities of my voice, Iâ€™m a fast
learner of music and technical concepts, Iâ€™m able to manage my time well, Iâ€™m
communicative, I work both as a composer of high level music as well as a
versatile performerâ€¦ never mind the fact that people enjoy my concertsâ€¦and hey,
Iâ€™m good looking, too!
If I have been able to develop my professional
skills to such a high extent in this small country, Lithuania, where jazz music
has been legal for only 20 years and where a jazz department exists at the
national conservatory for only 10 years, who can imagine how much I will
achieve when Iâ€™m a student at the best place for studying jazz internationally?  Think of the odds that have been stacked
against me:  Iâ€™ve been without a good
system and the necessary technical equipment for practicing and performingâ€¦ Who
can imagine how much I can improve my skills at a college where I will have
access to top-level teachers, will be surrounded by a community of fantastic
musicians, with the technical possibilities to make recordings and concerts?!?!
Make
sure! Have a look at my works of art:

The
Impact
If my campaign doesn't happenâ€¦ The world will be
missing my voice and ideas.What
I Need
I donâ€™t have any private funding sources as of yet:
my father is disabled, and my mother earns less than $500 a month. Iâ€™m applying
for other funds currently, and Iâ€™m trying to get international scholarships,
but Iâ€™ll get an answer only in September 2012, when I have start my studies -
and it will be too late. Now I donâ€™t have any money, even for my student visa
or plane ticketsâ€¦
So far, Iâ€™ve got a scholarship from Berklee for 16,000 USD for year.
Tuition for my studies is 28,850 USD per year (with scholarship, 12,850 USD per year).
Mandatory laptop: 2,985  USD.
Health insurance: 1,870 USD for year.
Plane ticket about $1,200 USD.
Housing, food about, visa: 13,000 USD per year.  Please
note that legally, I canâ€™t work or earn money during my studies in Americas.
For more information about the fees associated with
study at the Berklee College of Music, please click the Diploma Program at: http://www.berklee.edu/tuition/
TOTAL for the first year: 31,905 USD
If I achieve my goal 30,000 USD  - the first year
of my studies will be guaranteed.
I can guarantee You, that all money goes to my
studies expenses.
What
You Get
I will be very grateful for your contribution and I
can offer  a lot of things what you or
your family really need:
-Private lessons during my studies in Boston (jazz

-Private concerts for you and for you friends or
family (For example: for the Christmas party, the birthday party, family

Our Story

Hi, I am Carol Sokoloff,  a jazz vocalist and songwriter who recently released ""Let Go!"" (Wild Song) a debut jazz album, comprised largely of originals in the style of the standards. Audiences, singers and musicians love my songs and I wish to make further in-roads in the music industry so my music receives widespread distribution and attention. ASCAP, the American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers (of music) holds an annual industry event called ""I Create Music"" in Los Angeles California, billed as the best of it's kind. I have registered, and now am scraping together the funds to attend. My husband Richard and I both work in the arts and have limited funds. This would be a great opportunity to find a place for jazz in the world and perhaps a larger exposure for my songs, one of which which Grammy winner Kurt Elling said reminded him of Hoagy Carmichael, and Grammy-nominee  Nancy King referred to as ""a new jazz standard"".  I am gratefiul for all help as this Canadian artist takes an important step. I am also an author and lyricist with published books of poetry, history, metaphysics and children's writing.
<div>
The Impact

This would help a Canadian artist take her work to next step. It is my hope that I will gain valuable information, connections and create exposure for my songs and lyrics. I am applying for all opportunities available at the conference to play or have my music played (in panels and performances.) The music does have 'legs"" and is well liked. This conference will allow me to meet other songwriters, possible colaborators, and importantly, to consider how best to publish my catalogue of songs, to meet with a 'mentor' and to have my music heard. I think all these factors are likely to have a significant impact in advancing my songwriting career!
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

I need to cover travel expenses to and from LA. I am thinking of taking the train, a favourite way to travel and an excellent source of 'song inspration' (ask Duke Ellington and Johnny Mercer).  I also need to cover conference registration and accommodation.
Travel to and from LA, $600
Accomodation: $500
Registration fee for the conference: $400

What I am most looking for is the energy of knowing that people support my efforts and wish me well... are behind me and rooting for me, are helping lend some of their energy to create some energy for putting these songs out into the world... (where they came from). It is all a large cycle...like the major scale. What goes around comes around (like the tonic and the octave).
I am offering every contributor merchandise or a service of equivalent or greater value including my CDs, books, magazine subscriptions (mailed anywhere) and Almost Free Advice!!!
Thank you for getting behind this campaign. Leave me a commment please and go check out some of my tunes!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word and forward this to others. You can also bypass IndieGoGo and go directly to my websites and purchase either a CD or a book, and all those proceeds will also go towards this trip.  You can contact me at casjazz@islandnet and hire me for a jazz performance (solo, duo, trio, quartet) or for writing or editing.
My websites are
www.carolsokoloff.com
www.ekstasiseditions.com
www.prrb.ca

Polina Kourakina: “This Erie key of A”

Hi, my name is Polina Kourakina, I have lived in the united states since the year of 1998. My mom, and wonderful mentor has played piano her whole life, which was a huge inspiration to my musical background.  I have traveled to many places, meeting different people along the way.  All of these journeys have led me write wonderful music, while on the road to these different adventures. In the summer of 2011, I went on a greyhound tour for two months on my own which was funded by many of you today. In leu of coming back to Cleveland and making another album, I focused my time on getting dear, talented, musicians to help make beautiful colors of music spring out through arrangements that I wrote coming back, and growing this past year.
“Thie Erie key of A”

This campaign will help fund my first full length album. “This Erie key of A” is not only a collection of songs, splattered on an album cover, drenched with music to fill the notation of a page.  It is a connection of the journey I have embraced that landed me, miraculously, in the heart of a wonderful music scene. Which captured my soul into a state of enlightenment unlike any other time in my life.
With your help, this album can start a movement of joy, and celebration!!! YAY
What We Need &
Here is where the fun begins. In detail this is what we need to do to make this the most creative album ever made!.. AKHEMM:
<ul>
•  Record,Mix, and Master the Album
• Copyright, Digitaly distribute, and put on Pandora radio
• Physical Cd's, and a few T shirts to give you guys
• Vinyl Press the album, small run (you know you want one!!)
• Any Residual amount of money will go directly into the tour funding account.
In leu of repeating what perks are available, here is a summary of what you will recieve.
Download of the album, physical cd, vinyl lp, hand screen printed t shirt by the band and myself YAAY. poster, love and a big warm hearted THANK YOU!!!!
The cherry on the pie

It difficult not to sound greedy when making these things happen. But in all honesty, this album is the reason that i am motivated to go back out there and keep playing, meeting, and working with musical individuals. All of the wonderful ways you all can contribute will help make this dream a reality.
A plethora of ways to contribute
SPREAD THE WORD FOLKS!!
Here are some links that will help this get out, and become a box of crayons taht just fell on the floor, bursting with colors all around you.
www.facebook.com/polinakmusic
www.polinakourakina.com

www.indiegogo.com/polinak

Heading into their second year, Burlesque Rock N' Roll Band, The Fox &
column2: The Hounds are building a strong following in Chicago. From their electric cabaret-influenced stage shows to the blend of guitar rock, chamber pop, and even jazz, fans of the of era of women in rock (a la No Doubt or Garbage) will be happy to know that women led bands aren't dead (just fashionably late).

column1: With songs that focus on memorable melodies and eclectic stylings, what better reason  to make an album?

While most of the tracking has been captured for our debut album, we still need funding to finish mixing, mastering, album artwork and replication. In this day and age, record labels are almost non-existent, leaving album production and promotion up to the artists. While this is really exciting in that we get complete creative control we do need your help on the financial side.

We're asking for $4,000 which will cover most of the production costs, however mixing and mastering alone will be about $6000 and another $1000 for replication. So, as you can see every little bit we can get helps!

Let us tell you that this album has it all! We called in a few favors from some of Chicago's greatest musicians and have made these songs killer with full brass sections, cello, organ, saxophone, harmonica, djembe, bells, french horn...need I go on?

With your help we can see this album reach the full potential we know it is destined for. With an 12-page booklet of full colored album artwork, mixing and mastering by some of the top engineers in Chicago, we plan to go big and go all the way. Come be a part of this amazing adventure as The Fox &
column2: The Hounds show no signs of stopping!

column1: <div>
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand financial times are tight so even if you can only contribute a dollar, all those dollars add up!

You can also help by posting this link to your facebook page, twitter, reverbnation, myspace (???), we'll even send you the video file to post on your youtube page. It's amazing what word of mouth can do!
Thanks to everyone who's helped us make it this far, we can wait for what lies ahead!
F&
DON'T MISS THE RELEASE SHOW, DECEMBER 1ST AN SUBTERRANEAN IN CHICAGO, IL!

","Heading into their second year, Burlesque Rock N' Roll Band, The Fox & The Hounds are building a strong following in Chicago. From their electric cabaret-influenced stage shows to the blend of guitar rock, chamber pop, and even jazz, fans of the of era of women in rock (a la No Doubt or Garbage) will be happy to know that women led bands aren't dead (just fashionably late).
With songs that focus on memorable melodies and eclectic stylings, what better reason  to make an album?

While most of the tracking has been captured for our debut album, we still need funding to finish mixing, mastering, album artwork and replication. In this day and age, record labels are almost non-existent, leaving album production and promotion up to the artists. While this is really exciting in that we get complete creative control we do need your help on the financial side.

We're asking for $4,000 which will cover most of the production costs, however mixing and mastering alone will be about $6000 and another $1000 for replication. So, as you can see every little bit we can get helps!

Let us tell you that this album has it all! We called in a few favors from some of Chicago's greatest musicians and have made these songs killer with full brass sections, cello, organ, saxophone, harmonica, djembe, bells, french horn...need I go on?

With your help we can see this album reach the full potential we know it is destined for. With an 12-page booklet of full colored album artwork, mixing and mastering by some of the top engineers in Chicago, we plan to go big and go all the way. Come be a part of this amazing adventure as The Fox & The Hounds show no signs of stopping!
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand financial times are tight so even if you can only contribute a dollar, all those dollars add up!

You can also help by posting this link to your facebook page, twitter, reverbnation, myspace (???), we'll even send you the video file to post on your youtube page. It's amazing what word of mouth can do!
Thanks to everyone who's helped us make it this far, we can wait for what lies ahead!
F&H

Short Summary

TUPAC SHAKUR:   ""...I love Shakespeare. He wrote some of the rawest stories, man. I mean look at Romeo and Juliet. That's some serious ghetto [expletive]. You got this guy Romeo from the Bloods who falls for Juliet, a female from the Crips, and everybody in both gangs are against them. So they have to sneak out and they end up dead for nothing. Real tragic stuff.""   (Los Angeles Times. Oct. 25, 1995)
• Help fund the world's 1st Shakespeare rap tracks!!!
• In 2012, I recorded 23 tracks of Shakespeare set to music with master guitarist Eddie Jeff Cahill. This album will feature those tracks, and new additional tracks.

<li>My name is Greg Paroff. I have been a performer for over 20-years. Fifteen years ago I began developing the concept of rapping Shakespeare. In the last 5-years I have focused on developing myself as a rapper &amp
• Money from this campaign will cover expenses of travelling to California to perform at the 2014 Santa Cruz Fringe Festival. While at the festival, I will complete the album!

• Shakespeare Rap is a revolutionary concept, bringing the words of Shakespeare to a new audience. By supporting this project you are part of a game-changer in the 400-year-old history of Shakespeare.
What We Need &

• The $500 raised at this stage will go toward: a) $175 to Fringe Festival promotional-fee, b) $150 to travel expenses. $175 will go the beginning of expenses for additional recording and remastering.
<li>Some of the cool perks from this project include: advance tracks, Sonnet-by-Phone, Digital download, &amp
• If the full goal is not reached, the first money will be spent on the Fringe Festival promotional-fee. Additional money will be given to the Executive Producer, as down-payment.
The Impact
• Funds additionally support the Fringe Show WILD MAN SHAKESPEARE at The Santa Cruz Fringe Festival (www.scfringe.com).
<li>Those who know &amp
column2: appreciate Shakespeare's work understand how this recording will bring Shakespeare to a new audience. Those who just love rap will have a great rap album to enjoy.

column1: <li>Previously, Greg Paroff has performed Shakespeare-related shows at two Fringe Festivals (SHAKESPEARE AFTER MIDNIGHT and BARD, BEAT$, &amp
column2: BURLESQUE!!!) to positive-notices (see quotes under photo captions). He has performed Shakespeare Rap! for five-consecutive Renaissance Festival seasons, and has rapped Shakespeare in his comedy-act STANDUP SHAKESPEARE. He has also appeared in various stage-productions of Shakespeare

column1:
Rap (verb). Corruption of ""rapid"" (i.e. rap'd), c.1605. From Middle Dutch, Probably derived from rapen which originally meant ""to make haste,"" ""to speak quickly.""

","Short SummaryTUPAC SHAKUR:   ""...I love Shakespeare. He wrote some of the rawest stories, man. I mean look at Romeo and Juliet. That's some serious ghetto [expletive]. You got this guy Romeo from the Bloods who falls for Juliet, a female from the Crips, and everybody in both gangs are against them. So they have to sneak out and they end up dead for nothing. Real tragic stuff.""   (Los Angeles Times. Oct. 25, 1995)
Help fund the world's 1st Shakespeare rap tracks!!!
In 2012, I recorded 23 tracks of Shakespeare set to music with master guitarist Eddie Jeff Cahill. This album will feature those tracks, and new additional tracks.

My name is Greg Paroff. I have been a performer for over 20-years. Fifteen years ago I began developing the concept of rapping Shakespeare. In the last 5-years I have focused on developing myself as a rapper & an eccentric performer of Shakespeare.
Money from this campaign will cover expenses of travelling to California to perform at the 2014 Santa Cruz Fringe Festival. While at the festival, I will complete the album!
Shakespeare Rap is a revolutionary concept, bringing the words of Shakespeare to a new audience. By supporting this project you are part of a game-changer in the 400-year-old history of Shakespeare.
What We Need & What You Get
The $500 raised at this stage will go toward: a) $175 to Fringe Festival promotional-fee, b) $150 to travel expenses. $175 will go the beginning of expenses for additional recording and remastering.
Some of the cool perks from this project include: advance tracks, Sonnet-by-Phone, Digital download, & insert-PDF!
If the full goal is not reached, the first money will be spent on the Fringe Festival promotional-fee. Additional money will be given to the Executive Producer, as down-payment.
The Impact
Funds additionally support the Fringe Show WILD MAN SHAKESPEARE at The Santa Cruz Fringe Festival (www.scfringe.com).
Those who know & appreciate Shakespeare's work understand how this recording will bring Shakespeare to a new audience. Those who just love rap will have a great rap album to enjoy.

Previously, Greg Paroff has performed Shakespeare-related shows at two Fringe Festivals (SHAKESPEARE AFTER MIDNIGHT and BARD, BEAT$, & BURLESQUE!!!) to positive-notices (see quotes under photo captions). He has performed Shakespeare Rap! for five-consecutive Renaissance Festival seasons, and has rapped Shakespeare in his comedy-act STANDUP SHAKESPEARE. He has also appeared in various stage-productions of Shakespeare
This commitment to Shakespeare is a life-long pursuit for Greg Paroff, who brings the bards rhymes to the public in new & exciting ways.
Other Ways You Can Help
Show your support by Liking & Sharing Shakespeare Rap! on Facbook,  Share with your Friends (www.facebook.com/shakespearerap).
If you can't contribute (remember $1 helps), please Share this project -- via Facebook, email, & word-of-mouth -- to anyone interested in being part of this exciting piece of Shakesperiana!
Rap (verb). Corruption of ""rapid"" (i.e. rap'd), c.1605. From Middle Dutch, Probably derived from rapen which originally meant ""to make haste,"" ""to speak quickly.""",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Santa Cruz, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/shakespeare-rap-music-completion-project/pica

column2:
>WHO WE ARE:

Hello from the inaugural graduating class of The New Studio on Broadway- NYU Tisch!

 The past four years have been an insane, thrilling, and life changing time for all of us. We have grown up together into one large wonderful, talented, and dysfunctional family, and we want to celebrate our time at NYU by performing one last time together. On May 24th at 7 PM, NSB 2014 will be presenting a concert at Joe's Pub celebrating both our new voices and the voices of new composers. The evening will be under the artistic direction of Tony and Drama Desk nominated actor, Michael McElroy.
column4:
>Here's where you all come in. Putting on a concert at one of the top venues in New York City is expensive, and we are using our own money to produce this concert. We have a lot of fees that we need to pay to make this night happen. In addition to booking the venue, we have to create the cabaret, secure new music, hire band members, and make sure we produce high quality work. We are asking for your donations to help us produce this concert. Join us in celebrating our class, new music, and new talent. We promise that this night is going to be an inspiring, thrilling evening of new work, and we want to have you all there with us! 

Remember, the students are paying out of pocket to fund this concert. NYU is already crazy expensive, and this is hard for us! We would be so grateful for any help we could receive. The money that you donate goes to:

-The Venue: $2,000

-Comp tickets and food/drink for industry professionals and their plus ones (target number 60): around $20 dollars a person (possibly reaching nearly $3,000 total)

-Videographer: $100

-Cost of band members: TBD

Please help us reach our goal! We'll do whatever you want if you help us. For real. We promise. 

Love,

NSB class of 2014

WWW.NSB2014.COM

Short Summary

I began training in singing and dancing at five, and held
a vocal scholarship for six years at St Paul’s Grammar School Cranebrook. For
the past 10 years I've been studying vocal performance with Natalie
Carboni while also studying guitar and song writing.
In 2007, I won the “13 and under Vocal section” in
the Sydney Eisteddfod - a big achievement for a 13 year old. In 2010 I
was chosen as one of the top eight for the Grand Final of the Contemporary
Singer of the Year.
In 2013 I placed highly in all categories I
entered, but my most satisfying achievement at the 2013 Sydney Eisteddfod was

when I won the Country Section performing one of my original songs from my recently released EP – Reflections.

It is now my ambition, with your help, to attend the Academy of Country Music in Tamworth next January.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

I need the attendance fee to attend the Academy. It costs $3,300 which covers my accommodation, meals and tuition for the two weeks the course runs.

It would help if you could purchase a copy of my EP here. I am also offering an in home performance for you and your friends in the Sydney area. 

If you feel like just making a donation to bring my dream to reality, that would be greatly appreciated too.

    The Impact

    Many of our best Country artists have begun their career by attending the Academy learning skills such as song writing, stage craft, how to appeal to an audience as an entertainer, not just a singer, how to treat the industry as a business and about the industry in general. It is my dream to bring my songs and stories to Australia and the world at large.

      Risks &
column3:
Challenges

Attending the Academy has been a goal of mine for years and now is the time for me to bring that to fruition. I have appointed management to assist and guide me on my path to the future and have set up this campaign as part of my fund raising strategy. It's a challenge to raise the entry fee of $3,300 as a starting artist but the belief of my family, my management and my fans drives me forward. The only risk I face is not being able to attend, thereby holding my future career back.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I would greatly appreciate it if you could share my campaign by utilising the Indiegogo tools provided for sharing or share through Facebook and other social media sites you may have access to. I thank you in advance for your invaluable support.

Summary

For nearly 50 years, Bach Vespers at Holy Trinity Lutheran Church next to Lincoln Center in New York City has served as one of the city's most cherished cultural organizations. As the first organization in North America to present weekly Bach cantatas within a liturgical context, Bach Vespers has a long history or offering some of the city's finest early music and the model from which other institutions have found inspiration.

On Sunday, April 27th at 5:00PM, Bach Vespers will presents its final Vespers of the season featuring Bach cantata Christ lag in Todesbanden (Christ Lay in Death's Strong Bands) along with other exquisite music from North Germany. Our most ambitious season to date, your gift will help ensure that we meet our financial goal for the year. Bach Vespers serves as a major source of employment for singers and instrumentalists in the greater NYC area and faithfully presents the music of Bach for free to the public week after week.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We're looking to raise $3500 in the next 30 days. That's an ambitious goal, but we know how important Bach Vespers is to so many people around the globe. Every dollar counts! There is no gift that is too small.

In the spirit of wanting to give back to our donors, we have three perks that we can share with you:

$25 and above: Acknowledgment in the program on a ""Special Donors"" page.
$150 and above: Acknowledgment in the program and reserved seating for Vespers.
$500 and above: Acknowledgment in the program, reserved seating, and an invitation for 2 to attend a private champagne reception in the gallery after Vespers.

The Impact

For centuries, Bach's music has inspired, moved, and delighted musicians and listeners alike. Bach's genius paved the way for other composers that came after to find their voice and continue to push the realm of musical composition to new heights. The music of Bach has lamented for the sorrowful, soothed the brokenhearted, extolled the joyous, proclaimed hope amidst despair, and captured every other emotion through the stroke of a pen.

Through your donation you can personally help grow this tradition and take responsibility for being a co-creator of beauty and art which moves people and nourishes their soul.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

column1: • Bach Vespers is always seeking people to usher, host receptions, or help with set up and take down. There are many behind the scenes hands at Bach Vespers! Contact the Bach Office at office@bachvespersnyc.org.
• Help spread the word!! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to reach your friends and family who might want to support such a unique and important tradition.

Thank you!!

Short Summary
I created music for my first album and have had some setbacks along the way that included old gear, health troubles, &
column2: work. These setbacks have forced me to push the release date further &amp

column1: Originally my audio engineer and I were going to do a trade of services. He had roughly mixed 4 out of 5 songs. But the final setback occurred when he lost his job. That in turn affected my project as he now needs to use his time to pursue paid work. Which meant, my album wasn't going to happen.
So I had 3 choices:
Number 1 - I could cry about it
With your help I can get these songs out the door! $500 is what we need to make it happen. This will pump blood back into my album release, AND support a skilled engineer.
The cover art is complete, so once this album is mixed and mastered, my first original album will be released digitally. This five track EP includes the song I performed at SHINE &
column2: 4 very uniquely crafted songs that are sure to stretch your musical boundaries. (Listen to a sample of a song I wrote for my son)

column1: So with that - Are you in? Be sure to look at the PERKS over on the right side, so that YOU TOO can benefit from this experience.
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column6: >If you aren't able to help financially, please share my video link so that this project can be heard.

column1: ","Short Summary
I created music for my first album and have had some setbacks along the way that included old gear, health troubles, & work. These setbacks have forced me to push the release date further & further.

Originally my audio engineer and I were going to do a trade of services. He had roughly mixed 4 out of 5 songs. But the final setback occurred when he lost his job. That in turn affected my project as he now needs to use his time to pursue paid work. Which meant, my album wasn't going to happen.
So I had 3 choices:
Number 1 - I could cry about itNumber 2 - I could bury the project & quit music foreverNumber 3 - Reach out to you
With your help I can get these songs out the door! $500 is what we need to make it happen. This will pump blood back into my album release, AND support a skilled engineer.

The cover art is complete, so once this album is mixed and mastered, my first original album will be released digitally. This five track EP includes the song I performed at SHINE & 4 very uniquely crafted songs that are sure to stretch your musical boundaries. (Listen to a sample of a song I wrote for my son)
So with that - Are you in? Be sure to look at the PERKS over on the right side, so that YOU TOO can benefit from this experience.
Other Ways to contribute If you aren't able to help financially, please share my video link so that this project can be heard.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","South Bend, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/triumph-album-fundraiser-jonndevon/pica

CRASH—Erik Barsness, Heather Barringer, Peter O’Gorman, and
Eric Sundeen— has been invited to perform in Cuba as part of the Havana
International Festival taking place October 22-31, 2015. It’s a tremendous
honor to be invited to join other acclaimed artists from around the world at
this festival, and it’s an invaluable opportunity to bring our work to Cuban
audiences. However, the Havana International Festival cannot provide artist
fees or travel expenses, so we need to ask our friends, fans, and supporters

for the funds to make this important performance possible.

CRASH is a percussion group that embodies the concept of
music in motion. We perform the visual percussion works of composer and
artistic director Mary Ellen Childs. Childs has created a powerful body of work
that integrates music, dance and theater in fresh an unexpected and delightful
ways. Check out the video below to see what we mean. Every work is a masterpiece.
We’ve been performing as CRASH for decades (some of us since
1988), and in that time, we’ve polished the pieces in our touring repertoire to
perfection. We return to our work together year after year to bring these amazing pieces to as many people as we can. CRASH has engaged audiences at home
in the Twin Cities, throughout the nation (New York, Vermont, North Carolina,
San Francisco) and throughout the world (St. Petersburg, Yaroslavl).
Now we have the opportunity to edify and enthrall audiences
in Cuba. We’ll perform twice at the festival and once at the Ludwig Foundation. We’ll
even be taking our act to the streets, so that people from all walks of life
have an opportunity to experience CRASH. Festival organizers assure us that our
performances will sell out. We’re certain CRASH will make a big SPLASH.
We’ve already raised enough money to be confident that our trip
to Cuba will definitely happen. We’ve covered airfare for all of our artists
and production crew, tour organizer fees (can’t travel in Cuba without one!),
and many of our production costs. We still need to raise money to pay for
lodging, meals, and artist fees so that our artists and crew can afford to take
leave from our other sources of employment.
We have $5,000 left to raise. Your donation can help us
bridge our funding gap and make our trip a success!

Introduction

In 1929, my parents fled their
homes in Eastern Europe and arrived in Canada with little more than the clothes
on their backs. Moyshe and Ida, of blessed memory, married in Montreal and
settled in a shtetl-like working-class neighborhood composed of new immigrants.
It was their dream to create a safe and comfortable life for their family in
which Jewish education and the preservation of the Yiddish language and culture
would be a top priority.
I grew up in a home where Yiddish
was the only language spoken. My three siblings and I attended the local
Protestant school along with Peretz Shule, where I discovered and fell in love
with the vibrancy and raw emotionality of the Yiddish folksong. It was there
that I learned and performed each of the songs contained in this album. Melodies
of children, parents, grandparents, teachers, lovers, victims, survivors and
rebuilders are indelibly engraved in my heart and mind.
As a teacher, parent and
grandparent, I continue to sing and interpret Yiddish songs in the hope that
our stories of trials, tribulations, and victories of past generations, will
live on. It is now my endeavor and obligation to perpetuate the dreams of my
immigrant parents.
Zingt Zhe Kinder is dedicated to my
children – Bryan, Danna, Marc, Ann, Ian, Courtney, and to their children –
Uriah, Maayan, Shahar, Shira, Zach, Alexia, Lauryn and Ashton – so that we may
all remember.
With love and hope for the future.
What We Need &
• Production costs will be anywhere from $1,000-3,000!  The more we raise, the better the quality of production and the more quantity to share and promote.
• Gifts and pre-sales are to cover costs for graphic design, discs, printing, art reproduction, distribution and replication, web design, and any other basic necessities in releasing the album.
• Proceeds will benefit the Jewish Federation of Greater Santa Barbara.
The Impact
• Help preserve Yiddish culture and language.
• Be a part of a very special folk art tradition and learn/teach Yiddish in the process.  Transliterations and Translations to all songs provided.

<li><b>Enjoy amazing folk music, professionally produced in studio by incredibly talented musicians and sound engineering by legendary Robert (Bobby) Martin, MultiMartin Music! Instrumentation includes:  Lorraine Klein, guitar and vocals
<li><b>Support a good cause that in turn will benefit an organization that provides social services and programs, open to everyone, no matter one’s age,
ethnicity, religion, gender, etc., and, most are FREE of charge!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
• Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
• Use the Indiegogo share tools!

We are passionate about helping the kids at Destiny Orphanage...will you join us?
Here is the project in a nutshell:
• Tunes for Tots is throwing a campaign to raise 2k to join Sarah Emerson in a building fund at Destiny Orphanage in Uganda, Africa over the Christmas season.

• Sarah Emerson and team have been playing gigs in Seattle all year to raise funds for the girls dormitory at Destiny Orphanage raising over 11k to date. And have been traveling to Uganda, Africa to bring supplies and funds since 2008.

• By raising this 2k, the girls dormitory will be pushed into the next building phase that, when complete, will give each girl currently sleeping night after night on a classroom floor...A BED at Destiny Orphanage!
What We Need &

• Our goal is to raise 2,000$ over the next 45 days. 100% (minus indie gogo's fee) of the 2,000$ received from this campaign will go directly towards the building fund for the girls dormitory not using any of it for our costs!! We are giving to this...with you!

• For anyone who gives a gift of 50$ or more, I will send you a free copy of Sarah Emerson and the Radiokings cd (Haaaaay!!) For higher givers, we will put something special together for you. THANK YOU for caring for these kids with us!
• Also, for higher donors who would like a tax deductible receipt...please email me at sarah.j.emerson@gmail.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise!! Help us get the word out via facebook, instagram, twitter, email or bullhorn ...whatever means you have! 

Musicians, tell peeps at your shows!! How amazing is it to stand and sing for something bigger than yourself?? Pass on the link...easy. 

I personally think we can blow this 2k out of the water. Let's see what Dallas has!!!

Also, for higher donors who would like a tax deductible receipt...please email me at sarah.j.emerson@gmail.com.

Other Ways You Can HelpMake some noise!! Help us get the word out via facebook, instagram, twitter, email or bullhorn ...whatever means you have! Musicians, tell peeps at your shows!! How amazing is it to stand and sing for something bigger than yourself?? Pass on the link...easy. I personally think we can blow this 2k out of the water. Let's see what Dallas has!!!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Seattle, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/dallas-for-destiny/pica

A Little about me (here goes LOL)

Hello! My name is Demetrius from Montgomery, Alabama. I'm a Independent Christian Artist working on my debut album entitled ""I AM FREE!! YAAAAAAAAAYY!! I've already put in a few years of hard work on the project and really excited about the music that's being created. I've had the opportunity to work with some GREAT musicians and I am recording at a great studio and have an AMAZING engineer and team supporting me! I've been a worship leader for over 10 years (WOW) and i've experienced a lot in life and in ministry! God placed the cd on my heart over 2 years ago after i read Galatians 5 in my private study time and these are simple songs of Freedom that will encourage the world to be the YOU that he created YOU to be! I'm so ready for you guys to hear it and I need your help in getting this released to the WORLD!

Mixing/Mastering
Photo Shoot for Album
CD Artwork Design
Website Design
Promotions (radio,internet,etc)
CD Duplication
Video
Studio Time
Touring to promote album
And so many more little things that goes into creating quality projects.......
<div>
The Impact I pray this CD has

I've been praying that the captives be set free and the world realizes the true impact of the Death/Burial and Resurrection of Jesus Christ!! He lives so that you can live! You're free from any bondage and you're fearfully and wonderfully made! I pray this CD speaks and awakens us to our TRUE IDENTITY in Christ! Those with low self esteem and those who feel abandoned and unloved...after listening to this music I pray a change happens and they KNOW that God want them! WHEW! I can go on and on....

column21: >Ghost in the Music is a passionate collaboration of music, art and ghost stories.
>I've created a book of ghost stories with a vinyl record sound track inspired by the death of musician Spade Cooley and other haunting stories San Francisco bartenders have shared with me.
>Along with illustrations by Kira Lynn Cain and music by Marabelle Phoenix, Ghost in the Music is a unique brand of nostalgia.

>Publishing a book and producing a record is no small feat and certainly not cheap. Especially for me as I am producing a book in the children's book style of ""Little Classic Golden Books"". Gold binding and all.
>Not to be out done, the record is also a nod to yesteryear, meaning a real vinyl 45. Don't worry audiophiles you'll get a digital version too.
>The money I'm raising will go directly to the cost of publishing the book and pressing the record.

>The total costs of my project is $7950.00. The bulk of the costs are for the binding and printing. Due to the golden book style and the need for housing a 45 record inside these costs are more costly than normal. I am using all local printers and artisans to maintain authenticity and support the art of printing and local businesses.
>This project has taken me on a fun and fantastic journey. Bringing to life my vision and meeting all the amazing and talented people along the way that helped make it possible.
>I know you will enjoy this classic book of scary stories and haunting music as much I do.
>Every donation is appreciated. Even word of mouth. But check out the perks cause I think you're going to want one.

column1: ","Ghost in the Music is a passionate collaboration of music, art and ghost stories.
I've created a book of ghost stories with a vinyl record sound track inspired by the death of musician Spade Cooley and other haunting stories San Francisco bartenders have shared with me.
Along with illustrations by Kira Lynn Cain and music by Marabelle Phoenix, Ghost in the Music is a unique brand of nostalgia.

Publishing a book and producing a record is no small feat and certainly not cheap. Especially for me as I am producing a book in the children's book style of ""Little Classic Golden Books"". Gold binding and all.
Not to be out done, the record is also a nod to yesteryear, meaning a real vinyl 45. Don't worry audiophiles you'll get a digital version too.
The money I'm raising will go directly to the cost of publishing the book and pressing the record.

The total costs of my project is $7950.00. The bulk of the costs are for the binding and printing. Due to the golden book style and the need for housing a 45 record inside these costs are more costly than normal. I am using all local printers and artisans to maintain authenticity and support the art of printing and local businesses.
This project has taken me on a fun and fantastic journey. Bringing to life my vision and meeting all the amazing and talented people along the way that helped make it possible.
I know you will enjoy this classic book of scary stories and haunting music as much I do.
Every donation is appreciated. Even word of mouth. But check out the perks cause I think you're going to want one.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","San Francisco, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ghost-in-the-music/pica
0,"

Hey! We’re Dead City Riot, an anarcho-skacore band from New London CT. We are comprised of individual artists and as group of freethinkers we find that we do not always agree with one another 100% of the time. Although, as a group of like minded people we find common ground, and understand that we are all struggling toward the same goal. We identify ourselves as part of an ever growing, international, revolutionary movement continuously moving towards freedom, justice, and peace. We stand in firm solidarity with all working, and lower class peoples. We are anti-fascist, anti-hierarchical, and stand in direct opposition to all oppression. We hope that through art and action we can spread the word of revolutionary cause, in hopes that one day, together, we may achieve freedom, justice, and peace for all peoples.

Since December 2011 we've toured the U.S. multiple times, with the likes of Morning Glory and Urban Waste. We've also toured the UK and Europe with label mates Luvdump and Thee Infidels, respectively. We’re released a US E.P. which was distributed for free, and a European E.P. which we distributed whilst on tour. Due to rampant touring, and our “for the people” market strategy ( meaning we have a very thin profit margin, we really just want our art out there) we've left ourselves with a smoking crater where our war chest once was.

So we come to you, the people, to help us gather funds to record our first full length L.P. We have given ourselves a deadline in which we would like to see the album completed and sent to press by the end of November 2013. If we can finish recording the album, our label will help with the pressing and distribution, but we need to finish recording first! This is very much why we need your help, to afford the studio time and get back on tour, where we belong.

We’re looking to raise $2000USD. That might not sound like a whole lot for recording, but trust us, we can do a lot with a little. About 1500 will go directly to studio time. The rest will go towards printing the album and getting the perks we promised out to you. Even if we don’t hit our goal, we will still do our best to get what we promise to those that do help. With a little luck, if we go over our goal, we’ll put any extra money towards making the album bigger and better than what we plan for now.
***please read***

In regards to the show pass, we will keep you information and whenever we are playing a show near you please contact us (2 weeks in advance would be best) and we will get you on the guest list for that show!

 Lara Price Means Business

My name is Lara Price. I first came on to the Northern California music scene in 1998. Since then I have recorded 5 records and 1 ""live"" DVD.

column2: >It's been almost 6 years since my last record. In order to keep relevant in the music business an artist needs to keep making records. As of late I have been working on my craft and have been blessed to have collaborated with some amazing talent. I feel like I am ready to unleash my 6th and best record entitled, ""I Mean Business"".

column1: <strong style=""font-size: 16px

My goal is to raise at least $10K. In reality, the cost for this record will be closer to $20K,but $10K will give me a head start.  Any contributions exceeding the $10K goal will go to added  recording and design, distribution and promotions.

<div>It will take 5 different studios to record ""I Mean Business"". The studio locations will be: Austin, Texas, 2 studios in San Jose, 1 in San Francisco, California,  and a studio in Portland, Oregon. Throughout my whole career, music lovers have been asking me how they can help
column2: and inquiring about what it's going to take for me to get to ""the next level"". Your generous donations will make it possible for me to finish this record. I plan to take ""I Mean Business"" out on the road and seeing where it will take me!

column1: To learn more about my musical journey: A Little About Lara
<div>
<span style=""font-size: 24px
<div>
It will take a village of talent to say what I need to say. Here are a few highlights:
<ul>
<li>
Chris Cain-Guitar player/Songwriter
<li>
Curtis Salgado-Vocalist/Harmonica player
<li>
Marcia Ball-The queen of the boogie-woogie piano
<li>
Mighty Mike Schermer-Guitar player/Producer/songwriter
<li>
Laura Chavez-Guitar player/producer/songwriter
<li>
Girls Got the Blues-All-female/All star Blues Revue
• The Sweet Nectar back-up vocalists-Sue McCracklin and Maureen Smith
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

If you aren't able to donate, I totally understand. You can still help by spreading the word via social media or over a tasty dinner with others!
