FAQ:
Is it possible to make a contribution without accepting the perk?
Yes.  At checkout, you will be given the option of whether or not to accept a perk.
Can I chip in for my own shipping costs?
Yes please! The cost of shipping is included in your perk contribution, but you're more than welcome to add a few dollars to contribution amount. Add your desired amount as you check out.
Can I give beyond the level of my desired perk?
Yes of course! Add whatever amount you wish as you check out. Every dollar helps us meet our goal!
What will you do with money made beyond the goal?
More time in the studio!  Higher quality music video production!  And there is ALWAYS more money that can be spent on marketing and promotion!  Thank you!

","YOU DID IT! WE DID IT GUYS!!!! WE REACHED MY CAMPAIGN GOAL WITH 1 HOUR TO SPARE.  YOU ARE THE MOST AMAZING FANS EVER. THIS IS CRAZY!  I know this is a tough time of year to come up with ANY extra cash…trust me, I sure do get it. Knowing that you all believe in my dream enough to trust me with your hard earned dollars is truly humbling, and the best Christmas present an artist could ask for.  THANK YOU FOR BELIEVING IN ME!  The future just got a whole lot brighter. I can't wait get to work and SHOW you how right you are about me!  Thank you Santa and all you little helpers of his :)  Never stop believing in people...and most importantly, never stop believing in yourself.  Ever.
Happy Holidays friends!  Now let me get to work on these perks of yours…
Love,
Jordan

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ I am down to the final hours and so SO close to reaching this goal before 11:59PM TONIGHT.  You've gotten me this far….too far to quit now!  Since it's Christmas Eve, here is a special message from Santa himself.
I believe in Christmas miracles :)

The Next Chapter is Taking Me to Nashville: In case you missed my interview and performance on My News 3 - NBC Las Vegas yesterday, the plan you are helping fund here is now taking me to Nashville, TN!  I am SO excited to share this news with you guys.  I will finish the current song we are working on here and resume the ""plan"" below in Tennessee.  With such wonderful people here in Las Vegas, and also in Nashville who believe in me and want to help build my career it was a tough decision to make, but I feel strongly that Nashville is where I need to be right now.  Its ready with open arms and I am answering the call.   Las Vegas has and will always be my home.  It is the community that has shaped me and built me up.  It is where my family lives.  I will be back
CLICK HERE TO WATCH MY INTERVIEW AT NBC LAS VEGAS & PERFORMANCE OF A BRAND NEW SONG

With only 6 days to go, especially with the big move ahead, I need your help reaching my goal now more than ever!  We are 59% of the way there, with $3,514 to go.  ANYTHING you can contribute will help and don't forget you can suggest your own perks if you like.  Please help me reach this goal by Christmas Eve friends!  I want to give my hometown one more success story they can point to and be proud of as one of their own.  Help me get there and watch me SHINE!

~ 12 DAYS OF CHRISTMAS ~Wow we are getting closer and closer to reaching the minimum goal guys!  Thank you SO MUCH for all your support, promotion, and contributions thus far.  For the last twelve days of the campaign, I'm counting down the ""12 Days Of Christmas"" with 12 special perks for my backers.  No matter what holiday(s) you're celebrating, count down with me EACH DAY while laughing at these silly instagram videos I'll be posting with fans, friends, and random people I persuade to count down the twelve perks I have created for you guys.  *Remember, if you have a special request or suggestion for another ""perk,"" I am all ears!*  Maybe, just maybe, there will be a a few surprises added...  This is going to be so fun!  Please please share this campaign page with you friends and tell them how awesome I am.  I am so close.  Your support means everything to me and I canNOT do this WITHOUT YOU!
On the TENTH day of Christmas…""
On the NINETH day of Christmas…""
On the EIGHTH day of Christmas…""
On the SEVENTH day of Christmas…""
On the FOURTH day of Christmas…""
On the THIRD day of Christmas…""
On the SECOND day of Christmas…""
On the FIRST day of Christmas…""
**UPDATE**
CHECK THIS OUT!:  http://vegasseven.com/2014/12/01/jordan-mitchell-and-ekoh-need-your-help/

Vegas Seven Magazine believes in me so I really hope you will too!  Writer Zoneil Maharaj not only wrote these kind words in his column, but also personally contributed to my campaign.  I am blown away.  The campaign support so far is overwhelming, but I still have a long way to go.  PLEASE share this article with everyone you know and contribute if you can.  EVERY dollar helps me reach my goal!  Lets do this together!
Who Is Jordan?
WEBSITE . FACEBOOK . TWITTER . MUSIC . VIDEOS . SHOWS

Official Bio:  ""Jordan Mitchell will not only drink you under the table but she'll write about it too. Her witty, yet heartfelt lyricism packs enough charm to win anybody over. It's a little bit folk, a little bit poppy and just a tad bit serious. In all honesty, she's the total package and then some! You would be a fool not to take notice.""  Born and raised in Las Vegas, Jordan naturally gravitated towards bright neon lights and entertainment. She grew up singing in the church choir where she developed her real love for music and singing. She has been influenced by artists like Patsy Cline, Ella Fitzgerald, Norah Jones, Bob Dylan, and Bonnie Raitt. Though music is Jordan's first love, she was brought up riding horses and competing in horse shows. She showed quarter horses at a very young age, and was eventually recruited by West Texas A&M Universitys top ranked Equestrian Team. She went on to win the 2009 Collegiate National Championship in Reining. While devoting her college career to becoming a national championship rider, she also earned a Bachelors Degree in business with a minor in musical theatre. Jordan blends country, pop and rock and sings with enough passion that will melt even the coldest of hearts. Her lyrics craft sweet with heartbreak, love with humor. It's not trying to be something its not
column2: its trying to be something it is. Real. Shes easy to love and hard to forget.""

column1: I have been singing since I was a little girl when I found it was the best way to annoy my little
brother.  I wouldn’t shut up so my
parents finally decided to put me in singing lessons to ease their ears a bit.  From there I started performing at every contest,
talent show, county fair, and community event I could, and I haven’t stopped
since.
I released my
first EP last spring and since then its been a big year of BIG opportunities.  In the past year I
have been LUCKY enough to have played Austin City Limits Festival, Life is
Beautiful Festival, Wine Amplified Festival, and many others especially here in
Las Vegas like Container Park (and nearly every venue downtown), The Palms,
Vinyl at Hard Rock Hotel, Rock's Lounge at Red Rock, Brooklyn Bowl
my songs played on Las Vegas radio station, Mix 94.1.  I’ve even
played a few shows at Whole Foods and Neiman Marcus, ha.  Vegas Rated, Vegas Seven, the Las Vegas
Review Journal, and other awesome publications
column2: as well as local news media like My News 3, Fox 5, and Action News 13 have been kind enough to show me A LOT of love and support.

column1: Why An Indiegogo Campaign?
WEBSITE . FACEBOOK . TWITTER . MUSIC . VIDEOS . SHOWS

Because, as you just read, I am “RIGHT THERE!” I CAN FEEL IT, AND I CAN DO THIS!……but only with your help.  Instead of waiting around to be “discovered,"" I want to involve you in the process to make the music I am passionate
about making for you. I’ve got a pretty good start so far, but the next step is
getting a few new good songs in the right hands.  In order to record these new songs, the right way, and
market them effectively……it takes money.
That’s why I am doing this campaign, and that’s why I am asking for your
help.
What Are The Costs?
WEBSITE . FACEBOOK . TWITTER . MUSIC . VIDEOS . SHOWS

For big ""stars,"" a record label's budget for simply producing and manufacturing a record costs around $200,000.  Then the record label invests hundreds of thousands more in marketing and promotion.  Sometimes these amounts are nearly double.  Even though I have

great friends who thankfully don’t charge me near what they normally would, costs still include: recording, distribution, photo shoots, music videos, marketing, website design, radio promotion, film and television licensing, and a lot of other necessary promotion for the songs.

My goal is $8,500 because, since we need to hit a MINIMUM goal, I believe this is the very minimum needed and an achievable amount based on my fan base.  It is VERY important I meet this goal!  If I do NOT meet my goal, Indigogo takes a 9% cut plus additional fees.  As you can tell, I need much MUCH more, but $8,500 would sure give me a great start!
THE PLAN!
WEBSITE . FACEBOOK . TWITTER . MUSIC . VIDEOS . SHOWS

I have some great new songs I am really proud of and I know you guys will love.  I want to harness the power of my fans to fund the process.  Instead of trying to finance an ENTIRE album right now on my own,
we’ll pick the best songs to pitch to record labels (with the help of some cool peeps who believe in me), and also an agent to get my butt on tour.  As soon as I get a label behind me, we’ll
finish the album and YOU will be part of it!  I want to make a great album of great songs and to do that, we need to reach THIS goal first.

Since these songs will be part of a full album, distributed by a record label at a later date,  I'll also be printing AND signing EXCLUSIVE EPs just for you, my backers…with your pictures on them. Its
only fair that you have the music you helped create!  I also have some other really fun incentives
like recording with me in the studio, appearing in my music video, a private

house concert….hell, I’ll even cook you dinner!  **If you don't see a ""perk"" that interests you, just tell me what you'd like instead.  Send an email to info@jordan-mitchell.com, and if I'm able to fulfill your request I will!**

I’m making you my record label for now.  With your help, I will have the materials I need to make the jump, and spread the music MUCH further. Your support means the world to me, and I truly believe that together we can show everyone that good, honest music and great fans are all that we need.  Thank you for taking the time to read this and boy if
you can help, I sure would appreciate it.
Just think, when I’m famous soon, you can tell everyone you helped put me up there
Love,
Jordan

Short Summary

Friends of Hamilton Academy of Music is a NON-PROFIT GROUP (EIN #80-0545150) composed of parents, teachers, friends and students.  The Academy of Music is a magnet program within the Los Angeles Unified School District drawing 930 students from across the Greater Los Angeles Area.  The purpose of this outreach is to raise funds to purchase instruments (1 Yamaha Bass Trombone, 1 Yamaha Jupiter Oboe, 4 Cremora Violin Outfits, 2 Cremora Premier Series Student Cellos, 2 Knitting School Model Violas, 1 Yamaha Vibraphone, 1 Carlo Robell: upright Bass, 2 Yamaha Hybrid Pianos, &
column2:
1 Adams Marimba).  The Academy of Music offers many genres of music including Orchestra, Marching Band, 3 Jazz Bands, Mariachi, Guitar, Concert Band and Music Technology.  Many of the instruments we use were purchased 25 years ago when the school first opened.  Several of these instruments are in need of repair and a few are so outdated the cost to repair them is exorbitant.  A few students bring their own instruments but many of our students qualify for free and reduced lunch and must rely on the instruments we can provide.  Music programs are being cut by the school district each year, but we have kept our head above the rising water.  Through teacher dedication and student talent, our program flourishes.  Our students come to the Academy loving music!  Our job is to provide the tools to make their time at the Academy productive.  Musicians know that music can be made anywhere, but they also know that the quality of the instrument matters.  We appeal to your generosity to keep music alive in public education and keep the arts pertinent to the next generation.

 

Where is the Funding Going

column1: Our goal is to raise $20,000 which will go towards the purchase of 14-18 instruments.   If we exceed our goal, we will purchase additional instruments so all students will have an instrument and won't need to share or play on a broken instrument.

The Impact

The Academy of Music views the arts as essential to the human spirit.  We believe that students flourish in a creative-purpose driven environment and that sense of involvement improves their academics.  With funds to purchase new instruments for the first time in 25 years, we will be able to expand the number of students who can participate in the above stated music classes.  Anyone contributing over $250 will receive 2 tickets to a performance of their choice.  There are over 60 performances a year.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

 There are no risks to bringing music into the life of a student.  The challenge is to spread the word that instruments are expensive to purchase and repair - every dollar will bring us closer to putting an instrument into the hands of every student who wants to learn.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, we would welcome ""used"" instruments in good condition.  We encourage you to spread the word about our mission and our campaign by mouth and social media.  We invite you to attend one of our many performances.  You can learn more about us at www.hamiltonmusic.org.  On behalf of the students, faculty and the Board of Friends of the Academy, we thank you for considering donating to our campaign:  An Instrument for Every Student.

Short Summary

Hey everyone! I am an independent artist from Florida. I've been making music since I was 15, and I've just finished my newest album Illuminate. I launched this campaign so that everyone who wanted to support my music, could easily grab a physical copy of my album. By backing this project, I'll be able to make sure everyone can get a copy!
<h3>What We Need &amp

As far as the funding goes, each backer will help with me with having enough funds to produce the physical copies. I wanted to keep the perks simple, so there's only two! You can buy the physical copy by itself, or you can grab a bundle that includes a: physical copy of the album, 11x17 poster and a sticker!
The Impact

Over the past couple of years, I have released two physical copies of my albums. With each release, I've had more orders and it's been difficult producing all of the physical copies without knowing how many people would want one and just procuring enough funds. Through this campaign, it'll be immensely easier for me to get these albums to you as fast as possible!
<h3>Risks &amp
As far as risks go, there really aren't any. The entire album is finished, and I will be posting various songs from it, up until the release of the album. :)
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't afford a physical copy, that's no biggie! But if you can, please spread the word about this campaign! I am so proud of this album and just sharing the word would be wonderful support.

0,"

Hello world! My name is Jamie Hamburg, and I'm a singer-songwriter here in the beautiful city of Boston, Massachusetts.

Music has always been an essential form of expression for me. It speaks, it heals, it consoles, it is my everything. From an early age, I found that I longed for the opportunity to speak to people without having to use words. Eventually, I realized that I want to use my words, but in a visceral way that establishes a deeper connection than just pure dialogue. I am so excited that I am finally releasing some music that has been raging inside me for almost a year. More importantly, I'm grateful that with your help, I could have that opportunity!

The material is ready, the musicians are waiting--this Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward creating my first-ever professionally produced studio album.

This campaign is raising funds for my professionally recorded album with Mike Davidson, a Boston-based producer, and engineer with 15+ years of experience working with both established and up-and-coming musicians. Together, Mike and I are digging into my original material, writing arrangements, and reaching out to local musicians to bring the songs to life.

We’ve been able to cover the costs of recording and producing one song, which is ready for you to check out right here on this page. This first song is called “The Strongest Stone,” and you can check it out below!
column3:
showinfo=0"">

While I was able to fund the recording process for ""The Strongest Stone"" on my own, to create an album of songs of this quality, studio time costs add up quickly. With that said, this campaign can give us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together. Your donation will cover following costs of my project:

1. Pre-Production: This is where everything starts. Mike and I will start crafting the arrangements for each of the songs that will go on the album. We’ll hold rehearsals to fine-tune the songs, arrangements, and talk through new and exciting ideas for how to approach the recording process.

2. Recording: This is when we enter the studio and start capturing the music and where the songs become what you'll hear on this album. This campaign will play a huge role in making sure we have enough time to capture great performances for every member of the band.

3. Mixing &
column4:
Mastering: Each track will get mixed to create the right balance between instruments, texture and color that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.

And what will you get for your generosity and support? So many awesome things!

We are so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity, We've put together a really exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign.

Check out some examples below and a full list to the right!

It's hard to express how much this project would change my life.

In truth, this project is the culmination of years of hard work, and passion for what I do. The thought that any one of you believes in me or loves me enough to help me proceed towards my future is both heart warming and humbling. 

These songs that I will hopefully get to record, they are not just songs to me. They are blue prints from the past, for the future. They are the stories of myself, of my friends, my peers, my role models, everyone who has helped me along the way. It would mean the world to get to share them with the people who inspired them.

I’ve had opportunities to record in the past, but this would be my first chance to work with a professional producer and take a much more deliberate approach to the process. Working with my producer, Mike Davidson, I know what it is I am here to do, and I have the creative direction and resources to do it. Mike is shaping my sound the way it needs to be shaped, and we both feel that the end result of our hard work will be exactly what kind of album I need to put out. This will be the first stepping stone in what I am planning to be a long and dedicated career, made possible by the support of some amazing friends, family, and supporters.

If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink ""Back It"" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts, and I am endlessly grateful for all your support.

If you've got folks in your network that would be interested in supporting me please help get the word out and make some noise! There are social media share buttons on this page, and please tell your friends how much I would appreciate their support.

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page. I can't wait to share this music with you!

The thought that any one of you believes in me or loves me enough to help me proceed towards my future is both heart warming and humbling. These songs that I will hopefully get to record, they are not just songs to me. They are blue prints from the past, for the future. They are the stories of myself, of my friends, my peers, my role models, everyone who has helped me along the way. It would mean the world to get to share them with the people who inspired them.I’ve had opportunities to record in the past, but this would be my first chance to work with a professional producer and take a much more deliberate approach to the process. Working with my producer, Mike Davidson, I know what it is I am here to do, and I have the creative direction and resources to do it. Mike is shaping my sound the way it needs to be shaped, and we both feel that the end result of our hard work will be exactly what kind of album I need to put out. This will be the first stepping stone in what I am planning to be a long and dedicated career, made possible by the support of some amazing friends, family, and supporters.If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink ""Back It"" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts, and I am endlessly grateful for all your support.If you've got folks in your network that would be interested in supporting me please help get the word out and make some noise! There are social media share buttons on this page, and please tell your friends how much I would appreciate their support.Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page. I can't wait to share this music with you!",8.0,1,"1 Campaign

column3: What Is a Secret Tree Fort?

column1: Hello, I'm Skyler.

I'm 20 years old and have an Acoustic Singer/Songwriter project named Secret Tree Fort. I've been writing songs since I was 15 years old, and play Drums (main) Guitar and Sing! I've been writing music as Secret Tree Fort since this past April (2016) and have grown a very healthy following very quickly as of January 2017! I have recorded and released 2 singles and a 5 track EP with low quality free software and a $50 usb microphone. All set up within my bedroom...
NOW its time to go into the studio for my first REAL recording session!
<h2 style=""text-align: center
As you probably know, studio sessions are VERY expensive! And being an unemployed, independent touring musician trying to chase his dream leaves you a little less than broke almost %100 of the time.
Thats where YOU come in!

Every penny you donate doesn't go unappreciated!!! I'm asking for $500 to fund my EP. On the right side of this page you will see perks I have available exclusively for only a few people! Shoutouts! Personal messages! One on one Skype calls! etc. Everything donated will go to supporting and funding the EP!
You help me =  I give you things + new music!
<h2 style=""text-align: center
column2: >What kind of Music Will Be On The EP?

column1: Some say they think my sound/genre is Emo. Some suggest soft singer songwriter, and others think I sound Alternative. But this time around I'm going for straight up Acoustic driven Pop Punk vibes! If you like songs about Breakups, Sadness,falling in Love or depression, this EP is for you! Brutally honest &
column2: forward lyrics from a heart broken boy from North Carolina.

• Share the link to this page on your social media sites! Facebook, Twitter, Instagram!
• Follow Secret Tree Fort on all social media! (Twitter: @Skyler_Truth, Instagram: @secrettreefort, Snapchat: @skylertruth, Youtube: @SecretTreeFort)
• Listen to my music FREE on Spotify

Thank you to everyone who has chosen to donate and stuck with me through out 2016. 

Seriously. Thank you so much. 

","Who & What Is a Secret Tree Fort?
Hello, I'm Skyler.

I'm 20 years old and have an Acoustic Singer/Songwriter project named Secret Tree Fort. I've been writing songs since I was 15 years old, and play Drums (main) Guitar and Sing! I've been writing music as Secret Tree Fort since this past April (2016) and have grown a very healthy following very quickly as of January 2017! I have recorded and released 2 singles and a 5 track EP with low quality free software and a $50 usb microphone. All set up within my bedroom...
NOW its time to go into the studio for my first REAL recording session!
What I Need & What You'll Get
As you probably know, studio sessions are VERY expensive! And being an unemployed, independent touring musician trying to chase his dream leaves you a little less than broke almost %100 of the time.
Thats where YOU come in!

Every penny you donate doesn't go unappreciated!!! I'm asking for $500 to fund my EP. On the right side of this page you will see perks I have available exclusively for only a few people! Shoutouts! Personal messages! One on one Skype calls! etc. Everything donated will go to supporting and funding the EP!
You help me =  I give you things + new music!
What kind of Music Will Be On The EP?

Some say they think my sound/genre is Emo. Some suggest soft singer songwriter, and others think I sound Alternative. But this time around I'm going for straight up Acoustic driven Pop Punk vibes! If you like songs about Breakups, Sadness,falling in Love or depression, this EP is for you! Brutally honest & forward lyrics from a heart broken boy from North Carolina.
No Money? Thats Okay!
​I understand not everyone has a lot of money but has a heart to want to help.
Here's how you can help me at no expense! $0!
Share the link to this page on your social media sites! Facebook, Twitter, Instagram!
Follow Secret Tree Fort on all social media! (Twitter: @Skyler_Truth, Instagram: @secrettreefort, Snapchat: @skylertruth, Youtube: @SecretTreeFort)
Listen to my music FREE on Spotify
Thank you to everyone who has chosen to donate and stuck with me through out 2016. Seriously. Thank you so much.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Our Project

Hey friends, thank you for your interest in our work! I'm Sydney Wright, and I make songs and sounds as an artist and live sound engineer here in Austin. I've been working on this project for two years. I recorded the single, You Can Stay, in 2015 with my producer, Stefano Vieni, and the road to release has been long and arduous. I've been so lucky along the way to stumble into the most gracious teammates that teach, encourage, and prop me up on my leaning side. Monetarily, until now, I've worked really hard to fly solo and relied heavily on the generosity of my friends. Fortunately, the director, Lauren Bruno, is an ambassador in the art of asking. She levelled up this video in leaps and bounds simply by asking for help in getting what we have. She's inspired me to reach out to you all and ask if you could help us ice up this delicious cupcake. Your contributions go directly into funding the last stages of production and the release of this video. We're so close!
Here's what we need:
$800 for 'post-production' to tie the bow around this labor of love:)
Post-production will include all of the film editing(selecting, sequencing, and timing each shot) and color-grading(enhancing certain aspects of the footage so the film 'pops')

column3: '>Honestly y'all, this project is more than a music video for me. This is my first step towards a dream that I've obsessed over since I wrote my first song at 15 years old. I love the hustle, and I want the option to do more of the work that I love - writing and recording songs. My hope is for this project to be a launchpad for a career that will allow me to create all day, everyday. Anything and anyway you can contribute is so very crucial and appreciated.

column1: More ways to help out
Whether or not you're able to contribute financially, you can still support our project! We would love your help spreading the word about this campaign. Indiegogo has share tools to make it easy!
ALSO, when the video is complete and released, SHARE IT! You're support in reaching out to the people that you influence is INVALUABLE to helping us create and keep on creating. THANK YOU.

Summary

Hi, My name is Stephie Grace.  I’m a singer/songwriter from London, and I write for Film, TV, established Artists and for myself as an Artist, as well as singing for my supper, teaching singing and getting my paints out once in a while.
Mental Health is a subject close to my heart, because I have suffered from, and still work through Mental Health issues, and I know many people who do too.

The idea for ""We're Not Meant To Do This Alone"" came in a moment of inspiration last year, when I was struggling.  I know that the power of words and, in particular, words with music, can have the ability to cut through the moment you’re stuck in
column2: hearing someone else articulate what you’re experiencing can be an immense relief in times like these.  That’s what I want to do with the project.

column1: I will write, record and release a song a month for 8 months, culminating in an album release in June 2018.  All the songs for the project will be inspired by Mental Health
column2: they’ll be frank, honest, but positive, empowering.  (The last thing I want this to be is depressing.)  Ultimately, I want to bring hope, let people know they’re not alone, even if they think they are, and to get people to reach out and get help by connecting with others.

column1: This is where my Indiegogo campaign comes in!
I am going to self-fund the actual project, BUT … I need to make a music video to launch the project with, (for the best impact.)  And that’s where I need your help.
<h3>What I Need &amp

I need to raise £2.5K to make the video.  This will cover all the costs of:
The Videographer/Director
The Producer
The Choreographer
The Editor
The Sound Engineer
The Lighting Engineer
The Stars /Performers
The Make-up Artist
Studio Hire
The pre-design and storyboard, and re-drafts
Props
Costumes
Cups of tea
And maybe biscuits...
Please have a look through the exciting, one-of a kind rewards you can have for your donations.  these include:

A First listen and signed copy of the completed album
Free tickets to We're Not Meant To Do This Alone gigs
A signed limited edition print of the artwork for my song Heartbeats (painted by me)
Handwritten lyrics with my doodles and drawings
The actual, signed Original Artwork of the album cover (painted by me)
A Skype singing lesson
A cover song request - filmed, uploaded to Youtube and dedicated to you
A live performance at your event or party
A chance to appear in the music video itself
An exclusive gift where I will write a song just for you, or for someone special to you
The Impact
With you help, I can make a video which will do justice to a project that has the potential to:
* Truly help those who suffer from Mental health issues, by giving them connection, hope and the encouragement to reach out and not be alone.
* Raise funds for an amazing Mental health Charity (Re-think) which I am fundraising for.

* Support me in continuing to make music that will make a positive difference.  I truly feel that, if we have been given a gift, it is kind of our duty to use it for the greater good.  Cheesy, perhaps, but TRUE!
Other Ways You Can Help

I am totally aware that we are not always in a position to give financially.  If you aren’t, but feel strongly about what I’m wanting to achieve, I would ask for your support in sharing this campaign to as many people as you know whom this would speak to.  This could be done by emailing a bunch of people you think would be interested in this campaign, or simply by using the share buttons beside the video.
We’re Not Meant To Do This Alone.
Thank you.
Please Note:

I will aim to get every reward out to you immediately (physical or on-line.)  Certain items (both shippable and experiential) won't be available until a bit later, (because they won't exist or occur until then!)  These include:
Appearing in the music video (September 2017)
The full ""We're Not Meant To Do This Alone"" album  - physical and download (June 2018)
Your name in the liner credits (June 2018)
Signed Original artwork (June 2018)
Guest at the Album Launch (June 2018)

Gina Fried was a beloved member of my synagogue, who tragically passed away at 53 from cancer. At her recent funeral, people spoke of her amazing ability to meet others with respect
column2: also, her amazing energy for addressing social ills, especially prejudice.  It's not surprising that ""Roots"" -- a project of reconciliation between Jews and Palestinians in the West Bank -- is one of the charities Gina's family invited others to support in her memory.  In my experience, the activists in ""Roots"" have Gina's same amazing ability to hear others with respect
column4:
and sow seeds of healing.

I was lucky to have the opportunity to hear ""Roots"" leaders Hanan and Ali in Ithaca, NY.  I heard them also in W. Newton, where I was moved again by the way these Palestinian and Jewish leaders are transforming their West Bank communities by
column5:
pact=2162-130258513-8117669623-3cb0e68c6ecb7b5c9b0bdb99d6ec8b636d857fdb"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">humanizing the face of the ""other"".

If you've checked out ""Roots"", or you knew Gina, and are moved to give, please consider doing so here so we can see our impact, and double it:  Happily, a generous grant from my W. Newton community will match any donations you make up to $1800.  Of course, if we reach $1800 and you can take us further, please don't stop there!  ""Roots"" will put all money to good use: joint text study circles for Jewish and Palestinian women
column6: joint intensive Arabic classes for teens
column7:
and summer camps for younger kids. 

As Palestinian leader Ali shares here -- to bring peace, we need a movement.  We, Jewish settlers and Palestinians in the heart of the conflict, have to be the ones to make this happen.  We have to hear each others' stories, each others' truths, to be moved to envision together and demand of our leaders solutions that will serve both peoples.  ""Roots"" is building that movement.

Please share widely!

Short Summary

I am Jason Everett aka Mister E, and I am excited to share my once-in-a-life-time opportunity with you and to ask for your help in bringing it to fruition.

Music has been a dominating force in my life since I was two years old.  I have been composing and performing from about 8 years old, and have played with many wonderful musicians over the years.  I was trained in Western Classical music attended university on a full music scholarship, where played in many types of ensembles….concert band, symphonic band, marching band and even a bassoon quartet. But playing electric jazz bass has been my greatest musical passion since I was twelve.

I developed an early love for groove (particularly of the funk variety), odd-metered time signatures, and more global tonalities particularly those from India, the Middle East and Flamenco music. Over the years I have played in many bands and created several of my own, most often the music is jazz fusion with a varying degree of global musical influence. 

I am an endorsed artist for three amazing companies, Conklin Guitars, Bartolini Pickups and Electronics, and Kalium Strings.  2016 was a very big year for me.  In addition to releasing the OM Bass: Jason Everett Signature Model with Conklin Guitars, I released a major work called Moksha: The Elimination of All Duality. It was an incredible honor to work with some of the finest and most respected Indian/Fusion musicians in the world on this project.

So that is some background…here is the opportunity. I am pleased to inform you that I have been awarded an artist residency from Jack Straw Productions, a prestigious non-profit organization in Seattle, WA that supports and promotes audio artists and audio production.  Among other things, the residency includes a significant amount of time in their recording studios with an excellent engineer.

My project is to record and film some of my compositions in the “Snarky Puppy style.” Snarky Puppy is a Grammy Award winning jazz ensemble that records live, with no overdubs in a studio with a small audience in the middle, everyone on headphones (including the audience) and excellent video capture with numerous cameras and angles. They are creating compelling and challenging instrumental music and video and all of their music is online for free.  Despite that, they are very successful, selling out nearly every show, touring the world, and selling lots of CDs.

So the reason that I am asking for help is to hire the artists to make this music.  My music is very challenging…it takes a high caliber of musicianship to be able to play it…and again, I am very blessed to inform you that many world class musicians have signed on to the project.  These include:
<li>
V. Selvaganesh a giant in Indian percussion who plays with Remember Shakti with John McLaughlin and Masters of Percussion with Zakir Hussein
<li>
Fareed Haque, director of Jazz Studies at Northern Illinois University
<li>
Radhika Iyer, classically trained Indian violinst who is also a fusion player on her seven-string electric violin
<li>
Trey Gunn from King Crimson will play his Warr Guitar
• The one and only, Bill Laswell has offered to help with the final mix.

Being able to record these compositions--that for the most part only exist in my head--with world-class musicians who can not only understand my musical vision but have the technique and capacity to really make them sound amazing has the potential to be a career-changing opportunity.

But to bring this level of talent to my project will require your financial support…

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

In order to hire these amazing musicians, (including airfare and lodging) as well as the videographers will cost between $25,000 and $30,000.  While this number is big, it would normally be much bigger if not for the generosity of the artists and production crew. 

None of the money raised will go to me…this is all for the professional artists and production expenses.  If I am not able to get the full funding, I will have to reduce the number of cameras, eliminate the string section and local Indian musicians, and go to a smaller core group.  This would change the dynamic of the project and would not allow me to fully develop my vision for this work.

The Impact

My music has always been described as unique, but until recently, it has fallen short in my mind in terms of artistic quality.  Last year I released my best work to-date called Moksha: The Elimination of All Duality. It is four movement, 20-minute composition that is the story of a soul that lives, battles with death, travels as light to the Source and ultimately returns to a new life with a sound that mirrors the more traditional previous life but embraces a blending of more modern sounds. (In retrospect, I realized this piece reflects an autobiographical perspective.) https://youtu.be/nkK3FMbWbhI

Included on this piece are some of the aforementioned artists including V. Selvaganesh and Fareed Haque
column3: as well as Vishal Nagar, tabla
column5: and on the soon-to-be-released fourth movement (called The Return) Ujwal Nagar, vocals
column6:
and Neyveli Radhakrishna on double violin. 

Risks &
column7:
Challenges and Ability to Accomplish the Goal of the Project

I have the capacity to accomplish this project if I am able to secure the funding.  As mentioned above, I have worked with many of these artists, and produced several solo and group recordings and videos.

I have played on many recordings and produced four records / CDs of my own.  But of course, now it is all about online views, not record sales.  My Youtube channel has over 60,000 views and about 250 subscribers. My Facebook artist page has over 1800 fans, and the average reach (market penetration) of my videos posted to Facebook is over 6000 people. My single video with the highest views is over 15,000.

Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously, I need cash to hire these artists and am glad to say that I have secured a fiscal agent so that donations can be tax-deductible (please contact me for info on how to do this).  If you can’t make a financial donation, don’t worry…you can still help out.  You can share this campaign with others who value music that brings people and cultures together.  You can also donate airline miles to that I can secure airfare at reduced cost to bring the artists to Seattle. 

If you are in Seattle, you could host a house concert where I can perform and talk about my project.  And finally, if you can’t do that, just listen and share my music.  It is not mainstream but it is me…and it is filled with love.

Thank you so much!

Jason

I am pleased to inform you that I have been awarded an artist residency from Jack Straw Productions, a prestigious non-profit organization in Seattle, WA that supports and promotes audio artists and audio production.  Among other things, the residency includes a significant amount of time in their recording studios with an excellent engineer.My project is to record and film some of my compositions in the “Snarky Puppy style.” Snarky Puppy is a Grammy Award winning jazz ensemble that records live, with no overdubs in a studio with a small audience in the middle, everyone on headphones (including the audience) and excellent video capture with numerous cameras and angles. They are creating compelling and challenging instrumental music and video and all of their music is online for free.  Despite that, they are very successful, selling out nearly every show, touring the world, and selling lots of CDs.So the reason that I am asking for help is to hire the artists to make this music.  My music is very challenging…it takes a high caliber of musicianship to be able to play it…and again, I am very blessed to inform you that many world class musicians have signed on to the project.  These include:

column1: V. Selvaganesh a giant in Indian percussion who plays with Remember Shakti with John McLaughlin and Masters of Percussion with Zakir Hussein
Fareed Haque, director of Jazz Studies at Northern Illinois University
Radhika Iyer, classically trained Indian violinst who is also a fusion player on her seven-string electric violin
Trey Gunn from King Crimson will play his Warr Guitar
The one and only, Bill Laswell has offered to help with the final mix.

Being able to record these compositions--that for the most part only exist in my head--with world-class musicians who can not only understand my musical vision but have the technique and capacity to really make them sound amazing has the potential to be a career-changing opportunity.But to bring this level of talent to my project will require your financial support…What We Need & What You GetIn order to hire these amazing musicians, (including airfare and lodging) as well as the videographers will cost between $25,000 and $30,000.  While this number is big, it would normally be much bigger if not for the generosity of the artists and production crew. None of the money raised will go to me…this is all for the professional artists and production expenses.  If I am not able to get the full funding, I will have to reduce the number of cameras, eliminate the string section and local Indian musicians, and go to a smaller core group.  This would change the dynamic of the project and would not allow me to fully develop my vision for this work.The ImpactMy music has always been described as unique, but until recently, it has fallen short in my mind in terms of artistic quality.  Last year I released my best work to-date called Moksha: The Elimination of All Duality. It is four movement, 20-minute composition that is the story of a soul that lives, battles with death, travels as light to the Source and ultimately returns to a new life with a sound that mirrors the more traditional previous life but embraces a blending of more modern sounds. (In retrospect, I realized this piece reflects an autobiographical perspective.) https://youtu.be/nkK3FMbWbhIIncluded on this piece are some of the aforementioned artists including V. Selvaganesh and Fareed Haque
column2: as well as Vishal Nagar, tabla
column4: and on the soon-to-be-released fourth movement (called The Return) Ujwal Nagar, vocals
column5: and Neyveli Radhakrishna on double violin. Risks & Challenges and Ability to Accomplish the Goal of the ProjectI have the capacity to accomplish this project if I am able to secure the funding.  As mentioned above, I have worked with many of these artists, and produced several solo and group recordings and videos.I have played on many recordings and produced four records / CDs of my own.  But of course, now it is all about online views, not record sales.  My Youtube channel has over 60,000 views and about 250 subscribers. My Facebook artist page has over 1800 fans, and the average reach (market penetration) of my videos posted to Facebook is over 6000 people. My single video with the highest views is over 15,000.Other Ways You Can HelpObviously, I need cash to hire these artists and am glad to say that I have secured a fiscal agent so that donations can be tax-deductible (please contact me for info on how to do this).  If you can’t make a financial donation, don’t worry…you can still help out.  You can share this campaign with others who value music that brings people and cultures together.  You can also donate airline miles to that I can secure airfare at reduced cost to bring the artists to Seattle. If you are in Seattle, you could host a house concert where I can perform and talk about my project.  And finally, if you can’t do that, just listen and share my music.  It is not mainstream but it is me…and it is filled with love.Thank you so much!Jason",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Summary

Hi Folks! My name is James Kasper. I founded Mighty Speck Records in December 2012 as a way of combining music and community. The decade prior to that, I had produced the Vancouver Island Music Awards, which was fulfilling and rewarding, but the inherent perception of competition left me in want of creating something wherein community was at the heart of both the goal and the public perception. Enter Mighty Speck.
My education is in linguistics and broadcasting and I've been a singer-songwriter for 20 years, so I am basically a word nerd with a passion for music.

This campaign is important because it is a first step in establishing a professional, productive space for emerging musicians on Vancouver Island (and beyond) to develop their craft and have an ambitious label give them the boost they need to take their music careers to the next level. Funding this studio/office space for the first 6 months will allow us time to build income streams so that we can then become a self-sustaining organization and empower emerging musical talents long-term.
We are aiming to raise $10,000 to go to the following:
* Rental Costs for first 6 months of studio/office space: $7200
* Purchase of recording equipment: $1200
* Travel costs for upcoming BC/Alberta roster tour : $1000
* Mastering &
column2: duplication costs for new roster album: $600

column1: Perks!
We have a fun variety of Mighty Speck Care Packages to offer you in exchange for your contributions!

* Attn: Lennon/Beatles Superfans/Collectors: A Limited Edition John Lennon Replica Jumpsuit (only 12 in existence, created by Le Chateau, the same creator of the original jumpsuit Lennon wore during the famous ""Bed-In"" in Montreal), donated by ""Give Peace a Chance"" author Joan Athey.
* Limited Edition signed CDs from many of our Mighty Speck artists (Eleanore, Skellig, Terry Boyle, Herokah)
* Two of our artists (Herokah &
column2: one anonymous artist) will write a song just for you!

column1: * Provide the Design Concept &
column2: Title for our new roster album!

column1: * Limited Edition signed copies of our new roster album! (CD)
* Limited Edition signed copies of our most recent roster album ""Nature &
* Your name on a prominently displayed plaque in the lobby of our new studio/office space.
* 1- Year passes to all Mighty Speck Showcases
* Acknowledgement/Thank-you in the CD liner notes of our new roster album
* VIP Pass to our Mighty Speck Studio/Office Launch (includes snacks &

Thank-you, in advance, for bringing Mighty Speck Records to life. By doing so, you are empowering emerging BC musicians and an emerging BC community record label which aims to do great things in the local &
More info on our label can be found at http://mightyspeckrecords.ca
And If you have any questions about this campaign or Mighty Speck Records, feel free to email me directly at msr@jameskasper.com
You rock.
Sincerely,
James Kasper
Founder &
Mighty Speck Records

The Goods:

Here's the deal. You help us finish this album - we give you lots of cool stuff! If you aren't already a fan, here's a link to the website www.bobbytmusic.net. This new album promises to be Bobby's best yet, and we are really excited about how it is shaping up.
The Details:
Here's what's left to fund:
Recording/Tracking:  $3,000 - We have laid down most of the tracks, but this chunk will help get the rest of the instruments, backing vocals, etc. so that everything sounds great!
Mixing: $1,750 - A necessary step in the process. Skilled engineers will be making sure that all the levels are just right.
Mastering: $2,500 - This is where the album gets compressed, equalized, and gets its stereo enhancements, all so that it sounds awesome!
Pressing &
column2: Printing: $2,500 - The album will be pressed on both CD and on vinyl (for you purists out there).

column1: Marketing: $250 - This will go to getting the word out about the album.
Music Video/Merchandise: $??? - IF we exceed our goal, any additional funds will go to making a music video of the title track.
The Why:

""It's pointless for me to make this album for myself, the purpose of this album is to communicate emotion and share it with people. Human connection is paramount in the world as we become more inundated with information and pummeled with . The crazier the world gets, the more art we need. You are not just handing money over to the project, you are being invited into this musical community."" - Bobby Thompson
<h3>Risks &amp

column2: >We are looking to raise $10,000. This will cover the growing costs of studio time, mixing, mastering, and pressing the album. We are also hoping to press it on vinyl for those turntable, retro purists.

column1: If we can get this money raised, we can get this album out in September at its best quality. If we do not raise the funds, we will have to delay the album significantly, and not have access to the same quality studio and personnel.
If you  can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help:
<ul>
• Share this campaign (and the YouTube video) on social media to your friends and family
• Indiegogo has tools to share this campaign as well. Be sure to use them!

Hi! I'm raising money to film a music video for 'Adios Maria,' my debut single that was released on January 17th. Adios Maria' is a call to action for a more humane immigration system, and a love song to immigrant mothers everywhere. We want to visually tell this powerful story and bring awareness to the experiences of immigrant single mothers in New York. We plan to shoot next week in upstate New York, and every dollar will go towards production costs-- especially ensuring that our talent, who are immigrants themselves, gets fed and paid properly. Shouldering costs as a 20 year-old independent artist has been difficult, and I would truly appreciate any help in bringing awareness to this cause.
Listen to Adios Maria here
About the song:

The pop-soul anthem honors a past generation of immigration advocates while activating a new one. After working to defend immigrants as young as 18 from deportation at the New York Immigrant Family Unity Project, Alma Grace knew that she needed to meld her activism with her art. Born to a family of Mexican-American immigrants and raised by a bad ass single mother, her debut single seeks to honor her roots and give back to the community she comes from.
About the artist:

Alma Grace is a 20 year-old activist, artist, and actress born and raised in New York City. Her mixed musical influences are reflective of a globalized upbringing— she learned how to love from Selena, make witty comebacks from Shania Twain, and turn pain into art from Miss Lauryn Hill. As an activist, she attended her first protest at the age of 13, has volunteered with community-based organizations in Harlem, and has worked in both the Bronx and the U.S. Senate to defend immigrants facing deportation. As a solo artist, Alma Grace is no less impressive— she has performed on Broadwayand Lincoln Center stages, and has been a featured soloist at the Tribeca Film Festival for years. Finally, her acting career has taken her across the world on tours, films with Toby Maguire and Ed Zwick, and TV shows on HBO and Discovery. She is currently collaborating with Universal Music Group writers to create a full-length album centered on Frida Kahlo’s life— a woman with a mission to redefine boundaries placed on race and  gender, just like Alma Grace.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><h3>Since 2013 Danielle Espinoza better known as her stage name “Welfair”, is a multi faceted solo artist. She has manipulated the word to actualize her version of well being, and a “do you“ mentality. Welfair is a thoughtful mixture of R&amp
column2:
B, Funk, and Soul. She is heavily inspired by 60’s/70’s retro glam, her Mexican American culture, and the sounds of her childhood. As of January 5th, 2020 her record is out on all digital music streaming platforms!

Welfair kicked off 2020 with her very successful record release show celebrating her third record titled “Recreational”.  Welfair wishes to tangibly share her record with you all, and  to hold her own music in her hands for the first time on vinyl. Unfortunately, having vinyl pressed is prohibitively expensive. Not only will a milestone be reached in her music career, but with your support her dream can become a reality!

There are many perks offered to the supporters of her campaign, including shirts, pressings of  “Recreational” on vinyl, vocal lessons via Skype, and even a Welfair performance!

Any donation big or small goes a long way! If you cannot donate monetarily but still wish to help, please share this campaign and help spread the word!

Hello from Estonia!
We are three young guys from Estonia with a dream to help people to succeed using their talents.

As living in a such small country like Estonia, possibilities to become ""someone"" are rather limited. Thanks to a lot of hard work - having experienced a bit of this limited success we believe to know the right direction to grow even bigger and take as many talented people with us as possible.

Our tool for this is a dance studio. A place where youngsters have the environment to develop their skills to become a professional whether they are dancers, musicians, visual artists or who knows, maybe even magicians.

The goal of this campaign is to relieve our financial situation but mostly to create more efficient skill-development conditions in the studio. Also to become financially self-managing so our current situation (explained in the video) never happens again.

To make things even more clear: You helping this campaign can really make a difference in the future of the youth community in our area. Who knows - maybe one day You will enjoy a show or a movie by one of those young people.
<div>
Investment strategy
<div>
<ul>
• 1/3 of the funding will be used to pay for the rent of our studio rooms.
• 5% or 10%, regarding of reaching our goal or not, will be refunded to other projects on Indiegogo.
<div>
And this is the rest of the investment plan:
<ul>
• Crash mats FALCO 200x100x5cm - 10pc x 116$ = 1160$
• Epson WorkForce 545 All-in-One Printer – 138$
• STAGG SMS12DP700, 12"" Digital active speakers – 338$ x 2 = 676$
• Wall attachments for speakers STAGG SPH15BK (2tk) – 68$ x 2 = 136$
• Hot air pump - 1202$ x 2 = 2204$
• Green Screen + lighting – 445$
• Canon EOS 5D Mark II camera- 2161$
• Canon EF 24-70mm lens - 1432$
• Mirrors for dancers - 341$
• Dressing room closets - 180$
• Benches for dressing rooms - 126$
• Footwear stand in the lobby - 42$
• Beanbags for the waiting room - 14$ x 5 = 70$
• For painting all the walls - 842$
• Powermove safety rope - 190$
• Wall-mounted barres - 300$
• Beatbox microphone - 221$
• Art class equipment - 442$
And now! Check out the awesome perks that are waiting for You!
<div>
We will survive! (8)
If the situation is so critical then why do we still have faith in the second year?
Some reasons:
<ul>
• Last year we started in november. This year we start at the same time with all the other studios, which is extremely important
• Speaking of dance studios in general, we have accomplished remarkably much for the first year of a new dance studio. Because of that people already know us and have trust and faith in us.
• From the second year, we will have citys financial support.
• We already have a year full of experience.
• We have lot’s of new ideas that would take our studio to the next level and those we could accomplish with your help only.
If You like what we have done so far – then You can give us the opportunity to create even more opportunities for even more people. You can make a difference even from the other side of the world!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
You can also help by sharing this campaign - it will help more than one could imagine. Ask Your friends what they think about this campaign, make a post on Facebook or even e-mail Your grandmother

We're Primal Instinct(Karlstad, Sweden) and two years after the release of our debut album 'Terrified' we're about to release our sophmore album Devastation.

Devastation is packed with 11 tracks branding Primal Instincts signature mix of Modern Metal and Hard Rock only this time it's both heavier and more musically diverse.

It's recorded, mixed and mastered by Kristofer Strandberg at ES Music Karlstad featuring artwork by Lukasz Jaszak.

It will be unleashed upon the world on the 27:th of November.

Digital version of the album is included in all purchases!


Tracklist:

1. Tungt Vatten
2. Method To Madness
3. Crossroads
4. The Mask
5. Barcode
6. Tarantism (Feat. Andrew Johansson)
7. I Stand Alone
8. Stay Quiet
9. Jackalopes
10. Parental Advisory
11. The Torch

It's going to kick fucking ass, and of course we want you to enjoy it on Vinyl.

This GoFundMe is your way to Pre-Order Devastation in a Limited Vinyl Edition, along with additional goodies of your choosing.

The Rabbit's gonna get you all.
/Primal Instinct

Tungt Vatten2. Method To Madness3. Crossroads4. The Mask5. Barcode6. Tarantism (Feat. Andrew Johansson)7. I Stand Alone8. Stay Quiet9. Jackalopes10. Parental Advisory11. What are we playing?

• The expressive, ornamented music of Bach’s sons is comparatively little known to modern day listeners, who are more familiar with the father’s austere counterpoint. Tragically even lesser known are the virtuoso compositions of their talented colleagues also working for Prussian king Frederick the Great - Graun, Janitsch, and Benda. Their chamber music thrilled audiences both at court and in the private salons of eighteenth-century Berlin. We hope to bring this tradition out of the obscurity in which it has been undeservedly shrouded for the past two and a half centuries. The six trios and obbligato sonatas included in this project – by Johann Gottlieb Graun, Johann Gottlieb Janitsch, Franz Benda, Carl Philipp Emanuel Bach, Wilhelm Friedemann Bach, and father J.S. Bach – straddle the transition between the Baroque and Classical styles.
<li>

Where is it from? These pieces were once part of an important collection of music manuscripts gathered by Sara Levy. Notable for being a Jewish female musician and patron in Berlin during the late eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries, she took keyboard lessons with W.F. Bach and was the great-aunt of composer Felix Mendelssohn. Sara Levy hosted a musical salon in her home, where amateur and professional musicians gathered regularly to play from her collection, some of which she may have commissioned.
Why is this recording important?
<li>

Three of our selections remain unpublished, and none has been recorded in the forms that we plan to present. All will be performed in historically informed manner on period style instruments in new editions created especially for this recording together with new cadenzas and keyboard parts realized according to the practices of the period. Particularly intriguing is a reconstruction of a work revealed by recent scholarship to be probably a joint effort of J.S. and C.P.E. Bach. We are excited to have the opportunity to bring this music to light, and you play a big role in making this possible!
<li>

Viola: This music is particularly unique for its instrumentation, including some of the first music that places the viola on an equal footing with the violin. Sara Levy's collection is impressive for its wealth of good viola parts, and W.F. Bach might have adapted two of the Graun sonatas for her to play with her brother, thought to have been a violist.The Franz Benda sonata is one of the first viola sonatas ever written.
How can you help?
<li>

Indiegogo contribution: Your contribution means a lot to us, whether you can spare just a few dollars, or more. Your donation will go directly toward hiring the studio and engineer and harpsichord ($6000). Not all of the musicians are currently Boston locals, and will be gathering from as far as Los Angeles, Paris, and Copenhagen. They have donated their rehearsal time and travel expenses. If excess is raised, it will help reimburse the musicians for travel and accommodation.
<li>
Host a musician: If you are interested in hosting one of us as a home stay for a few days in June in lieu of a financial contribution, please get in touch!
<li>
Spread the word: We value your assistance in spreading the word by sharing our campaign on social media.
Who are the artists?
• Augusta McKay Lodge, violin
• Georgina McKay Lodge, viola
• Eva Lymenstull, cello
• David Schulenberg, harpsichord

Augusta McKay Lodge is an international prize-winning baroque violinist based in New York and Paris. Her solo album released by Naxos, Beyond Bach and Vivaldi, was named one of the top 20 albums of 2018 by WQXR and was under consideration for the Grammy nominations. Ms. McKay Lodge gave her solo debut in Carnegie Hall. She has had concerto appearances in Lincoln Center’s Alice Tully hall, and with Indianapolis Baroque Orchestra, and featured solos as concertmaster of Juilliard415. She is a member of Les Arts Florissants, Le Poème Harmonique, and Opéra Fuoco, and has been acting concertmaster of The American Classical Orchestra in their 2018-19 season. Most recently she performed Handel Violin Sonatas with William Christie.

www.augustamckaylodge.com

Georgina McKay Lodge has performed with leading Danish early music ensembles Camerata Øresund and Copenhagen Soloists on viola and violin, as well as with the Porto Orquestra Barroca Casa da Música, and in the USA with period orchestra Grand Harmonie, The Berry Collective at Boston Early Music Festival, at Oregon Bach Festival, and alongside musicians of Tafelmusik, Voyage Sonique, Concerto Copenhagen, the Cleveland Orchestra, and the Juilliard School. She will perform in the 2019-20 season with Holland Baroque as a Samama fellow. Ms. McKay Lodge serves on the Emerging Professional Leadership Council for Early Music America. She won the Best Bach award at the Ohio Viola Society Competition. She currently lives in Copenhagen.

www.georginamckaylodge.com

Eva Lymenstull has appeared as baroque cellist and violist da gamba with the Orchestra of the Age of Enlightenment, Holland Baroque Society, and the Orpheon Consort, as guest principal cellist of Atlanta Baroque Orchestra, Lyra Baroque Orchestra, and Apollo’s Fire, and as principal cellist of Symphonie Atlantique. She has performed at the Utrecht, Boston, and Berkeley Early Music Fringe Festivals, and on New York’s Gotham Early Music series. As winner of the 2017 Voices of Music Bach Competition, Ms. Lymenstull recorded Bach’s D minor cello suite. Upcoming season highlights include a CPE Bach cello concerto with the CWRU baroque orchestra and a recording with Lyra Baroque Orchestra. Ms. Lymenstull received a master’s degree in baroque cello from the Royal Conservatory of The Hague, and holds degrees from Rice University and University of Michigan.

www.evalymenstull.com

David Schulenberg is recognized internationally as both a performer on early keyboard instruments and an authority on the music of the Bach family. Author of books and articles on the music of J.S. Bach and his sons, he also wrote the textbook and anthology Music of the Baroque and has held fellowships from the National Endowment for the Humanities and the Japan Society for the Promotion of Science. In addition, he has published critical editions of sonatas and concertos by C.P.E. Bach as well as organ music by J. S. Bach. Previous recordings include chamber music of C.P.E. Bach, Quantz, and King Frederick “the Great.” Professor of music at Wagner College in New York, he has also taught at Boston University, Rutgers University, Columbia University, and the Juilliard School.

http://faculty.wagner.edu/david-schulenberg/

 

Thank you!

The Project...

I have been working on this record for the last two+ years and it is now at the final stages of completion.  My name is Ricardo Lopez-Aguilar, and I wanted to make an album about my expriences at the end of my marriage, and of the personal struggle and growth that came after that.  I wanted it to be positive.  I wanted to find a path to forgiveness and acceptance.  That path was through the 10 songs on the record.
With your help, Oldfolks Home can release the most uplifting and happiest divorce album!

I should say that a donation of any amount, you will be mentioned in the thank you video for the album.  It would be impractical to list all the names on the record, so I will make a video where the world will hear of you and your generosity!
<div>
Break It Down Now...
The album is so close now.  Most of everything has been recorded, and the funds raised through this campaign will go towards
<ul>
• A bit more recording
• Mixing in a local Winnipeg studio with a local mixing engineer
• Mastering the finished mixes, also through our local talent
• The reproduction of the album to CDs and Vinyls to sell at our shows
• And, if there is anything left over, to promoting the record (publicists, mail-outs, print and radio promo, etc.)
<div>
You Are So Beautiful...

...to me!  For helping me achieve a goal.  As an artist, I primarily find the support I need for my art in myself.  This can be very diffucult sometimes.  I beleive in community, and that is why I am asking my community to help me finish this project.  I think this world needs a positive view on the issue of divorce.  So many people can relate!  And just because it was a very difficult thing, it doesn't have to be seen in a negative way.
This record is my way of saying, ""Hey there, person.  Through patience and understading towards yourself and your new life, you can move past this in a positive and constructive way"".
Help me say this to people.
<div>
In Tough Times...

I know it isn't possible for all of you to give your finacial support to this record, and that is totally ok.  If you would like to help though, please post a link to this fund raising effort on all your various social media pages.  Let people know about it!
If I get the chance to meet you and you helped me out with this, I will give you massive hug.  If that's ok with you.  I give great hugs.
About Oldfolks Home...

In 2010, mere days before departing for a Canadian tour, Ricardo Lopez-Aguilar’s marriage fell apart. At the time, I was the other half of his musical outlet Oldfolks Home, and saw firsthand how this shattered his world. I was right to expect that this would spell the end of our imminent touring, but what I couldn’t know is that this event was about to trigger the start of the most insightful, self-aware, and honest divorce album I have ever come across: Black and Blue.

The album's opening lyric, “Lately I feel like I want to kill / and I’m trying so hard to say something right” gives the listener a front row seat to the post-traumatic stress Lopez-Aguilar experiences as he tries to come to terms with his current situation. While some of Black and Blue’s most telling moments come on stand-out track (and letter to ex-wife Kerri) ‘It Scares Me’, Oldfolks Home is at his best on the heartbreaking ‘Sleeper’ where the lasting effects of the dissolution become clear to him “You know there’s no going back on this / it’s permanent…”

I wondered about Lopez-Aguilar’s thoughts on Black and Blue’s potential to be summed up as just another break-up album. “I’ve been told that I may become known as the Taylor Swift of indie rock,” he joked. “But this isn’t an album about placing blame, or gaining sympathy, or saving face. This is the product of allowing myself to grow out of my darkest moments, while patiently waiting for the good to come through.”

Oldfolks Home, who is no stranger to festivals like the Halifax Pop Explosion and Pop Montreal, looks forward to revamping what already is a highly reputable live show. “There were a few shows in the aftermath of 2010 where I didn’t have the courage to say much,” says Lopez-Aguilar. “I half-joked at the time that I would have been happy to prerecord all my stage banter.” 

So will he be able to turn this negative energy into a positive? “That’s an understatement. I have never felt more free to experiment in a live setting. While I’ve always been interested in a fusion of digital and acoustic, the live show is about to get far more… three-dimensional, so to speak.”

Oldfolks Home has a bright vision for his hometown of Winnipeg. Like several of his musical peers, it was important for him to write and record Black and Blue in Winnipeg, and wanted its elements to stay local. He recruited a cast of current and former hometown players such as Keri Latimer (Nathan), Michael P Falk (Les Jupes), and Shaun Gibson (The Details) to contribute, and, what might be Black and Blue’s most shocking twist, the album’s cover art and name are taken from a piece donated by Lopez-Aguilar’s Winnipegger ex-wife, Kerri-Lynn Reeves. 

There’s no doubt that many of the beautifully crafted tracks on this LP will find perfect homes on television and film soundtracks, and I can say with great certainty that if John Cusack’s character in High Fidelity could do a present-day “top 5 divorce albums” list, Oldfolks Home’s Black and Blue would easily earn top spot.

-Shaun Gibson, 2012.

It's A Long Way To Tipperary...
....but the heart of Gypsy Jazz is right there. Help Patrus to travel to his homeland and find the warm Irish welcome and wonderful Gypsy Jazz that's waiting for him.
<ul>

• Cloughtoberfest is Ireland's festival of Gypsy Jazz.  Now in our third year, we've worked hard to bring together some of the finest musicians from Ireland and around the world to promote this wonderful genre in our country.  Run by a small and very dedicated team of volunteers, Cloughtoberfest is full of Irish warmth and gypsy spirit.... and just like gypsies, we know how to create a feast on a tiny budget!

• Patrus KC is the chronicler of modern Gypsy Jazz, a true lover of the genre who is interested not only in the music, but in the people who create it... if you don't know about him, visit his website here.  He has interviewed the great masters and the new rising stars from Samois to New England, but he's never been to Ireland... even though it's his ancestral home!  Now, with a Gypsy Jazz festival to visit and a wealth of Irish bands to meet, he can't resist any longer, he just has to come home!  The trouble is, like we said, it's a long way.....

• Here at Cloughtoberfest, we've turned out our pockets and sold every last tin bucket to help to raise the money for Patrus' air fares, but we still need your help to make it happen.  If we cannot raise the extra money to pay for his travel, he won't be able to come, plain and simple. This is more than a wonderful homecoming journey for Patrus, it's a real opportunity to spread the word about the Irish Gypsy Jazz scene and get our musicians the attention they deserve.  We can't do it without you!

• Patrus has thousands of followers in the Gypsy Jazz scene right around the world. Bringing him home means that our Irish performers can be seen by that huge audience, and we can showcase the amazing talent and events we have going on from Donegal to Cork and all around Ireland.
<h2><span style=""line-height: 1.45em
<ul>
• Patrus' air fares cost hundreds of Euros.  Every cent you can contribute will help us to pay for his flights and accommodation.

• In return for your help, you can get some great rewards that are strictly for funders ONLY.. For just €10 you can access free downloads of Patrus' Cloughtoberfest videos, including interviews with the top Irish performers and some of our international stars.  For €15, you can secure your place at An Audience with Patrus.. our Sunday afternoon session of filming in the newly opened Thomas MacDonagh heritage centre.  Watch the interviews and performances live, and maybe even get yourself in the picture! There are only a small number of seats available for this exclusive session, and seats are reserved for funders only. For larger pledges, you can enjoy limited edition T-shirts, Irish craft beer tours and festival concert tickets... what are you waiting for!

• What if we don't reach our target?  Well, that's no way to think... let's do this!  We have opted for the smallest possible target, to make sure that we can reach it, but in reality we need more than that if possible, so let's beat that target!
Put Irish Gypsy Jazz On The Map!
What if you're as broke as we are?
That's OK, we understand.  But you can still help!
<ul>

• Spread the word about this campaign far and wide... share on social media, on forums, email your auntie or shout it through an alpenhorn from the top of your building... encourage everyone to make a pledge if they can.
• Don't forget to tell people about the festival too!  You can see all the details at www.cloughtoberfest.com
• Sharing is easy.. you can use the Indiegogo share tools just below our video :)

Here at Cloughtoberfest, we've turned out our pockets and sold every last tin bucket to help to raise the money for Patrus' air fares, but we still need your help to make it happen.  If we cannot raise the extra money to pay for his travel, he won't be able to come, plain and simple. This is more than a wonderful homecoming journey for Patrus, it's a real opportunity to spread the word about the Irish Gypsy Jazz scene and get our musicians the attention they deserve.  We can't do it without you!

Patrus has thousands of followers in the Gypsy Jazz scene right around the world. Bringing him home means that our Irish performers can be seen by that huge audience, and we can showcase the amazing talent and events we have going on from Donegal to Cork and all around Ireland.
How Can You Help?
Patrus' air fares cost hundreds of Euros.  Every cent you can contribute will help us to pay for his flights and accommodation.

In return for your help, you can get some great rewards that are strictly for funders ONLY.. For just €10 you can access free downloads of Patrus' Cloughtoberfest videos, including interviews with the top Irish performers and some of our international stars.  For €15, you can secure your place at An Audience with Patrus.. our Sunday afternoon session of filming in the newly opened Thomas MacDonagh heritage centre.  Watch the interviews and performances live, and maybe even get yourself in the picture! There are only a small number of seats available for this exclusive session, and seats are reserved for funders only. For larger pledges, you can enjoy limited edition T-shirts, Irish craft beer tours and festival concert tickets... what are you waiting for!

What if we don't reach our target?  Well, that's no way to think... let's do this!  We have opted for the smallest possible target, to make sure that we can reach it, but in reality we need more than that if possible, so let's beat that target!
Put Irish Gypsy Jazz On The Map!
What if you're as broke as we are?
That's OK, we understand.  But you can still help!

Spread the word about this campaign far and wide... share on social media, on forums, email your auntie or shout it through an alpenhorn from the top of your building... encourage everyone to make a pledge if they can.
Don't forget to tell people about the festival too!  You can see all the details at www.cloughtoberfest.com
Sharing is easy.. you can use the Indiegogo share tools just below our video :)",3.0,0,"1 Campaign
