Hey everyone!

My name is Zander and I make relatable story-based hip-hop music.  
Before I go into further detail about my campaign, there are two things I want to make clear:

• HOW 50% OF THE MONEY I RAISE IS BEING DIRECTLY GIVEN BACK TO YOU (MY SUPPORTERS) IN THE FORM OF PERKS/MERCHANDISE.  
    (ex. if you choose the $99 Saturn package, $50 goes towards my music and the rest is used to pay for the cost of the package itself)
    Please take a look to the right and read over some of the perks I am offering
column2: I tried to make these packages as affordable as I could possibly make them.  My goal is to raise $17,500 to finish recording my album and to produce my second music video.  ALL OF THE SONGS ON THE ALBUM ARE WRITTEN, they just need to be recorded.  I will accomplish this when I have reached the $35,000 threshold for my campaign.  If you are interested, there is a total budget breakdown right after this segment.

column1:
• BY GOING TO MY SELF-DESIGNED WEBSITE (www.zandertherapper.com) YOU CAN DOWNLOAD SEVEN HIGH QUALITY SONGS FOR FREE!
    You can also check out my finished music video.

I am trying to be as transparent as possible with all of you.  These are the costs of recording an album (which I do at a home studio, 1/3 the going industry rate), mastering those songs, and producing a high quality music video.
THAT IS ALL I'M TRYING TO DO! And that's directly where your money goes if you choose to support me.  Right back to the music.

Although it may be hard to believe, I have made it here completely as an independent artist.  None of this was handed to me.  Nobody approached me and offered their services, or had some concept they wanted executed.  It has been my vision from day one… But it has also been my bank account. 
Which brings me to where I am now…

As it currently stands, I am in a financial deadlock. I have spent all of the money I have (this is not an exaggeration, $20,000 and counting since the beginning) on the things I listed above.  And I did this because I want to show you the quality of my work before I ask for your support.  I want to show you my musical versatility: what finished songs sound like, what a finished music video looks like, what my brand is… I want you to understand who I am as an artist.  
And more importantly, I want you to listen to my music and share it with your friends and family.  

That's why all of my music can be downloaded in a high quality format for free. I believe that charging people for music is the wrong philosophy.  If a listener truly enjoys your music and relates to your songs, they will want to support you.  By building a connection with your fans, you create trust.  And I am taking the first step in this relationship by giving you everything I’ve created for free.  Any support you can return is hugely appreciated because I can’t finish my album alone.  I need your help.


SO WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
column2: >Today, I am absolutely stoked to release everything I've been working on: the video above (and the 3 songs from the album that accompany it), the ""Perfect"" music video, the ""Who's Up Next?"" 5-track EP, two bonus songs from the album, the album art, the website (
column4: >), the merchandise (CDs, Posters, T-Shirts, Sweatshirts) and a lot more!

In closing, I would like to thank you again for your support and encourage you to share my campaign and my music if you like it!  
I am very excited to get working on the album.  

Yours Truly,

Let's face it.

We love putting out records. Records are expensive and the bands spend more time and money than you can imagine writing, recording and exploring options in making their labour of love available to those looking for something new, and their devoted fans waiting for more. Unfortunately, these songs don't always make it to a physical format for everlasting enjoyment.

This record is recorded and currently being pressed and funded by The Prozacs, Darlington and Jerk Off Records. There is still much costs involved in completing the project. We want to see this thru and have started an IndieGoGo campaign to help off-set our upfront costs (remember, we are hardworking musicians...working normal jobs to support ourselves and families) and give our fans an opportunity to get some cool stuff with a pre-order of the record and help us move it along.

You Love The Prozacs. Jay Rules. Their music is killer. They have been one of the harder working punk rock bands in the underground over the last decade and a half. You can always add more Prozacs vinyl to your already-awesome vinyl collection! 
You Love Darlington...or, you secretly love Darlington but pretend not to because it's not cool with the ""in"" punk crowd and have a stash of Darlingtons 20 years of pop punk vinyl anyway!
Any way you slice it, You want this new 7 inch limited-run vinyl EP that Jerkoff Records is releasing in late February. It's got two songs from The Prozacs and two from Darlington. There's extremely limited pressing of 300 colour vinyl copies, with 3 different variants. This indiegogo campaign is the only way to get your hands on an uber-rare test pressing version of the record...as well as the multi-color packages...as the bands will be receiving a limited amount to sell.
You'll be bragging on your instagram posts to no end with one of these sweet slabs of punk vinyl. Plus, you'll get stickers, guitar picks, other goodies to boot!
So let's face it. You spent way more on that overpriced swill from the bar at the last Masked Intruder show than you will on this sweet EP. And this won't give you a bad hangover.
Thanks for your support!

Join AKNU EP Campaign  


We AKNU were fortunate enough to be on The X Factor USA which gave us an opportunity to present a style that hasn't been seen by the industry for some time now.  This classic style that Demi Lavato called ""special"", Kelly Rolland called ""refreshing"",  and Simon Cowell called ""the new Motown"" has blessed us to be featured on MTV and in Vogue Italia, Ebony, and Vanity Fair, among many others.  With so much love coming from our wonderful fans we have been inspired to independently release our first EP.  


A major record label would be spending well over a million bucks to produce, mass market and promote music like this. From our experiences we have learned that since it is their money, they would want to control the look, sound and direction of our music. That's why we're reaching out to you guys to get backing so that together we can bring back the spirit that made music great through promotion, marketing, mastering and aiding us in a tour that will empower us to come see you.
column2:
>April  29th 2014 AKNU Debut EP Drops

Where will the money go?

column1: • Marketing
• Promotion
• Production
• Mastering
• Distribution
• Advertisement
• Videos
• Staff
Some of our rewards!!
• Signed Physical copies of the AKNU EP
• Signed T shirts by all 3 AKNU Members
• Appear in a AKNU's Music Video
• Social Media shout out
• Live video chats
• Private show at your house and or venue
• Primier tickets
• Hang out with AKNU on set
• Go on the red carpet with AKNU
• Personal Song to you
• And many more !

column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">


If we are blessed enough to surpass  our goal of $100,000 the additional funds will go towards making more songs, more live shows, music videos and visuals merchandise and packaging!! The more money we raise the more content we can get to you guys!!!


Funding Goals

column1: • If we reach $250,000 we will be able to release a  full length album as well as put on a extended tour in more locations.
• If we reach $500,000 we will be able to release a  full length album as well as put on a extended tour in more locations, more music videos, full scale release of album.

Here's To Waking Up The Sun: The Greatest Impact with this Campaign 

Everyday we work hard to perfect our show so that we can grant people in experience of a life time. Through music we believe we can promote a clean positive life in a energetic fun way. These times desperately need more artist that actually care about the well being of their listeners. Here's to  us working together to bring back the spirit that made music great.


In Between Ballin 

If you are not able to purchase a perk, the next best thing is to share our campaign via e-mail and through your social media networks. Help us get the word out so that we can create music to inspire, music to spread hope and music that provokes change through love and compassion.

Jen Taylor
My name is Jen Taylor.  Help birth my whimsical &
I have just finished recording Pretty Fast Golden Dirtbike and am excited to put this work out into the world.

The album examines the dualistic nature of human thought and delivers a veritable theogony of Goddesses and ancient bad girls from the Egyptian Hathor to modern day Xena Warrior Princess.   My focus is on re-wilding and the modern-ancient soul.

In Tomatoes Cry Ripe, cracked tomatoes covered by ants in the garden are pushed to an analysis of sex work.  From the enigmatic Thinking in Pictures to the call to arms that Spare Wings is, the album takes you on a journey from coyote trickster energy to Penthesilea’s last stand at Troy.
The album features myself on ukulele, vocals, guitar &
column2: keyboard, Justin Vood Good on gypsy jazz guitar, Hans Lohse on percussion &amp
column3: accordion, Chris Brown on acoustic bass.

column1: I am a singer/songwriter and Artistic Director of Om-FLY (an aerial, yoga &
column3: performance troupe).  I also serve as Executive Director of The Sanctuary at Shepardfields (a solar-powered 501c-3).

column1: What Pretty Fast Golden Dirtbike Needs
The final phase entails mastering ($700) and manufacturing the cd's, labels and 4 panel eco-wallets ($1200).
You will receive a copy of the album and other special things depending on your donation level.
If Pretty Fast Golden Dirtbike does not meet its goal, the money will still go towards production of the album and I will supply the rest of the funds for completion.
The Impact

PFGD will help facilitate the undoing of the forces of patriarchal insanity and the retrieval of goddess-consciousness - the birthright of humanity.   It will make, um, misogynists and perpetrators pull their shirts over their faces and stumble away in terror.  And it will make little girls trust their hearts.  It will make you want to sing.   And possibly stand on your head.  Or hands.
What would Xena do?
","Jen Taylor
My name is Jen Taylor.  Help birth my whimsical & dark odes to the goddess.
I have just finished recording Pretty Fast Golden Dirtbike and am excited to put this work out into the world.

The album examines the dualistic nature of human thought and delivers a veritable theogony of Goddesses and ancient bad girls from the Egyptian Hathor to modern day Xena Warrior Princess.   My focus is on re-wilding and the modern-ancient soul.

In Tomatoes Cry Ripe, cracked tomatoes covered by ants in the garden are pushed to an analysis of sex work.  From the enigmatic Thinking in Pictures to the call to arms that Spare Wings is, the album takes you on a journey from coyote trickster energy to Penthesilea’s last stand at Troy.
The album features myself on ukulele, vocals, guitar & keyboard, Justin Vood Good on gypsy jazz guitar, Hans Lohse on percussion & accordion, Chris Brown on acoustic bass.

I am a singer/songwriter and Artistic Director of Om-FLY (an aerial, yoga & partner acrobatics teaching & performance troupe).  I also serve as Executive Director of The Sanctuary at Shepardfields (a solar-powered 501c-3).

Four Femmes on the Thames Music Video

Hello, we are the Four Femmes on the Thames and we are in the process of filming our first music video to our original song, Taken Up The Shard.

We are a comedy jazz band and we have been together for the last three years. Our song has aired live on BBC London radio and will be played on Ronnie Scotts radio in the near future.

You can listen here:

https://soundcloud.com/fourfemmesonthethames/taken-up-the-shard-cleanedit1

We have teamed up with some very talented, like-minded professionals to bring our song to life!

What We Need 

Filming is expensive.

The money will be used towards:
• Our £500 Venue
• Camera equipment (hiring cameras, lenses, dollies etc..)
• Paying our director
• Flying our cameraman in from Prague
• Post - production
• Feeding our lovely extras!

We hope the video will help build the Four Femmes' profile and put a smile on people's faces!

Colin Boland's Album!

Hello Friends,

  I know there is lots out there on the interweb, and limited minutes in a day, so thank you for making it this far. 

You could help me out heaps with my musical project and passion with just a few more minutes.

I have been writing songs and performing since I was a wee one.  For friends and families, professional gigs, or backyard parties and campfires. I love every second of it.  My first recording was on my 18th birthday, oh it seems so long ago.  Now, a decade later, I am finishing up a full length studio recording with nine original songs.

Why this campaign?

• I am working on a sailboat in Europe at the moment so it would be hard for me to get the album into the hands of all my friends back home.  With this campaign, people can support the project and get the music wherever they are, or I am, in the world.
• This has been a self funded project up to now.  Though the prices of the studio and supporting musicians have been very fair considering the experience and amazing talent, the cost does add up.

So Im looking to you to help me out with the cost of the mastering and manufacturing of the CDs, and the launching of the CD.

The mastering is the final step of the recording process.  Its where they make the final copy of the music that all other copies will be made from.  It takes critical ears and some computer wizardry.  I am having a very experienced and nice fellow Corwin Fox do the mastering for me. 

The manufacturing of the CD's is where I send the master and the album art to some nice folks who put it all together to make that nice little wrapped up package of music to be sent to your door.

If this campaign is succesfull it will also fund the launch of the CD.  This includes me publishing it online and sending it to radio stations across Canada.  

If people get the music in their hands then it means all the hard work that went into making the album will come to fruition.  People will get to hear the songs, and that is what it is all about! 

Money...its a gas....
Ok so now lets talk money.
It works this way
you help me out, I send you cool stuff!
I tell you a bit about where the money is going to go:
Mastering:  approx.
Manufacturing 1000 CD’s: approx. 1500$
Album design and art: 300$

CD baby, website domain, mailing to radio stations: approx. 200$

People who help out with this project could get signed copies of the CD, postcards from my sailing travels, hand made sailor paraphernalia, and even a custom scrap books with photos and stories from the recording project.  Not only that but the satisfaction that they are supporting independent original music!  

The Splash
Supporting independent music is a fun thing to do!  With your help I can get my music out on the
airwaves and into your ears.
I have had
so much fun creating these songs and making this album.  I hope you can have fun listening to the
music.  Let’s make this project
happen.  Help if you can, and if you can’t
make a contribution, just try and spread the word and that would mean the world

to me.

column2:
>UPDATE: March 30, 2014

GREAT NEWS!  INDIEGOGO HAS EXTENDED OUR CAMPAIGN!

This is huge. We are currently #9 on the all-time list of music projects on Indiegogo...so because the campaign has done so well they decided to extend our campaign by two weeks!

This means more people will have access to the limited merch, music and experiences we are offering as a part of this project.  

So, we are adding new perk pre-orders because several have sold out. If you haven't already, you can join us now.  We just added a CD/shirt perk and a CD/Hoodie perk.  

And stay tuned, because we will be adding many more exciting perks, contests, and more in the next few days...

The excitement continues to build for our 9th studio album...as we write, write, write.
column3:
>UPDATE: March 24, 2014

We have hit our 60,000.00 video goal!!!   Thanks so much to everyone who has gotten on board with these preorder perks.  Now we have just a few days of MADNESS left! We have launched brand new perks and they are selling out!  Get one of the last few deluxe packages with signed drumsticks, and pick song for our live show with the VIP album release show perk. And we still have ONE LAST LIVE SHOW ANYWHERE is the USA perk.  Remember: The Signed vinyl and cds, along with the tshirt and hoodie are ONLY AVAILABLE in this campaign.  Don't miss out...

We love you...
column5:
>WE HAVE HIT OUR INITIAL GOAL OF $50,000.00 AND THE NEW P86 RECORD IS NOW AN OFFICIAL REALITY!

We want to say a very special thanks to all of you

column1: who have joined us in making the new P86 album a reality. As of today, we have
hit our initial funding goal of $50,000.00!! P86 definitely has the best
fans a band could ask for!
We are sending a powerful message to all in this industry...that P86, and our

fans, are connected in something special via this campaign.

As many of you know, we have been hard at work writing songs and preparing to enter the studio a little later this year.  This is where the fun begins!
<span>And we still have 3 weeks of our campaign left...so
with nearly 900 backers so far we hope some of you who still haven't had the
chance to jump on board will want to now. We would love to film a new music
video before the record releases to go with our first single or do some very
special record release shows around the country. We can do this if we raise

more funds.

So we have set a NEW GOAL: $60,000.00

When we hit this mark we will deliver an
official music video prior to the release of the new album.
AND TO SWEETEN THE DEAL WE HAVE CREATED A NEW PERK WHICH INCLUDES AN EXCLUSIVE
HOODIE.  Only 100 of these bad boys will be made, and only backers will
have access.  In addition, we have opened up a very LIMITED QUANTITY of

our perks which have already sold out.

We are not done yet...let's make some history together, everyone.

Meanwhile we will keep writing and writing...

**********************************************************************************************

an incredible experience from start to finish.  

Our direct partnership
with you allowed us to make the record we always dreamed of making.  The
songwriting process was groundbreaking for us, as a brand new energy was
breathed into this band. The recording environment was incredibly satisfying,
and we were able to collaborate with many of our long-time friends and
peers-from Brian ""Head"" Welch of Korn/Love and Death, to Bruce
Fitzhugh of Living Sacrifice, to Blake Martin of a Plea for Purging.  The
reception to the album was amazing to witness.  Crowds at our shows
swelled and both fans and critics alike gave the album rave reviews. <i>Wait
For the Siren garnered multiple #1 singles, including the smash-hit
Fall, Goliath, Fall,""-a song that delivered one of our most
high-profile placements in the history of the band, as the basis for Jim
Nantz's monologue during primetime of the opening rounds of the NCAA Basketball
tournament.
We are truly proud of
all that was accomplished...
So, we are more than excited to announce we are
writing a new album as we speak. And we are upping the ante this time in every
way.  If Wait for the Siren proved anything to us, it is that the
sky is the limit...
We learned a lot from our last project, and though we
raised nearly $40,000.00 to produce the album, create artwork, press cd's,
vinyl, print books, t-shirts, and mail everyone their orders worldwide, it was
necessary for us to spend more than what we raised.  In addition to
producing the album/fulfilling your packages, we spent additional funds on
publicity, marketing (including a music video), and a distribution team.
Because we want to not only deliver the best album possible but do it on the
best level possible we set our goal for this project at $50,000.00.
And there's more: Perhaps our favorite part of this
last album cycle was our VIP acoustic performances.  These sets were
special because they presented the songs in a more personal way.  So we
will be recording four original, ""unplugged"" songs, in addition to
the P86 album.
We have put together
some great incentives that are meant to allow you to be a part of this project
as much as possible
column2: The greater your backing, the closer you will be to the

column1: process of making this record.
And as an added incentive, every backer of $40 and
above will receive a digital copy of Andrew Schwab's first single from his
brand new solo project (title TBA).  You will be the first to hear this
new music, as it will not be released to the public until later in the spring.
You will receive the song as a special thank you for backing (again, $40
and above), as soon as the funding period of this project ends.
So, it's time
for YOU friends of P86, to partner with us like never before.
Join us in making another special P86 <span style=""line-height: 1.45em
for being an integral part of this new project.

So our story begins

• Saul is a 3 piece Progressive/Alternative Metal group pushing raw emotions to the Coasts from the heart of the Midwest. With just releasing their most up-to-date record ""The Touching of Parallels"" in early 2014, Saul needs help to pick up the pieces again. Saul is progressing forward everyday gaining more and more experience, and exposure.

• We have been very loyal and passionate with the progression of who we are as individuals, and how our group has formed into what it is today. Saul asks for your 100% attention, hearts, and help once again. As many of you have heard, Saul's van was pronounced dead on January 20th of 2014. Zach - ""I vividly remember rolling into Burley, ID with no sign of optimism to be found. I knew after that last mountain pass through the Rockies I had pushed our motor to the limit. Almost like a protective mother with her first born child...you just know.""
• Saul's goal as a group is to bring happiness to your lives, as well as ours. All three of us enjoy every minute of everyday with music, and bringing joy to others.

• With your contributions Saul will be able to start touring again! This is our ultimate goal to get us to the next level. It will be a dream come true to spread our hard work, and dedication to unfamiliar people nationwide!
How We Both Benefit
<li>Gas,
food, and lodging become very expensive, and become very stressful if
finances are not set. With every penny we receive you can assure Saul
will put it to good use on the road. Saul is looking into a good and
safe 6'x12' enclosed cargo trailer to haul our gear. Safety from one
show to another show is crucial, so safe and reliable transportation is
worth the investment.
<li>We have very well thought out perks
for you. We want to give you the world for all the support we receive.
Saul has a lot of memorabilia on this campaign and we hope you enjoy
them as much as we did when we owned them. Saul has custom and limited
edition items only provided for this campaign, and we hope you enjoy all
the energy we exert into it!
<li>If Saul doesn't reach the
minimum amount requested you can be sure that your perks will still be
sent to you on time. We will use the collected funds to purchase the
trailer, and the rest will go into savings for when the tour starts
forming.
The Impact
<li>All 3 of us members were raised on hard work, dedication, creative,
and the need to strive for something better in life. What us 3 in Saul
are trying to achieve is a life long career, and with that we need you!
Saul is one step closer to impacting others lives, with inspiration
around every corner.
<li>With ""The Touching of Parallels""
freshly released, we need to get back out on the road, and promote it
correctly. ""Motives"" is the first single off of the new record, with our
re-make of Pink Floyd's ""Welcome to the Machine"" to follow after. TTOP
is a 5 song, intricate ep that all 3 of us left a life long impression
on.
<li>Saul appreciates all the support we get, and will get in
the future. We belong on the road, and we hope you feel the same way.
The finances we receive from this campaign will help in so many ways,
and positively impact thousands of lives. For us it's not all about the
money, we are musicians, and care about our craft. Unfortunately the
world forces our industry to strive on high dollar costs. We love and
appreciate everything you do as a person, and as a fan. -Rise As Equals-
Other Ways You Can Help

• We completely understand if you can't financially help. That is not a big deal, we would still love the support. How? Please help Saul promote this campaign to everyone. Family, friends, co-workers, please share this on your facebook, twitter, website, ect. Remember word of mouth is still the best form of spreading the word!
• There are ""sharing"" tools right from this page, feel free to promote this as much as you physically can. All the support is welcome in all the ways you can get it done!

Thank you for all the love and support! We will get to meet every single one of you one day, and hopefully sooner than later.

Blake Bedsaul, Zach Bedsaul, Adam Chilton

-Saul-

Stella Polaris is a free, non-profit daytime event with no VIP area, no gates and no queues making Stella Polaris free from the organised chaos that now characterises the 21st century festival.

Most likely now the worlds largest chill out event with more than 100.000 guests in the magnificent sprawling gardens of the Royal Parks in Denmark, and set
amongst stunning natural surroundings
that include<b> banks of tress and
sprawling greens, Stella Polaris
is for those who are looking for something special. Whether you come to get

horizontal or dance beneath the trees, this event is a unique experience.

As you of course already is fully aware of – Stella Polaris is a free event, so who should pay for it all…the stage, the sound system, the artists, the toilets etc?

Beside the natural struggle with running a free event, we also would like to further develop our festival. Just to illustrate what we have in the pipeline, if we had more funding we have listed a few of our development projects that we hope you can help us realise through initiatives like this funding.

Invite more major artists

We have over the previous years attracted many major artist and had them play in completely new setups or just showcase live-shows in a great setting. We have greater ambitions and want to push the borders for what is possible in a setting like Stella Polaris.  

We take pride in keeping Stella Polaris free, but we still want to give you even better memories of great music enjoyed with great friends. 

The sky is the limit, but the climb to the sky is unfortunately not free.

Launching Stage 2

Stella Polaris wants to grow and create a new stage in Frederiksberg

Have Copenhagen at Mathildehojen. We attract big crowds, and it is our duty to use this platform as a scene for the vast amount of talent we have in Denmark. We want to present great new artists and thereby help the development of the electronic music scene in Denmark. We hope you will help us

make this dream come true.

Integrate other art forms

We want to make Stella Polaris a festival, not only for your ears but also for your eyes and include more visual art forms. We want to bring in great young artists to exploit the beautiful settings around the country. We want to reward these artists and create new possibilities for them to express themselves integrated with our chilled universe. We hope you'll help us do that!

This is just a few of the projects we currently work on, and we hope that you wish to contribute.

If you like us – then help us, by donating as much as you like us!! We need all the help we can get!!

Thank you!

Who the heck is Rani?!
column4: >I'm an unsigned, independent singer/songwriter/recording artist (girl, daughter, sister, friend, athlete, choco-holic :). Born and raised in a tiny down of Deep River, Ontario Canada, I've moved myself to western Europe to surround myself by the people who pioneered a key influence on my sound: Symphonic Rock. My parents are from Trinidad, my ancestors are from India and these influences have made me what I am
column5: a rather shy girl who loves rock but whose soul also gravitate towards a sound more ancient than recorded history.
column11: >Being an unsigned solo artist means every effort to paint my vision into sound requires years of saving, scrimping and forces me to make compromises on production in order to stay within my  means. Self-producing and arranging my first two albums has taught me more than I could imagine.
column14:
>rom people who are more experienced, whose creativity and passion exceed even my own. I've found a tremendous producer who believes in my vision - Joost Van Den Broek (After Forever, Epica, ReVamp, Mayan). This next step with him is a big one as we will discover together how to achieve my musical vision through production of a single. And to do that, to say at the end of the day that I did my best, I need the resources to engage the best producer, musicians, composers, engineers and collaborators.

Why would you care, why should you share?
column15:
>This project is about tackling one song, called ""NightShade"" at the moment, to carve out my true sound. Let's be honest, we don't know if this vision will make sense so in the end, better to invest in one song than to risk the resources needed to make a full album.

The initial budget for this single exceeds 3,000 euros but I'm hoping to crowd source just 2,500 of that. The balance needed to complete production will come from my own little pocket. Even if I don't reach my funding goal, believe me when I tell you, I am all in for taking this next step. This song will be produced, I promise.

ALL Funds raised will go to:

column1: <li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >Musician fees. Ruud Jolie (Within Temptation, MaidenUnited, For All We Know) will be handling guitar duty. But in a style like mine, beyond the usual band musicians who must also be fairly compensated for their skills and art (drums, bass etc) I'll need to work with an orchestral composer (and therefore an orchestra) and various musicians specializing in East Indian instruments (sitar, santoor, esraj, tabla, dhol/dholak, harmonium)

column1: <li><span style=""line-height: 1.45em
<li><span style=""line-height: 1.45em

The song will be a digital-release only so I needn't worry about the costs to press and print one song on disc.

What's in it for YOU!
column2:
>Individual contributors who donate 10 euros will receive:

  • a free, digital copy of the finished single

column1: • a free, digital copy of the finished single
• an 8""x10"" autographed photo (of moi)
Individual contributors who donate 100 euros will receive:
<ul>
• a free, digital copy of the finished single
<li><span style=""line-height: 1.45em
<li>
<b style=""line-height: 1.45em
column5: >to be used to announce the single. It will feature me, rendered in comic-book style by the great comic artist,
column7: >(DC comics, the Dark Knight, Birds of Prey). which is not at ALL egotistical...:) but in truth I offer it more as a cool piece of art by an amazing comic artist. and because it's of me and not a licensed character, no copyright violations! #score. See below for a rendering of me in this style.

column1: Every contributor will have my eternal gratitude for helping put within reach, the realization of a lifelong vision.
Let's rock the world!

I've self-produced two albums in the past and as a marketer (a girl's gotta have a day job in order to finance those past records!) rest assured that my effort to push forward doesn't stop with just this single. This business is hard work and will take all I have learned in school and outside of it to make good on the investment you have entrusted to me.
The outcome of this project will be to unleash a sound that no one has heard yet! Joost and I are pioneers and with your support, you become part of the history to be made!
Locking down my sound will open doors to making an album and give me a calling card with which to approach global markets to test the sound with those audiences.

I get shivers when I think about the potential my vision can have to impact the musical world. This is not the first step in my musical journey, but it is the beginning of something big. Can you feel it?
Support has many forms...

One of the most important affirmations for any artist is to be seen and heard. Please, with humility I ask you to share this campaign across all your social networks (both online and offline). My motivation to keep pushing against the odds has as much to do with the resources to produce as with having friends to support me by becoming part of my music world. - with most sincere thanks, Rani.

Self-producing and arranging my first two albums has taught me more than I could imagine. But I need more help from people who are more experienced, whose creativity and passion exceed even my own. I've found a tremendous producer who believes in my vision - Joost Van Den Broek (After Forever, Epica, ReVamp, Mayan). This next step with him is a big one as we will discover together how to achieve my musical vision through production of a single. And to do that, to say at the end of the day that I did my best, I need the resources to engage the best producer, musicians, composers, engineers and collaborators.Why would you care, why should you share?This project is about tackling one song, called ""NightShade"" at the moment, to carve out my true sound. Let's be honest, we don't know if this vision will make sense so in the end, better to invest in one song than to risk the resources needed to make a full album.The initial budget for this single exceeds 3,000 euros but I'm hoping to crowd source just 2,500 of that. The balance needed to complete production will come from my own little pocket. Even if I don't reach my funding goal, believe me when I tell you, I am all in for taking this next step. This song will be produced, I promise.ALL Funds raised will go to:

column1: Producer fees
Studio fees + engineer

Musician fees. Ruud Jolie (Within Temptation, MaidenUnited, For All We Know) will be handling guitar duty. But in a style like mine, beyond the usual band musicians who must also be fairly compensated for their skills and art (drums, bass etc) I'll need to work with an orchestral composer (and therefore an orchestra) and various musicians specializing in East Indian instruments (sitar, santoor, esraj, tabla, dhol/dholak, harmonium)
mixing/mastering
artwork & photography

The song will be a digital-release only so I needn't worry about the costs to press and print one song on disc.What's in it for YOU!Individual contributors who donate 10 euros will receive:a free, digital copy of the finished singleIndividual contributors who donate 50 euros will receive:
a free, digital copy of the finished single
an 8""x10"" autographed photo (of moi)
Individual contributors who donate 100 euros will receive:
a free, digital copy of the finished single
a cool Rani branded guitar pick

limited edition print poster (approx 11""x16"") to be used to announce the single. It will feature me, rendered in comic-book style by the great comic artist, Romano Molenaar (DC comics, the Dark Knight, Birds of Prey). which is not at ALL egotistical...:) but in truth I offer it more as a cool piece of art by an amazing comic artist. and because it's of me and not a licensed character, no copyright violations! #score. See below for a rendering of me in this style.
Every contributor will have my eternal gratitude for helping put within reach, the realization of a lifelong vision.
Let's rock the world!

I've self-produced two albums in the past and as a marketer (a girl's gotta have a day job in order to finance those past records!) rest assured that my effort to push forward doesn't stop with just this single. This business is hard work and will take all I have learned in school and outside of it to make good on the investment you have entrusted to me.
The outcome of this project will be to unleash a sound that no one has heard yet! Joost and I are pioneers and with your support, you become part of the history to be made!
Locking down my sound will open doors to making an album and give me a calling card with which to approach global markets to test the sound with those audiences.

I get shivers when I think about the potential my vision can have to impact the musical world. This is not the first step in my musical journey, but it is the beginning of something big. Can you feel it?
Support has many forms...

One of the most important affirmations for any artist is to be seen and heard. Please, with humility I ask you to share this campaign across all your social networks (both online and offline). My motivation to keep pushing against the odds has as much to do with the resources to produce as with having friends to support me by becoming part of my music world. - with most sincere thanks, Rani.",3.0,0,"3 Campaigns
|","Brussels, Belgium",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/nightshade-new-single-production/pica

The Goal:

I have been playing guitar for nearly 25 years now.  I specialize in many styles, but the instrumental acoustic pieces that I have written seem to touch the most people - across genre.  It is a relaxing, refreshing, and peaceful music.  Elders and youth all seem to appreciate it.

For the longest time, I have held off on recording much of it (and have held back on releasing what I have recorded).  The reason for this, besides the technicality and precision needed for the actual music itself, is that I want the sound quality to be superb.  It is acoustic music, and I want to hear the beauty and intimacy of the guitar and guitarist in a room. 

The common theme for home recording, and even professional recording studios, these days is one of recording in a room that has no natural reverberation, and adding a digital effect of it on later.  For this music, I need some good microphones, and a nice room (natural reverberation).  As it so happens, my best friend from high school has just built this room.

I am ready to record.

What I Need &
column2:
What You GetSo, I basically need to cover travel expenses (he lives in CT, I live in CA), and the cost of paying him.  After that, there is cd mastering, design and duplication, publishing, etc...  It's always costly. 

-Flying to CT and back will cost at least $500, probably more.  I have places to stay, so that isn't an issue.

-Matt Berky, the sound engineer and owner of Massive Productions Studio (http://massiveproductions.com), is highly professional, with many years and awards under his belt.  He is worth at least $2000 for this job.  Though, I know he is flexible if the fundraising doesn't reach the intended goal. 

-Mixing and mastering will be done by a separate engineer.    $2000

-CD design (including photos, art, and layout) easily reaches $500.

-CD duplication will take about $1000.

-I have an extra $1000 in the pitch for copyright registration, publishing, marketing, Indiegogo's percentage, and any unforeseen costs that pop up (there are always some)

If I don't meet my financial goal, my next moves will depend on what I do fundraise.  I will hopefully be able to fly out and record, and get to the cd duplication later.  If I don't make enough to do THAT, then I am fully committed to using the money to further any of my other myriad musical projects, or recording this music locally.  I have other recordings to get to.  Visit here for examples.  http://anandavmusic.com/

I am excited to offer many great rewards back to my contributors. Signed copies of the CD when released, personal guitar and composition lessons, house concerts, and VIP invites to the CD release concert are all in the mix.  Take a look for yourself!

A Musical Renaissance 

I have nothing but respect and curiosity for the music being made in this digital age.  Computers are changing our soundscapes daily.  A lot of it is fun, and highly artistic.  People are breaking new ground left and right.  But I do notice less and less interest in live musicianship, both in audiences and venue managers.  People want to dance, and managers want to make money. 

This isn't club music.  It is a deep expression of my commitment to creating something that slows people down and asks them to listen.  So many people are distracted these days - by smartphones and whatever else gives instant sensory gratification.  So, I want to use my art as an invitation for us all to get quieter, and pay close attention.  Deeply rewarding life experiences come from the sort of intimacy and presence I have developed with my guitar.  I can only hope that everyone can experience what is to truly deeply love something/someone in this way. 


Video shooting and Photography Credits: Chula Gemignani http://healingrivermassage.com/photography/


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

-Spread the word, if you'd like.  Email or post on Facebook.
-Share the links to my music, and the studio.

http://anandavmusic.com/
https://soundcloud.com/anandavaughan/letting-go
http://anandavaughan.bandcamp.com/album/in-our-center
http://massiveproductions.com/
http://healingrivermassage.com/photography/

No longer just a Dreamer: I'm recording an album.

A record of one completed turning of my life, the long road from disconnection-to-integration, the trials of discovering home, the mysterious gift of falling in love with the world, and the power that comes from becoming whole.

These songs are prayers and ramblings in alternate tunings, melodies sung from and into the dreaming land, and lyrics that have been sanded-down-to-the-heartwood. I hope you like 'em, they're from the Bigger Story and they're for you.

So many of you out in the world have been supporters, listeners, subjects of songs, dear friends, musical inspiration, collaborators, and teachers. For this I say a full-hearted thank you! And I ask for support one more time. To give these songs the treatment they deserve, to get them into your headphones and car speakers. For the first time, I'll be recording in a real live studio here in Durham, NC. I'd love your help to make that happen. And to finance the other aspects of album production, like creating album art, bringing in other musicians, mixing &
column2: mastering, and producing CDs. Recording will be happening this winter
column3:
expect the album by spring of 2017!

Until then, if you want to listen to some old tunes, stream or download from Bandcamp here.


What I Ask of You.

column1: Pre-order the album by donating through this page. (Only $8, folks!) Help me share this page with your friends and communities. Donate at any level you'd like. Give a bit more and score a sweet poster or tote bag, hand screen-printed by Lindsey Elcessor (check out her transfixing, magical creations on

her website here). Check out my Facebook Page, where news will be posted about this campaign, album progress, and shows I'm playing. 

And of course, you can simply help by holding me in your thoughts and humming along from afar.


In love, gratitude, hope, and most of all in song and poem,

tori

Hello!
My name is Mike Langlie and I have a toy piano band called Twink. I make a style of music called ""Toytronica"" – a mix of musical toys and electronic instruments.
The new Twink album ""Dust Bunny"" is a multi-color vinyl record with beautiful artwork by illustrator Kate O'Hara. I'm going all out to make this a special release and an
opportunity for fans to get something extra.

My goal is to raise $3,000 to cover the cost of pressing records. Every dollar helps, as does sharing this campaign with friends and on social media. If you're a fan of Twink or like artistic vinyl then I think you'll be excited to get this album.
Listen to the entire album at Bandcamp!
What you'll get as a contributor:
$1 – Thanks on the official Twink website to everyone who contributes.
$3 – Download a digital copy of the new album.
$12 – Download digital copies of all Twink albums. (11 albums total, see the FAQ section down below for details.)
$20 – Vinyl record of the new album, plus a CD version and downloads of all Twink albums.
$25 to $50 – Choose up to 6 Twink CDs (number based on
contribution level) plus the new vinyl record and CD, and downloads of
all Twink albums. See available CDs below.

$70 – A limited edition 7-inch lathe cut record with 4 bonus songs plus the new vinyl record and CD, all 6 Twink CDs, and downloads of all Twink albums. See details below. (Update: the lathe cut bonus records are sold out!)
$100 – A set of pling plong cards used to record a song on the album plus the new vinyl record and CD, bonus lathe cut record, all 6 Twink
CDs, and downloads of all Twink albums. See details below. (Update: the pling plong cards are sold out!)
CDs available for $25 to $50 level contributors:
You can hear all of these at Bandcamp.
Lathe cut record of 4 bonus songs:
A square plexiglass 7-inch record made with equipment nearly a century old. It plays on a regular turntable and sounds something like an antique record. You'll
also get digital downloads of the 4 exclusive songs. Check out the Lathe Cuts FAQ for information about how they're made and sound. (Update: lathe cut bonus records are SOLD OUT!)
Pling plong cards used for songs on the album:
The pling plong is a mechanical music box instrument played by

punching holes in paper cards and winding them through to trigger notes, like a mini player piano. Cards can be taped together to create full-length songs. I used the pling plong for 5 songs on the album, and all 5 sets of cards are available as perks. Each set is rubber stamped with the name of the song and comes in a nice envelope. (Update: pling plong cards are SOLD OUT!)
About the new album:
Listen to the entire album at Bandcamp!
Dust Bunny was inspired by New England’s long Winter of 2015 that buried the land as well as moods. How else to keep spirits up while sheltering in place than by making music?

The album opens with brittle toy piano patterns captured on a dodgy microcassette recorder. It’s joined by a melody played on an instrument called the pling plong through the use of hole-punched cards. Music box tones sparkle like ice crystals on “Emberglow,” “Thistle Bliss,” “Fox Tuft,” and “Whirl Wisp.”

A melancholic vibe winds through many of the songs but never extinguishes the hope that Spring will one day return. Bells, chimes, xylophones, and a collection of rusty toys add warm textures over chilly synths and cold mechanical beats. Darkness and light cycle like the seasons in songs such as “Salt Circle,” “Pipper Snitch,” and “Whale Speck.” A gentle thaw finally arrives with the lullaby “Fossil Blossom.” Crickets chirp, petals bloom, and hibernating creatures shake off the blanket of snow for another year.

Dust Bunny will be released on October 2nd, 2015 in cooperation with Disques de Lapin, purveyors of fine and strange music.
FAQs
<li>
When can I expect my stuff?

Campaign contributors have the advantage of getting the album before the official release date of October 2nd. Last-minute contributors might get their packages a little later than that, but before regular orders go out. The sooner you contribute, the sooner your package will ship.
<li>
I contributed and got download codes for 11 albums. Didn't you say you had 12?

The ""missing"" album is ""The Toy Box"" which was an alternate version of the album ""Supercute!"" that came packaged as a box set of 3 mini-CDs with 2 bonus songs. I consider it a separate album though the definition may be fuzzy in this case. To maintain the exclusivity of the bonus songs for people who bought the box set there is no download version aside from ""Supercute!""
<li>
How do I pay for the international shipping?
After clicking ""Contribute Now"" and selecting your package you can increase the contribution amount in the field above by $14.
<li>
I forgot to pay $14 for international shipping!
No problem, just click ""Contribute Now"" again and make a contribution that
is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original. Thanks!
<li>
I placed an order and have a question.
Feel free to send a message with your questions.

There is a huge lack of easily accessible, diy, all ages community spaces in Nashville. We all know this. A few of us are stepping up to spearhead the renting of a non-living space to bring you all live music, local musician merchandise, art crawl potential wall space, and a home away from home. This spot is located in the Wedgewood-Houston neighborhood, a great place to breathe fresh life into our community. The realtor, who is renting this home for non-living purposes, is super excited to have something like this in this growing area. ALL funds raised will go towards minor repairs, cleaning, rent, sound proofing, and getting the pa up and running. If we meet our goals, there will be a $free$ stacked show to kick off what will be a new era for Nashville's underground. Help us make this a reality
column2:
everything helps. Help us spread the word!

What Are We Doing?

Have you ever had a passion that was so strong for something that you'd be willing to do ANYTHING to make your dream a reality? While going on tour this Fall, we will be playing clubs all across America, meeting people that have sacrificed everything just to pursue their dream. We will show the very uncomfortable sleeping situations, the terrible food and the 15 hour drives through the middle of the night just to make it to the next venue. Along the way we will be playing with some of the most talented artists in the country and hearing some of their stories on what they have sacrificed in order to pursue their dreams. We have been robbed, spun off the road in snow storms, played in front of 3 people and played in front of thousands. In the end, we wouldn't have changed a thing. It's a roller coaster of emotion, but it's the only thing that truly makes us happy. After speaking with some people, getting robbed in our hotel room doesn't sound so bad compared to what some of these artists have gone through in their careers! Help us share their stories and hopefully inspire more people to follow their hearts and never give up on what they love.


What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We need $2k in order to make this happen. All of the shows are booked, but in order to document this tour the proper way we will need to make sure we have the right equipment. Every penny counts! We have plenty of options for donations and all we ask is that you help us share this project with your friends in order to help us reach our goal.

column1: The Impact

This documentary means a lot to us. We meet kids/young adults every day that tell us they feel ""lost"" and music is the only thing that makes them feel happy, or amazing artists that are forced to go to school to take over the family business. We want to help encourage young adults that it's OK to take some risks and never give up on their passion, no matter what it be. We have interviews set up with artists with stories that absolutely blow our minds. We know that if we can help show their stories then we can inspire a lot of people to keep doing what they love, no matter how scary it seems.

    Risks &
column2:
Challenges

The obstacles we will be facing are typical for us:

column4: >Blown out tires, bedbugs, getting sick, running out of gas, getting robbed, etc.

column1: We have never played this many dates so close together. It is going to be a challenge like no other and something we will have to prepare ourselves mentally and physically for. We are excited to meet all these inspiring people while being able to do what we love at the same time.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. All we ask is that you share this video with your friends and help us make this documentary come to life.

We have been robbed, spun off the road in snow storms, played in front of 3 people and played in front of thousands. In the end, we wouldn't have changed a thing. It's a roller coaster of emotion, but it's the only thing that truly makes us happy. After speaking with some people, getting robbed in our hotel room doesn't sound so bad compared to what some of these artists have gone through in their careers! Help us share their stories and hopefully inspire more people to follow their hearts and never give up on what they love.    What We Need & What You Get We need $2k in order to make this happen. All of the shows are booked, but in order to document this tour the proper way we will need to make sure we have the right equipment. Every penny counts! We have plenty of options for donations and all we ask is that you help us share this project with your friends in order to help us reach our goal.
The Impact

This documentary means a lot to us. We meet kids/young adults every day that tell us they feel ""lost"" and music is the only thing that makes them feel happy, or amazing artists that are forced to go to school to take over the family business. We want to help encourage young adults that it's OK to take some risks and never give up on their passion, no matter what it be. We have interviews set up with artists with stories that absolutely blow our minds. We know that if we can help show their stories then we can inspire a lot of people to keep doing what they love, no matter how scary it seems.  Risks & Challenges The obstacles we will be facing are typical for us:
Blown out tires, bedbugs, getting sick, running out of gas, getting robbed, etc.

We have never played this many dates so close together. It is going to be a challenge like no other and something we will have to prepare ourselves mentally and physically for. We are excited to meet all these inspiring people while being able to do what we love at the same time.

Other Ways You Can Help We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. All we ask is that you share this video with your friends and help us make this documentary come to life.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Newport Beach, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/oc-rock-band-hits-the-road-and-films-documentary/pica

Moontang Summary

  • With their aggressive approach to roots music, Moontang brings something new and refreshing to Colorado's music scene. Heavily influenced by both contemporary and classic dance music, the Moontang sound remains original, funky and undeniably soulful. .
  • Moontang won battle of the bands at the Fox, Boulder and were granted a gig at famous Summer Camp Music Festival near Peoria, Illinois.
  • Helping us get there will give us the opportunity to take a big step for Moontang and one leap for Roots music BABY .
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get
  • We need $1500 to either rent a van and trailer, or provide gas to our 3 available cars to get us and our instruments of magic from Boulder, CO to Summer Camp in Peoria, Illinois and back!

column1:
• $15 gets you a signed sticker.  $30 gets you a signed t-shirt.
  • If we don't reach our fund goal..... we will still make it there but be much much more poor as a whole:(

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute- no worries! YOU can still help!!

  • Share this campaign on all of your most favorite social media platforms.
  • GET out on the street and tell your friends, your brother, your mother, your grand papa, that cute girl or boy at the coffee shop!  Anyone could be excited about helping a band get themselves out there, and we would really appreciate the help!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

My name is Maren Montalbano, and I am a professional singer in the Philadelphia area. I have sung in over a dozen commercial classical recordings, and over the past five years I have been a guest artist with Lyric Fest, Bach Festival of Philadelphia, Network for New Music, and Piffaro, the Renaissance Band.
""Tangle and gold, I weave ye.
Fast to the rocks, I weave ye.""

These first lines from the Sea Tangle song cycle by Marjory Kennedy-Fraser captured my imagination and inspired me to create a program of music featuring little-known tales and myths: stories of powerful women performed by women.
I need your help to do just that.
<div>
Songs from the North

SEA TANGLE: SONGS FROM THE NORTH is an album of works for voice, violin, and harp. This is a completely self-produced album full of songs with ancient myths and folk tales from Alaska, New England, Scotland, and Iceland.
Joining me are violinist Rebecca Harris and harpist Christa Patton, as well as composers Melissa Dunphy and Emily Lau, whom I have commissioned to write new music for this album.
<div>
Why is this important?
As I was researching music for this project, I began finding folk tales about women, songs invoking goddesses, and even a poem about a bad-ass Viking warrior-maiden.

I realized that while there were plenty of songs and stories about princesses, there were very few stories that dealt with any other characterization. In SEA TANGLE, I sing about women who are righteous, jealous, joyous, love-sick, proud, and dangerous.
All the artists involved in this project, from the composers to the performers, are women. Who better to tell these diverse, little-known stories of women than women themselves?
<div>
<span style=""font-size: 30px

column4: >My goal is to raise $8,000
column7: >to record, market, and release this album. This is how that money breaks out:

column1: <ul>
<li>
Artist fees: $1,200. This covers the time that my artists and I will be spending in the studio only
column2: any rehearsal fees have already come out of my own pocket. This is the cost of working with high-quality, in-demand musicians.

column1: <li>

Recording costs: $3,700. I am very excited that we will be recording at the fantastic Buckeye Recording Studio in Philadelphia, which has worked with a diverse set of musicians, from jazz to classical to experimental. These guys are at the top of their game, so I am guaranteed a very high quality product. This money will go towards recording, mixing, and mastering, as well as graphic design for the CD insert and manufacturing fees.
<li>

Marketing: $1,500. I don't have a label to do press releases for me, so I need some help getting the word out! The music market is so saturated these days that without some aggressive marketing, my project will be lost at sea (pun most definitely intended). Marketing activities include videos, photos, press releases, blog posts, and online advertising. In addition to using female musicians, my videographer, photographer, graphic artists, and marketing professionals are also all women.
<li>
<b>Nuts &amp
column2: Bolts: $1,600. This may not be the sexiest part of the project, but it's probably the most important...and often the part of the budget that many people forget about. I have to pay fees to Indiegogo (3%) as well as Fractured Atlas (7%) for handling these monetary transactions online. Then there's the cost of shipping, taxes, etc., etc. Like I said: boring, but important.

column1: <div>
What YOU get out of helping me
Of course, the first thing you will get is a feeling of satisfaction at being a part of a unique, important, and interesting project!
Okay, okay...not enough of an incentive? How about this:
<ul>
<li>

Any amount you give (above the cost of your perks) will be tax-deductible, because I have teamed up with Fractured Atlas, a 501(c)(3) non-profit which is acting as a fiscal sponsor for this project. Most crowdfunding campaigns out there do NOT have this feature, so I'm really happy I can create this win-win situation.
<li>

Perks! Everyone loves perks. I've got your typical signed CD and credit in the liner notes...but everyone has that. In addition to the basics, there's some extra stuff that brings a little bit of me into your home. Check out the full list of perks as well as the giving levels in the sidebar to the right.
<li>

If you ever thought or said that women didn't get a fair shake in the world, now's your chance to lend a hand. SEA TANGLE is designed not only to showcase talented women doing what they do best but also to inspire other women to create more music. We need more women taking the lead and increasing visibility for each other in order to create a stronger society.
<div>
Timeline
I've been working on this project for almost two years, and it's exciting to now be scheduling rehearsals and recording sessions.
<ul>
<li>
Recording will take place in September. The works by Dunphy and Lau are still being written, but we will have those by August, just in time to polish and record them.
<li>
Performances will take place after we've recorded, either in November or December 2016. The plan is to coincide the first performance of SEA TANGLE with the release of the album!
<li>
Looking beyond the release: If I raise more than my $8,000 goal, I can start planning multiple performances in different cities.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Want to help but can't contribute monetarily right now? Consider these FREE ways to help:
<ul>
• Make some noise! Tell your friends about this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, Snapchat, Pinterest, etc. Use the share buttons above. And then once you've shared the link, keep sharing it!
• Donate a performance venue. I'm still looking into places in Philadelphia (or elsewhere) to perform this program, and if you have a place to donate, please get in touch with me.

• Do you like to cook? I want my CD release party to be a family celebration for those who have helped, and nothing would make me happier than to serve tasty dishes cooked by you, my friends and fans.

Sea Tangle: Songs from the North is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Sea Tangle: Songs from the North must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Hello Folks!

My name is Sheldon Vance, I am a 33 year old punk rocker/singer-songwriter living in Charleston, WV. The reason I've started this campaign is to fund the recording of my New CD ""Hills, Pills, and Unpaid Bills."" I know the title may be humorous to some, confusing to others, but in reality the title was meant to reflect the poverty and desperation of the area I grew up in, Logan, WV. The songs as well are reflections of my experiences, and the experiences I've seen with others. It's about trying to escape the poverty, hopelessness, depression, and drug addiction rampant in my home town.

I have an extremely talented individual by the name of Corey Hensley, who has graciously offered to produce/record the new album. Corey plays in the phenomenal bluegrass group Monroeville based out of Tennessee. If you've ever been to Ole Smoky Distillery in Gatlinburg, TN, there's a really good chance you've heard Monroeville play. 

What do I need to record and get this CD out there?
I'm seeking $700 to cover both recording and manufacture of the CD, as well as making a small amount of merchandise to go along with the album release. 

I'm trying to build funds to cover three things:

1. Recording costs - $500 of the total will go towards the cost of actually going into the studio, and recording the songs. This will afford me 2 days of studio time, and I'm hoping to get at least 10 songs recorded.

2. Manufacturing the CDs - $100 will go to making the 1st batch of CDs, and I am going to HAND-MAKE EACH CD. I'm doing this in order to keep the overall cost down, and realize my dream in a more cost effective fashion. I would love to have the things pressed at an actual facility, but that would drive the cost way up. The covers and booklets will be printed out at Staples, then cut, folded.  Each CD will be burned and labeled, then all components assembled and shrink wrapped by hand.

3. Merchandise - $100 will go towards getting some simple merchandise made to go along with the album release. I'm keeping it simple, stickers, buttons, some posters, and a few other odds and ends if money allows for it. 

That's it! But what if my campaign does well, and I raise beyond my goal?

Any money that I raise beyond the initial goal of $700, will go to making the CD and the release even better. With the recording, a little extra money might allow me another half-day or day in the studio to make the songs better.

Also, depending on how much extra is raised, I may get more, or better merchandise made up to UPGRADE the perks a little. Color posters, additional items, maybe even t-shirts. To honor the fact that you guys gave to me, I will try to give back to you as much as possible.

Either way, I want to thank you for your support, and for taking the time to even read this. Even if you can't contribute, PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD! I am a simple man with a simple goal...I DON""T want to be a rockstar or famous, I just want to share my music with as many people as possible.

Everyone's been asking, ""Where's the CD?""  So... here it is! Eatus Fetus is getting ready to release their debut album, but we need your help.
<div>
<b style=""background-color: initial
column2: >But your strange European currency frightens me, and I don't want to pay through paypal! AAAAHHHH!!!

column1: Shhh... don't worry, it's going to be okay. Just contact us, and we'll work something out that feels safe and easy for you.
<div>
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

This twisted toy box of demented musicians from the US, Britain and Germany come at you with their burning blend of punk-rock and opera with an in-your-face, fucked-up cabaret performance. Our music will touch you in your deepest, darkest places, where most dare not go.
Videos: http://tinyurl.com/n8j64we
https://www.facebook.com/EatusFetus

Believe it or not, behind all the funny, fucked up lyrics, many of the band's songs send a political message, with a heavy dose of sarcasm and tongue-in-cheek humor to wash it down. The queer front women hit on topics like children used in warfare, corporate politics, teenage cutting, overuse of pharmaceuticals, polyamory and consent.

Who is in this twisted toy box? Well, they are the broken toys that kids left behind, and they're PISSED OFF about it. There's Sara Mouse on drums, playing loud and queer, the Glamotron on bass, a robot gone wrong, obsessed with creating beauty, Mad Hatter Gerrit on guitar, taking sips from his psychedelic tea, and Locomotive Kenny on lead, the train engineer who can never have enough speed. These guys provide the hard-rocking music, solid, fast and loud. Then there are the two decadent divas, Daria the Wunderdoll, sweet and innocent, but not for long, and Rag Doll Rachel, the angriest, sexiest collection of cloth on this planet, who has never even heard the word “taboo.”

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We promise not to blow the money on smack and hookers. Seriously.

column1:
• Your money will go toward recording, mixing and mastering the album, then pressing and releasing it, plus merchandising and the album release event on Halloween: October 31, 2014 at Supamolly in Berlin
  • We've got LOADS of perks for you, as you can see along the right side of the page. If there's something you want that you don't see there, just ask... did I mention we're total fucking whores?
  • If we don't reach the entire goal, we'll just have to sell our bodies on Oranienburgerstr, because this album is coming out, one way or another. Our water is broken, the labor has begun, and the delivery date for this beautiful baby is set.
YOU will make all the difference
Realistically, people probably won't pay much for our bodies, so... we want you. We need you. WE'LL DO ANYTHING TO HAVE YOU!!!

We promise not to leave you with blue balls...

Our contributors won't be left short, Even if the campaign doesn't reach its goals because our fans are mostly either broke street walkers or cheap bastards. First we have a legal obligation to fulfill any and all rewards to our contributors. And we will do just that. Second, crowd funding is something we will utilize for other very cool music projects so our reputation is also on the line to deliver exactly what we say we're going to deliver, and we will not risk damage to our name by failing you. If there's one thing that Eatus Fetus stands for, it's integrity!
Our album release is scheduled for October 31, 2014, and we will fulfill all the perks as soon as possible after that.
<ul>
• Tell your friends! If you don't have any friends, tell your mom!
• Use the Indiegogo share tools, so everyone can find our campaign and give us their money!
Video Credits: Thank you to Oliver Chwat (videographer), Michael Reichert (voiceover), The Golden Reporter

L’Arche
Cleveland Presents:
The Sweet Sounds of the Holidays.....In Cleveland!
Hello, my name is Rebecca Brady and I
am the Community Leader of L’Arche Cleveland.  L’Arche
Cleveland, as you may already know, has been a part of the Cleveland community for forty years,  We  have four loving homes – one in Cleveland Heights, one in Maple
Heights, and two in Cleveland near Shaker Square – in which “core members”
(persons with developmental disabilities who are at the “core” of our

community) live and share their lives with assistants and volunteers.  I am excited to tell you about our  2015 holiday project that will be funded by this campaign: “The Sweet Sounds of the Holidays...In Cleveland!”  

As the holiday season
approaches we often reflect upon all of the things we are grateful for and how we can show our gratitude through giving back
exactly what you are looking for!
The goal of this campaign is to reach out
to people in the community for collaboration, raise money through a CD full of holiday music that we will be creating, and we also want to spread the
word about L'Arche.  The more people we can get to fund
the project, the more CDs we will be able to produce upfront.  Keep reading to learn the background
information on what we are doing and how you can help make this happen.   We encourage you to ask us questions, donate and get
involved.  We developed this campaign for
everyone in Cleveland and those that support L'Arche.. so enjoy!  We believe
creating this CD and singing together with other groups from around our city will create an even deeper
bond
column2: one that no other activity can replicate.

column1: This
CD is more than Music..... it is about Cleveland
Overview
The feeling of connection that comes
from singing together goes hand in hand with our mission to help
people with developmental disabilities share their gifts with others while

building transforming community relationships. To connect with others in our city, we have reached out to a variety of choral groups and musicians and asked them to support L'Arche and learn more about us by singing with us. The response has been overwhelming! We are so grateful for the generosity of these talented individuals in their willingness to share their gifts in the creation of this CD to support our organization.  CDs will be sold to help raise
funds to support the L’Arche Cleveland homes. Empower us to make
this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!

More about the Project

Update!!!! Our community is in the studio singing along to our favorite holiday songs! Soon we will be able to share them with you! Visit the gallery for more pictures and videos!
We are collaborating with Cleveland State University music therapy students, as well as other

community choral groups to create a holiday CD.  So far we are singing with Gesu Children's Choir, the NorthCoast Men's Chorus, the Temple- Tifereth Israel, the Horns and Things Jazz Band, Saint Raphael's Seraphim choir, Temple Baptist Church Choir and John Adams, the famed Cleveland Indians Drummer and we still have invitations out to other groups so we anticipate the collaborations to continue to add up! !  We believe that singing these songs that we
all know and love will create a unique and memorable experience for our core members and all other participants, as well as those who will purchase the CD

to enjoy during the holiday season. 

The Tracks

Deck the Halls

O Holy Night

Up on the Housetop

We Wish You a Merry Christmas

Reading of- The Eight Days of Chanukah

Silent Night

Go Tell It On The Mountain

Jingle Bells

Reading of- Twas the Night Before Christmas

12 Days of Cleveland Christmas!

Auld Lang Syne

*If we add additional tracks we will update this site.
How You Can Help
For us to bring this Holiday CD to
life, we need your support!
Your generous funding will help us get
things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost
of packaging, equipment and production. More importantly you get the chance to
be one of the first to hear our CD tracks!
This campaign needs your financial support but above
all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this project as much as
we do then please take a moment to click on the link to our Facebook page. Help us spread the word and get
things started!  We need you to ""Go Tell It""
How We'll Use the Funds
We need about $6,000 in
order to bring our debut holiday CD to the community by early November. That
will include all initial production costs, outreach and creation of the first 1,000 copies.
One of the perks available to
supporters of the campaign is the ability to secure a copy of the holiday
CD.  We ask that anyone who is touched by the mission of the organization to please support this
project by donating and sharing it with others.
Our Thanks for Your Support
We feel so grateful to everyone who has
taken the time to read about this campaign and for those who are contributing what they
can to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working
hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and know it will be worth every minute
thanks to all our generous supporters.
Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what
your donation helped us achieve.  You are
part of our L’Arche Cleveland family.
Your generosity and support will make
all the difference in making the Holiday CD a reality.
It would be great to have 6 people to
contribute $1,000. But in reality, 1,200 people contributing $5 would work
too, so please share this with anyone you think would
be willing to help.
Old
school?  No Problem!
For those who don't like making
donations over the Internet, please feel free to    write to us at our mailing address to send a check or money

order and pre-order your CD:

L'Arche Cleveland,
column4: > P.O. Box 20450, Cleveland, OH, 44120

column1: You do not have to have a PayPal
account.  Both credit cards and
debit cards are accepted.
Please help spread the word!
Crowdfunding is a hard task to get
everyone involved.  We don't have a
million friends and followers to share this with.  But, we have a community full of wonderful
people who want to see us succeed. Whether or not you contribute financially,
please share this page. Tweeting, sharing on Facebook or any
other venues you have at your disposal will greatly enhance our exposure and

increase our chances to succeed.  Please consider giving us 10 minutes of your time to share this page through social media and send 5 personal emails.  Need a little help figuring out what to say?   We have put together a sample email however feel free to ""tweak"" it to make it your own!

Will you help L’Arche Cleveland?  L’Arche Cleveland is a nonprofit that has four
loving homes in which persons with developmental disabilities live and share
their lives with assistants and volunteers.
One of their key goals is to help people with developmental disabilities
share their gifts with others!
With that in mind, they have put together a special fundraiser to

help support the community and to raise awareness of those wonderful gifts that the core members want to share with the world.  They are partnering with Cleveland State University music therapy students, as well as other
community and school choral groups to produce a holiday CD.  The idea is that singing together helps create a
sense of community and bonds people in a way that no other activity can.
They need  help to fund the production of the CD and
to make copies to sell.  I hope you will visit their Indiegogo site www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/the-sweet-sounds-of... look over the
information about the project and will post it and share it with others.
Here's the link to the Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/larche.cleveland
Please like and share it.  Feel free to leave a message also.
If you wish to contact us:
Website: http://larchecleveland.org/
Information

Please feel free to contact us at fundraising@larchecleveland.org 


","L’Arche
Cleveland Presents:
The Sweet Sounds of the Holidays.....In Cleveland!
Hello, my name is Rebecca Brady and I
am the Community Leader of L’Arche Cleveland.  L’Arche
Cleveland, as you may already know, has been a part of the Cleveland community for forty years,  We  have four loving homes – one in Cleveland Heights, one in Maple
Heights, and two in Cleveland near Shaker Square – in which “core members”
(persons with developmental disabilities who are at the “core” of our

community) live and share their lives with assistants and volunteers.  I am excited to tell you about our  2015 holiday project that will be funded by this campaign: “The Sweet Sounds of the Holidays...In Cleveland!”  As the holiday season
approaches we often reflect upon all of the things we are grateful for and how we can show our gratitude through giving back
exactly what you are looking for!
The goal of this campaign is to reach out
to people in the community for collaboration, raise money through a CD full of holiday music that we will be creating, and we also want to spread the
word about L'Arche.  The more people we can get to fund
the project, the more CDs we will be able to produce upfront.  Keep reading to learn the background
information on what we are doing and how you can help make this happen.   We encourage you to ask us questions, donate and get
involved.  We developed this campaign for
everyone in Cleveland and those that support L'Arche.. so enjoy!  We believe
creating this CD and singing together with other groups from around our city will create an even deeper
bond
column2: one that no other activity can replicate.
