My 1st Solo Piano CD

My discography contains over 50 recordings. The main thrust of my career has been collaborations with extremely talented songwriters (mostly based in NYC and Toronto). My playing on these records is strongly influenced by my passion for American Roots Music especially Memphis soul, New Orleans R&
column2: B and funk, Chicago blues, Nashville folk/country and New York City jazz. These recordings have often included a significant personal investment on my part - commitments of extensive touring in support of finished recordings, often months or years of developing material in club performances and 100's of hours of rehearsal. I have learned so much from this collaborative process with so many amazingly gifted writers and performers. The magic of the 1st take, listening more than playing, the value of space, embrace of minimalism, less notes equals more soul, the chemistry of personalities that creates the magic. I cherish the wonderful musicians I have shared the bandstand or live off the floor recording sessions with. I have learned my most important lessons from all of you.

column1: Decades of
column3: '> traveling the world touring and recording other peoples's music has brought me to a new stage of music making. I feel a strong calling to share my own personal  musical story. I have been composing my own songs for many years and finally feel like I have a worthy collection of material to produce and promote with live performances.

column1: <ul>
• I am celebrating over 55 years of playing the piano with the release of my 1st CD ""Every Time I See You""
• Featuring all original songs - Instrumental Piano Songs
• I have had so many requests for CD's at my performances over the last few years
• I love how this material has been received at my shows and hope this recording will lead to more solo concerts
Your donation to my project will allow me to continue to grow and develop my own music. I can't wait to share this personal music with you!
Production Stages
I have a great group of recording sessions to choose the final takes. Between edits and post-production mixing and mastering I have 3 to 4 weeks of final preparation to finish my project.
<ul>
• Your pre-orders and donations will give me the resources to finish up this year long project
• I spent the 1st two months of this year composing new material and arranging older songs
• An organic unified set of music gradually came together
• I recorded this material in early summer and then spent almost 2 months living with the recordings
• Several of the songs were then rearranged as well as 2 new compositions
• I went back in the studio for another week and a half of very fruitful recording
• All recording is finished. Thanks to my inspired design team in Seattle my artwork is ready and looks fantastic
• All that remains is final edits, mastering and manufacturing
The music: ""Every Time I See You""

My solo piano songs are instrumental music with lots of room for improvisation. That being said this is not a jazz record. These are largely songs - without words, but very tuneful compositions with a definite lyrical melodic character. I would describe them as personal intimate glimpses into my inner musical landscape. Mixed in with these songs are several groove oriented pieces with my own approach to blues, boogie woogie and Memphis soul. I love the variety of tuneful introspection to foot tapping celebration.
Thank you so much for checking out my project! Please visit my website at bobpackwood.com to enter your email address on my contact page for Gig Alerts and Updates on my CD.
","My 1st Solo Piano CD

My discography contains over 50 recordings. The main thrust of my career has been collaborations with extremely talented songwriters (mostly based in NYC and Toronto). My playing on these records is strongly influenced by my passion for American Roots Music especially Memphis soul, New Orleans R&B and funk, Chicago blues, Nashville folk/country and New York City jazz. These recordings have often included a significant personal investment on my part - commitments of extensive touring in support of finished recordings, often months or years of developing material in club performances and 100's of hours of rehearsal. I have learned so much from this collaborative process with so many amazingly gifted writers and performers. I have been composing my own songs for many years and finally feel like I have a worthy collection of material to produce and promote with live performances.

Mixed in with these songs are several groove oriented pieces with my own approach to blues, boogie woogie and Memphis soul. I love the variety of tuneful introspection to foot tapping celebration.

Short Summary
Greetings from Featherwest! We are an Indie-lectro duo currently based in Glasgow, Scotland where we found our home and place to develop our unique sound.
We are really excited to be able to announce the release of our debut album Home At Sea.

We are launching this crowdfunding campaign to help raise the funds needed to get the album on a beautiful 12"" see through red Vinyl Record. Please donate, contribute or pre-order items and you will receive some lovely perks for your help :-)
What have we done so far?
The album is recorded, mixed and mastered to high professional standards. We are now in the process of ordering  CD and Cassette copies of the album. It is also available in the digital realm.
You can listen to tracks from the Album by clicking here
So why Crowdfunding?

Recording, producing professional sounding album doesn't come cheap. Studio time, engineering fees, production costs, all of this costs loads of money and time spent. Producing a Vinyl doesn't come cheap either and for independent musicians like ourselves often is just a dream. We believe that a campaign such as this, can help make this dream a reality.
About the album
Our 10 song album is like us, full of opposites and yet harmonious in it’s diversity.
The songs are all original material composed and arranged by us therefore they are very close to our hearts.

On this album you will hear our playful, often harmonious vocals, soaring synthesizers with the deepest and fattest bases, not to forget about intriguing guitars and witty samples. On top of that you will  hear some outstanding Live drums by the very talented Melanie, who greatly contributed to the creation of the album of which we are extremely proud. All of that put together by amazing recording producer Paul Savage.
<h3>What We Need &amp
We need 1849.92 GBP to press 300 beautiful 12"" see through red Vinyl.
Here is a breakdown of the production costs:
For your contribution you will receive a still ""steaming fresh""copy of a beautiful, limited edition vinyl record of our album. If you are not into them kind of things you can also choose between :

Digital download on the sticker, CD or a cassette                                                                                     or possibly all of them in a bundle and have it delivered before the official launch date!!! Let's not forget about the  Tee - shirt.
Also Ryan will be happy to make a one of a kind drawing just for you. And trust me it will be a good one
There are a number of ways you can get involved and also a number of unique and exciting perks &
column2: rewards that we hope will encourage support for the campaign.

column1: The Impact

The main goal is to reach £1849.92 . If we, together, fund this press run, it will furthermore fund creative processes of our future albums down the line. This will therefore be a true collaboration between us and the fans, as you will be directly responsible for our future endeavors through this opportunity. Of course to reach this goal and even go beyond it would be absolutely fantastic. Every penny counts and every single one will go to where it is needed the most.

(Naturally you will be  kept up-to-date and informed of all progress made. Through Social media, mailouts and as a part of an online campaign you will be updated on what is happening and when it is happening.)
<h3>Risks &amp
We are very aware that things don't always go smoothly,  yes hiccups and delays might happen but we have a fantastic team of people from Loosewire collective to help with the whole project.
We also kept our rewards simple so we can get them to you as quickly and smoothly as possible.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you don’t have any moneys to spare there are other ways to help.
Follow our social media channels and 'SHARE' the content to help us spread the word.
Help spread the word of this amazing project to wider audiences of diverse musical interests, and also bring us closer together as artists and appreciators.
Sign-up for email updates so that when we come to your town you can support us in person!
We couldn't do this without your help so please contribute or pre-order items and you will receive some lovely perks for you help :-)

Thank you so much for taking time to read about our campaign. We hope you will find something in our perks that will make you heart go faster.  Please donate or purchase a perk it all contributes to our development! :-)
Cheers

NOTE:  If you are planning to make a donation of $200 or more in order to dedicate a song on the CD to a friend or loved one and have a printed dedication appear in the CD insert, please have donations in by May 15th.  After this time we will not be able to alter the CD insert before it goes to the press.  Thank you!
A note from Kristyn: Thank you everybody so very much for your amazing support! I am so excited that the new CD will be out this June!  Thank you for making this possible!  With love, Kristyn :)

column1: What YOU Get!
Goal: $2,000 or more (If there is ""more"" it will go towards supporting Kristyn's music career)
The money raised from this campaign will help pay for the royalties and the actual printing of Kristyn's new CD!

$2,000 is what we need in order to cover the last bit of expenses to press the first run of CD and to finish paying for royalties.  The album is all recorded and currently being mixed and will then be mastered!  We wanted to give YOU the opportunity to join in on the making of this new CD! column5:
>Hello! If you're here, you're likely already a fan of my work. But for those of you that don't know me, I'm Pedro Silva and I write music under the name Slime Girls.


For the past 3 years I've been releasing music, and steadily developing myself artistically and turning that into a career for myself. 

I've been able to accomplish so much I never thought possible via my music with the help of everyone that has ever purchased my music, merchandise, or gone to a show. It's been an amazing ride so far and I try to work hard every day to be worthy of that, and produce art that I'm proud of, that I also hope you will enjoy.

Currently, I'm in the middle of writing and recording brand new music for Slime Girls, composing music for OMORI (an independent RPG by OMOCAT that went through an extremely successful kickstarter period, that you may have heard about!) and a small handful of other projects that I can't talk about quite yet!

I have always (and will continue to for the foreseeable forever) offered my music for free and made it available through as many means possible, and accessible to as many people as possible. While I think my music is absolutely worth something and every purchase of my music helps me out tremendously, I would never strictly ask money for it.

But right now, I am dearly in need of your support!

MY PREDICAMENT:

My laptop has served me well for the past 7 years. I take good care of my belongings, especially my musical equipment. Because without them, it is impossible to create my art. I rely on my laptop for live shows alongside production (not to mention literally any other task in 2015)

Unfortunately, right before a live show a few days ago my laptop met its end, past the point of which I would consider it able to be revitalized.
I'm the type of person that tries my hardest to repair what I can, and get more life out of it, and I consider myself very tech savvy.
It's been through 2 batteries, 2 chargers, 2 screens (prior to it completely dying I've had to take an external monitor with me to all live shows in order to use the laptop!), numerous internal wire components that have been replaced and a broken CD drive. My laptop's time is well past, and there's no use putting more money into a machine that doesn't cut in the current climate of music production. 

As a musician, I've been living in a world severely setback by technical limitations of the hardware I have access to and the inability to really do anything portable (see above about the reliance on an external monitor). Without a laptop I am currently severely dead in the water when it comes to many aspects of what I do. I've already had to cancel an out of state performance because of my fears of not being able to rely on my laptop, which as you can see, turned out to be a sad but wise decision. As it stands, until I can afford a new laptop, I'm not going to be able to play any live shows, among many other things!

So with your help I'd like to invest in a Macbook so I can finally have a decent piece of hardware that will last me hopefully another 7 years or (likely way way way)more. I feel like at this point in my life it is an absolute necessity in regards to my musical output.

But, as it turns out! MacBooks are really really expensive! So that's where you come in.

So if you're a fan of my music, or even a new fan that has just discovered my work please consider donating whatever you can to this fund. This will go a tremendously long way in the short term and long term for my musical and artistic output, and my ability to provide you with content not only for Slime Girls, but additional projects I am a part of. So please consider helping me out, every dollar counts.

How Will The Money Be Used?
The money will be used to purchase myself a new laptop, depending on how successful this campaign is, I would ideally like to grab a MacBook Pro. Not trying to grab the most ultimate unnecessary specs, but something that is capable of running what I need is required. The more money I get, the more I can spend on getting something nice.

The rest of the money will be spent on the small handful of rewards that require some outside money. Along with accounting for fees from indiegogo.

Should this be wildly successful for whatever reason, there are some definite stretch goals that I can put in place. Mainly dealing with making my next EP and future music releases as amazing as possible. But we can get to those if they come up at all.

This indiegogo has unfortunately been put together much more hastily than I would have liked my first foray into crowdfunding to be. But that is only because the situation I have found myself in is one that needs a fix immediately. I'm running this campaign for less time than I should because I have obligations and live events that I do not wish to miss or cancel, such as a performance in San Jose in early September!  I hope that with your help I can pick myself up from this very quickly.

Of course, this is a really good opportunity to do some really fun things for backer rewards!

BRAND NEW SONG ADVANCE DOWNLOAD: WARPSTAR (WITH YOU)
This song will be featured on the EP that I am planning on releasing, but I want to share it with backers 2 months early as a thank you for your support.

MELONMINT BEAT SERVICES MIX
My good friend melonmint will be providing a special mix  just for this campaign!
You can preview their work on their soundcloud at https://soundcloud.com/melonmint
Be sure to check out and download their new ""sour plum EP"" as it is phenomenal.

SLIME GIRLS SONG COVERS/REMIXES/ARRANGES
For the $10 and above backers, you will receive a handful of exclusive covers/remixes/arranges by some super buddies. The exact songs that they will be tackling have yet to be chosen, but so far...

Providing a A 10 TIMES GRAVITY TRAINING MONTAGE REMIX, we have: 
Astroskeleton!
Who should be no stranger to fans of Slime Girls. They've already contributed a stellar remix in the past (for the Heart On Wave single). You can check them out here: astroskeleton.bandcamp.com

Bringing you a BLUE RESORT FERRISWHEEL FIREWORKS REMIX is:
Bansheebeat!
They just released one of the best, most texturally and emotionally rich albums of the year: Lumine
Which you can find at: https://galaxyswimteam.bandcamp.com/album/lumin...

Supplying A CORAL REEF SPA REMIX we have:
Clover &
column6:
Sealife!
Long time  beautiful undersea friend formerly known as Space Boyfriend will be tackling a Slime Girls song! Check out their music at: https://soundcloud.com/cloversealife
  
Conjuring A FRIDAY MONSTER RENDEZVOUS REMIX will be:
Cyclops Rock!
Fresh off the tail of ALSO just releasing one of the best albums of the year, Crush Punk! Which you should all get on! https://cyclpsrock.bandcamp.com/album/crush-punk

Taking you on a HOT CHOCOLATE DAYDREAM ARRANGE we have:
HoneyRocket!
One of the heads of the up and coming label Petal Port, you can listen to their lilting afternoon sounds at: https://petalportmusic.bandcamp.com/album/petal...

Leading the Promenade with a HANDSOME PUPPY ARRANGE we have:
Seth Boyer!
Who is also in the middle of a wonderful campaign to support their musical dreams and goals! You should absolutely check that out at: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/130449346/...

Filling the void in your heart with a SUMMER DAZE ARRANGE we have:
William Gibbons! (of Kara's Walk Home)
One of the bands I'm most excited about in the whole world, you can check out their music at: http://karaswalkhome.mortgage/

Possibly more tracks will be added as this campaign unfolds!

EXCLUSIVE STICKER SET BY SHIHFU AND BUBBLEBAT
Fans of Slime Girls should be familiar with the fantastic artwork of Shihfu!
A dear friend who did one of our more popular shirt designs a few years ago, the artwork for the YSTK Zine that I contributed 2 songs to and whose work you can check out here: http://shihfu.tumblr.com/tagged/shihfu-art
Fans of Slime Girls will also soon be familiar with the work of BubbleBat who recently did some art for the recent YUMEMI single release and some amazing art for mega pal Shoujo Kiss! You can check out their work at: https://www.facebook.com/BubbleBatArtist

NEW EP DIGITAL DOWNLOAD
As it turns out, this crisis I've found myself in could not have come at a worse time!
I'm in the middle of work on a brand new Slime Girls EP (likely going to be somewhere between 5-8 tracks) that is slated for an October 1st release! So I figured why not kill 2 birds with one stone here and make this a platform for you to be able to support me and be able to receive that EP once its out!

SLIME GIRLS DISCOGRAPHY
A digital download of every release I've put out and some harder to find tracks and including all remixes!
column10:
>
EXCLUSIVE ACRYLIC PIN BY PUNIMELT

Recent Slime Girls collaborator and mega talented artist PuniMelt will be designing a beautifully crafted acrylic charm set for this campaign! More details on the designs of those as this campaign unfolds, but Slime Girls fans should be very familiar with her style and work! If you're not, please visit their website here: http://www.punimelt.com/

Here is an example of some previous designs:



STEMS/MIDI/CHORD CHART/PROJECT FILES
I'm willing to share and provide you with chord charts, tabs, stems for remixing, MIDI files and project files for any and all Slime Girls songs! This also covers songs that will be featured on the upcoming EP once its released.

1 OF A KIND T-SHIRT
Long ago I received this as a test! It has never been worn, is size UNISEX LARGE and is completely 1 of a kind and will never receive an actual print run. It could be yours!

Here is a picture of it! It's a beautiful dark green with very very bright neon green ink print on it. Looks real great IRL.




KACHO-ON!
You get to choose a game, and in GameCenterCX fashion I will livestream myself attempting to beat said game and see the ending screen.
I'll make an event out of it and we can all have a party on the internet while I attempt to clear this challenge! Together!
Can even be a co-op game if you want to see me force a friend into this fate alongside me! 
Get some friends and pool your money together and decide my fate!
Likely limited to NES, SNES, Gameboy Advance, Sega Genesis. But PS1 and N64 are probable! Let's discuss what you want to see me suffer through and we'll make it work.

LSDJ &
column11:
FAMITRACKER WALKTHROUGH
Ever wanted to learn how to make chiptune?
I'll host a livestream tutorial detailing how I make chiptune. Walking you through the 2 programs that I have used in the past: LSDJ and Famitracker. Answering any and all questions you might have, and showing you anything regarding my creation process and chiptune sound design.



COVER SONG!
For a fair price, I will cover ANY song you want me to cover. This is your chance to hear your favorite...or least favorite...songs re-imagined. The cover will be sent to you personally! I can post it on my soundcloud or online but if you want to keep it to yourself it can be your precious secret for all of time! If there's any sort of creative direction you'd like me to take with it (do you want straight chiptune? vocaloid vocals? real vocals? want it to sound like a SNES game?? my own personal style?) I'll that into consideration too!

Ideally, maybe pick 3 or so songs, and I can give you feedback/make a choice from them! We'll discuss it!

I'LL PLAY A SHOW ANYWHERE IN THE USA!
If for some crazy reason you're willing to donate way too much money to me, I will make it my personal mission to travel to your city and play a show there for you!

0,"

Short Summary

I am an electronic indie musician and brony artist. This campaign is designed to raise money so I can afford a working desktop computer, so I may continue to do what I love. The laptop I currently use is dying and on it's last leg. Over the past several days it's blue screened and I've had to restart it several times just to get it to function. It continues to fluxtuate between periods of working and periods of not working, with the working periods growing shorter and shorter. If you donate, you'll be helping my reach my dreams of being a professional musician and artist, which would mean the world to me =3

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

I'm looking to purchase a desktop computer and monitor to replace the laptop I am currently using, as well as purchase a functioning set of speakers. I'll need around $850 to purchase what I have my eyes set on: an

column1: HP Pavilion 500-424 Desktop &
column2: 25"" IPS LED Monitor and Studio Monitor 45 5-1/4"" 2-Way Bookshelf Speaker. By supporting me, you'll get things like line art, fully colored art, and maybe even a custom song! I have links down below to show you what I've got. If I don't reach the entire goal, I'll just hold on to what we got until I can save up the rest

column1: Music: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjX1pKRyW3Jk63...
Art: http://achickencupcake.deviantart.com

The Impact

Making music and art is really my life. It's how I met so many amazing people, it brought me out of depression, and it continues to fill my life with joy every day, and I don't want that to end because I couldn't afford a new computer. I would save up by myself, but the unfortunate truth is I am jobless. I've been searching for a while now, but no one will hire, and I only receive a small amount every now and then from other sources, such as music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's okay! The fact you even took the time to read all this means so much =D
If you can, spread the word, let people you think might be interested know. Spread the word around, get it out there. I'll be doing what I can, but I'm only one guy
Thank you =3

","Short Summary I am an electronic indie musician and brony artist. This campaign is designed to raise money so I can afford a working desktop computer, so I may continue to do what I love. The laptop I currently use is dying and on it's last leg. Over the past several days it's blue screened and I've had to restart it several times just to get it to function. It continues to fluxtuate between periods of working and periods of not working, with the working periods growing shorter and shorter. If you donate, you'll be helping my reach my dreams of being a professional musician and artist, which would mean the world to me =3 What We Need & What You Get I'm looking to purchase a desktop computer and monitor to replace the laptop I am currently using, as well as purchase a functioning set of speakers. I'll need around $850 to purchase what I have my eyes set on: an

HP Pavilion 500-424 Desktop & 25"" IPS LED Monitor and Studio Monitor 45 5-1/4"" 2-Way Bookshelf Speaker. By supporting me, you'll get things like line art, fully colored art, and maybe even a custom song! I have links down below to show you what I've got. If I don't reach the entire goal, I'll just hold on to what we got until I can save up the rest

Hello good people,

My name is Ben McClintock.  I am a musician creating music in San Francisco.  Sometimes an album is made piece by piece in a recording studio of some sort and then arranged for a live setting, and other times the music is composed, rehearsed and performed a hundred times before a note is recorded.  Both methods can be great, but this album is a case of the latter.  I recruited two of the most talented and original musicians I know, Tom Smith and Cameron Bateman, and convinced them to learn my songs and help in their arrangement to make a power trio record with one foot in tradition and the other in whatever sonic ideas were inspiring throughout the writing.  

After a year of playing the music live we went into the studio to record with John Karr at Ear Relevant Recordings in San Francisco (production credits with Sleepytime Gorilla Museum, Eric McFaddin, The Mermen) and then had the music mixed by Phil Manley at El Studio in SF (Trans Am, The Fresh and Onlys, Moon Duo, Kelley Stoltz).  Extreme care was taken to ensure that this music was fully realized and recorded with no corners cut.  This music soothes me and it was created to do the same for you.  Now it just needs to be pressed to vinyl.
Why vinyl records?

These days people seem to primarily listen to music on their phones and from streaming websites.  I do this as well and really enjoy the accessibility of listening to my favorite tunes wherever I am.  Nevertheless, a vinyl record is a thing unto itself.  You can hold it, look at the finite details of the artwork, read the credits, put the record on and do nothing else for 40 minutes except flip the record when A side is over.  There are no distracting associations outside of the music and art of a record.  No banner ads, no phone calls in the middle of a song, no ""similar artists"" to put you down a rabbit hole inevitably ending on U2's new record.
The Costs
All of the music and artwork have been created, recorded and paid for already.  The reason for this fundraising campaign is simply to pay for
vinyl and packaging production.  If I reach my goal, 250 copies
will be made at San Francisco's own Pirates Press
(http://www.piratespressrecords.com).  The cost for the production is $1750.  The remaining $250 will go towards lyric sheet inserts, paying the cover art artist and paying for postage.
Philosophy and the Future

""The idea is not to live forever, it is to create something that will."" -Andy Warhol

Once we have hopefully reached our goal, Foli will definitely be playing a record release show in San Francisco to celebrate the work and the people that have been a part of realizing this project.

I've put together some nice pre-order packages if you would like to help me finish off this project and press the vinyl.  I have chosen to do flexible funding for this project which means if I don't receive the stated goal at the end of the campaign I will be able to keep what I did raise and will then self finance the remainder of the costs if need be. 

Thank you!

Thousands of Young People from Lebanon, Syria, Jordan, and Iraq have
been introduced to American Culture through our workshops and concerts since
Each day seems to bring a
new threat to conflict zones in the Middle East: ISIS, Mosul, Syria, Aleppo.
The list of conflicts seems endless and, watching the news, we despair as to how
to provide assistance to the region.
Yet every day, committed
young musicians, actors, and dancers in Syria, Iraq, Kurdistan and Lebanon,
living among these conflict zones grab their violin, don their dance shoes and
memorize their lines to pursue their passion for the performing arts.  Since
2007, American Voices has been the only organization to be there consistently -
in Iraq, Syria, Lebanon, Sudan and beyond, to help these talented youth follow
their dreams and achieve their goals.
With your generous
support, our summer academies in the Middle East and year-round scholarship
programs in the US have provided expertise, instruments, training and mentoring
to thousands of young performing artists across all conflict zones and
confessional lines.
This August marks a huge
turning point for our programs and our support of youth in the region. We will
re-launch our YES Academy Program in the Kurdistan region of Iraq as the
Kurdish-American Arts Festival and have expanded the scope of our program in
Lebanon to include participants of the Levant nations of Syria, Jordan, Egypt
and Iraq. Our programs will reach hundreds of youth this summer, most of whom
were unable to attend in 2014 due to the fall of Mosul and the ensuing
shortages and chaos.
The Lebanon program will
re-launch as The American Arts Festival and Academy of Lebanon and the Levant
and remains the only summer conservatory program in the region with a regional
focus. Youth from across the Levant will have the opportunity to study, perform
and collaborate together with instruction by esteemed American performers and
teachers.
American Voices seeks to

raise <a href=""http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001dTOdj2BjhqVlWJNDS8H0wkp3356QIydcJCp8JpXxt6x0DAuPz4KxK35wARlUroDvhCoWw_vTmzxov_uY4qzCClNMXoZh53bp77OAidDX-DUhF8wt3el5sVjhTPul02LU736HO_41KtKa3bhs7Jtm9Ysx45loUlsCj7FOsEPX5wucZgCxdFBitnY2sk-peJ6O&amp
support this year's American Arts Festival/ YES Academy in Lebanon (August

10 - 22) and Kurdish American Arts Festival (August 24 - 31. 

A generous donor has already
agreed to match all contributions up to $2,500.00
Funds raised in this campaign will directly
support the training of young participants in Iraq and Lebanon.
The performing arts are strong forces for good
in a region beset by violence. For all the hatred and fear and lack of
opportunity, the arts are a uniting force—a common thread. Our work in the
region has brought us face-to-face with thousands of young people who want to
share their music and learn about ours.There is no higher use of cultural engagement than to build upon
that innate desire to connect and to be heard.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""> <h3>
The Story:

We—Maria, Michaeline, and Kateri Andress—are three sisters who have been harmonizing together ever since we were gradeschoolers. Maria is now at a film school in San Diego, Michaeline is entering the Discalced Carmelites this year, and Kateri is a junior in highschool. As we are about to move on we've finally been given the opportunity to fulfill a dream we’ve had for the past 6 years—professionally recording a CD! Our first album ""Jesu And Maria"" will be composed of sacred music, including both well-known and hidden treasures as well as a couple pieces featuring original harmonization. So far we have finished recording at a studio in Milwaukee. Before we can continue, we need to raise money to cover that as well as printing and distribution costs. We cannot do this on our own, however, and are excited to ask for your support!
The Process:

•In order to produce a professional CD we must cover recording costs at Tanner-Monagle Studios, printing costs, and small business license fees. This is about $3000. In addition we would like to raise an extra thousand dollars to put toward recording a second CD this summer before Michaeline enters the Carmelite Cloister.

•We need your help! Whatever we raise with this campaign—even if it doesn’t quite top our fundraising target—will go entirely toward our project. Whatever you have to offer, whether it be fifty cents or five hundred dollars, will add up. With your enthusiasm and generosity we are positive we can reach our goal!
The Impact:

•You: With ""Jesu And Maria"" we will share our God-given vocal talents through chant and polyphony, a cappella and accompanied, English and Latin songs. Our hope is that this CD—and more in the near future—will inspire you any and every day of the year.

•Us: What we earn from this CD will enable us to record more in the future, raise funds for Maria and Kateri to travel in Europe for World Youth Day Krakow 2016, and help pay for our college education.
Other Ways You Can Help:
Even if you are unable to contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't support us:
column2: >•Share our link on Facebook or email with everyone you know!
column3: >(Use the                                 Indiegogo sharing tools on this page.)

column1: •Pray for us to get the funding we need and for our production to go smoothly.

Thank you very much and God bless you!

Thanks to everyone who supported our campaign!
Skoog 2 is now shipping and available to order from www.skoogmusic.com
Skoog is for
column4: > aspiring musicians, families, electronic musicians, and has a wealth of applications in education.
column6: >Skoog 2.0 works with the iPad connecting wirelessly via Bluetooth LE. And is available
column7: > to order now for just £199 from www.skoogmusic.com

column2: >Check out the gallery or
column3: list=PLeiEIpyoKsuhTk5nNUiIdr-eOEKMZW8kc"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">visit our youtube channel to see more examples of Skoog being played by musicians and young people, including examples of Skoog being used by individuals with disabilities.

column1: <h1 style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Skoog is an uber-cool, app-ready, hands-on musical cube that brings your creativity to life.  Skoog sets the standard for tactile control and redefines the musical landscape for novices and experts alike.

column1: <div>
<ul style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li>
For <a href=""#foraspiring"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column3: > it is an easy to learn musical instrument that you can play within seconds.

column1: <li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column5: >it is a fun way to explore sound and music together with the kids and grandparents with no need to master complicated music theory or

column1: <li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column3: >electronic musicianit is a hackable, real-time, multi-parameter expressive controller that can bring life to your compositions, live sets and synth jams.

column1: <li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column3: >educators Skoog has a range of applications in Special Education and inclusive music provision. Designed with accessibility in mind, Skoog can be used by musicians of all abilities, making it the go-to instrument for music therapists and assistive technologists, too.
>There's nothing like Skoog out there. No other digital musical instrument or music software controller is this tactile, flexible or naturally expressive.

column1: <ul style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<h1 style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column2: >The Skoog is like a games controller for making music
column3: it's a squashy foam cube that acts as a controller for our bespoke software running on your iPad, Mac or PC.

column2: >The sensor living at the heart of the Skoog detects how you squeeze and deform the foam - its not just sensitive to how hard the Skoog is being touched, but where  and how it's being touched.
>This unparalleled sensitivity means that our sensor translates your actions - the things you do to and with the cube - into meaningful musical sounds. It is uniquely expressive.

>When you are using it as an instrument, you choose a sound (guitar, say),  it has a different note on each side (giving you the option of 5 notes at a time), and when you touch a side you play the note. The expressive bit comes from how you touch it:  if you touch it gently, it will be a quiet, soft note, press hard and it will be loud and brash.

column3: >Whilst you can choose to aim for the buttons, when you're playing the Skoog you don't have to: the whole surface area of the cube is responsive.

column2: >When you are using it as a ‘controller’ you can assign different notes, effects and parameters to up to 17 different playable areas of the Skoog so that you can customise to your heart's content.

column1: <h1 style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column4: > sounds are made by a processes called 'physical modelling' and 'subtractive' synthesis. That's not sampling, no sir.

column2: >Physical modelling captures the nuances of each particular instrument
column3: play the Skoog as a flute and you'll get the different notes, sounds, tones and timbres determined by ""embouchure"" and breath noise, depending on how you physically manipulate your Skoog.  Subtractive synthesis gives a classic analog synth sound with full on bass, crisp mids and highs.

column1: <h4 style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >""The modelled instruments provided by the application are expressive and sound pretty wonderful"" - <span style=""font-weight: normal

column1: <h4 style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<h4 style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column6: >Skoog can also work as a MIDI controller, which means that you can connect to GarageBand, Logic and other compatible MIDI devices and applications to open up a whole new world of sounds.

column1: <div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<b>Check out our ""Skoog Jams"" playlist for examples of the sounds and instruments available: <a href=""http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2vuC10raO2Y&amp
column2: list=PLeiEIpyoKsuhs3x5crHAWhVril35sNc3Y"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">SKOOG JAMS PLAYLIST

column1: <div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fplayer.vimeo.com%2Fvideo%2F113599716&amp
<h1 style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column4: young and old, from novices right through to music teachers and sound designers.   With a range of easy to use software/apps and a FREE developer kit in the pipeline, Skoog can be a fun introduction to music making
column5: or it can be a serious piece of kit for on the fly-soundscaping.  It's up to you.

column1: <div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<h2 style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column2: >Skoog removes the technical barriers to playing an instrument so that you can focus on your sound. You can be expressing yourself musically in less than a minute. With a different note on each side, Skoog knows its scales so you don't have to - all you have to do is get in key and start jamming.

column1: <div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<span style=""font-size: 18px

column2: >Skoog lets you play along with your favourite tunes and tracks
column5: create your own parts and your own sounds
column6: set up loops and layer them
column7: add and control effects on the fly
column9: compose and record your own music.

column1: <div style=""letter-spacing: 0px

You can take it to the next level by hooking it up to other music apps and software, like Ableton, Logic or Garageband, and using it as a uniquely tactile and flexible multi-touch, multi-dimensional controller.
<div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<h2 style=""text-align: center

column2: >Skoogmusic was honoured to be a finalist at this years Music Teacher Awards for Excellence in the Best SEN Resource category.   Skoog 2.0 brings new opportunities to the classroom.
>Kids are musical. They sing and dance without being taught.

column3: >ut traditional instruments can be intimidating for younger children.
column4: >Skoog gives children (of all ages!) a fun, playful way to explore musical creativity and expression without the need for prior instrumental skills or specialised musical knowledge. Tactile, musical, play.

column2: >Using the pentatonic presets you can start making music with kids straight away and each of the sides is colour coded (with a ring around the button). You can use colour coded scores and learning materials to help children play tunes and even compose their own music.

>Our first product, Skoog 1, was developed in partnership with teachers and it has been successfully put through its paces over the last four years in schools across the world.  We've applied everything we learned over that time to designing a Skoog for everyone: an affordable, wireless, iOS compatible digital musical instrument and controller that lets you start expressing yourself musically from the moment you pick it up.

column1: <div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<div>
<h2 style=""text-align: center
column3: >The Skoog 2.0 Education Bundle - Applications in Special Ed.

column1: Skoog 2.0 (early bird edition) is in production and now we are delighted to announce that our new education bundles are available via Indiegogo as well.

During the course of the last 4 years we have developed a software package and range of resources to help teachers and students get the most form Skoog in the classroom. This bundle, which includes the Skoogmusic PC/Mac software, is now available on this campaign!
The education bundle includes the wireless Skoog 2.0 interface (in black), Skoogmusic PC/Mac software, Skoogmusic App and a range of teaching material and resources which include:
<span><span>
<ul>
<li>
Support for over 150 popular songs and tunes
<li>
<a href=""http://www.skoogmusic.com/resources/lessonplans?mc_cid=e575a91bb8&amp
<li>
14 sample packs
<li>
Backing tracks/loops
The bundle includes the iPad App and the skoogmusic software for PC and Mac.

column2: >To find out more about the features and benefits of Skoog that are relevant to children with special needs visit the
column4: >.  For specific student populations and applications see:

column1: <ul>
<li>
Cerebral Palsy
• Autism
<li>
PMLD
<li>
Speech and language therapy
• Music therapy
• Inclusion
• Down's Syndrome
• Visual Impairment

You can support a range of different music making activities using Skoog.  The interface can be customised to suit a wide range of physical abilities. Here is a short film illustrating how the Skoog concept was developed to address the barriers faced by children with physical and learning difficulties.

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""435"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2F10tIDYgPmXY%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp

For all the electronic musicians, producers, sound designers and sonic adventurers out there, Skoog 2.0 gives a new hands-on way to manipulate sound.  With it you can vary multiple parameters at once to perform musical gestures that might require a third hand with standard controllers. Powerful sensors detect how and where the body of the Skoog is deformed in 3D.  By mapping sonic parameters to the sensor data, a single gesture can be used to produce complex musical expression.

All Skoog perks come with Skoogmusic software for iPad, Mac and PC included, so you can have fun exploring the musical possibilities with the physical modelling and subtractive synthesis sound engines that we've designed to work with Skoog.

If you'd like to take things further, in May 2015 we'll be launching our Ableton plugin, so you can setup your Skoog to control pretty much anything your imagination can conjure up using Ableton Live.   On top of that we'll be releasing an API in summer 2015 that will mean that you can start integrating Skoog into your own software.

1. Skoogmusic: this is the sound engine and control room for your Skoog.
It's all you need to connect, customise and play. Available for Mac, PC and iPad.
2. Mogo: a dedicated virtual analogue synth app designed to work
exclusively with the Skoog. Awesome retro-futuristic sounds that you shape and bend - literally.

<h1 style=""text-align: center

At Skoogmusic we love experimenting with new ways to combine Skoog 2.0's  tactile-sensing capabilities with audio software.  Tactile interfaces connect you directly to your sound in a way that other interfaces simply cannot, and the possibilities are limited only by your imagination.

Use Skoog to control panning in your quadraphonic sound system, for real-time lighting or video editing, for driving your car, or for tactile control of your frickin' toaster if that is what floats your boat.  With Skoog 2.0 we have unlocked a new level of hands-on control and we want to see what you can do with it.

Over the coming months, we'll be putting together a multi-platform API for Skoog 2.0, as well as external objects for Max/MSP and a Max4Live Device for Ableton users.   Want to see what you can do with it?  Check out the initial spec:

column2: >FAQ: What else can we tell you?

column1: <div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
APP COMPATIBILITY
Which iPhone/iPod Touch/iPad models does the Skoog support?
Skoog is compatible with iPad models that support Bluetooth Low Energy - this
includes iPad 3rd Generation, iPad 4th Generation, iPad Air, iPad Air 2, iPad mini,
iPad mini 2, iPad mini 3
Our iOS apps are not compatible with iPhone.
Can I use the Skoog with Ableton Live?
Of course! Skoog can connect to Ableton via MIDI using Skoogmusic iOS or OSX, but for extra features and
customisation we are also offering an Ableton specific plugin as a Perk, which will
allow you to connect your Skoog to Ableton via Max for Live.
Is the Skoog compatible with Android devices?

Not yet.  We will be staging the release of the Android versions of our software, but they won't be available until late 2015/early 2016.   Please email info@skoogusic.com if this is something you would like us to prioritise.
Does the Skoog output Standard MIDI?
Skoog isn’t MIDI class-compliant, but with the Skoog app, it can output MIDI
and connect the Skoog to other applications.
What can I do with MIDI?
MIDI is an easy way to connect different electronic musical instruments and allow
them to ‘talk’ to each other. This is also how you can connect the Skoog to other
synth apps on your iPad and record it in Garageband!
What do I need to send MIDI from the Skoog to an external MIDI device?
You can connect your Skoog to an external MIDI device using the Skoogmusic
OSX software, via any sound card that has a MIDI output.
Which iOS audio apps can the Skoog ‘play’?
Skoog can talk to any app that supports MIDI In via Inter-App Audio.
Examples are Garageband, Nanologue, Orphion, ThumbJam...
It is also compatible with Network MIDI, which will allow you to connect your
Skoog to apps on any compatible device via your WiFi network.
How does the Skoog work with a laptop/desktop computer?
Skoog works with laptop/desktop computers, both Windows PCs
and Apple Macs, via the Mogo OSX or Skoogmusic OSX software.
<div>
<div>
<div>
Can I use my own sensor/controller with the app?
No. The Skoogmusic app and the Skoogmusic/Mogo OSX/Windows software only
work with the Skoog.
Does the Skoog only work with Apple devices?
No, our desktop software runs beautifully on Mac and handsomely on Windows.  Linux users, get in touch.

Skoogmusic is available for iPad, Mac and PC.  Mogo is currently available in desktop version only, with an iPad version available in September 2015.  Version 1.0 of ii-Music launched in January 2015 and lets you set up and add effects to your Skoog performance using eyegaze hardware (purchased separately) or to explore sound and music using just your eyes.
* ii-Music spec as at Jan 2015.  Features in the pipeline for 2015 include backing tracks, looper, custom tunings and analog synth instruments.
<div>
What is the hardware specification for Skoog 2.0?
<b>How do I get the Skoog apps?
The Skoogmusic app will be available via the iTunes App Store. The
Skoogmusic and Mogo software for mac and windows will be available for download from
our website.
Does the Skoogmusic app produce its own sounds?
Yes it does. The main ‘voice’ of the Skoog is generated by physical modelling,
with a range of instrument sounds available including strings, percussions,
woodwind, brass etc.
Where does the sound output come from?
The sound from your Skoog will be routed through the audio output of your tablet/laptop/desktop computer. You can of course enhance the sound of your Skoog by connecting
some high quality loudspeakers/headphones.
Can the Skoog be used to record and sample audio through a microphone?
The Skoogmusic OSX offers extensive sampling and audio recording
functionality for the Skoog.
We are working towards providing the same functionality for the Skoogmusic iOS app,
although you can also utilise other readily available sampling apps and connect
your Skoog to it via MIDI.
Can you change the sounds on the Skoog?
You certainly can! Both the Skoogmusic iOS app and Skoogmusic OSX software boast a
range of ultra expressive and dynamic physical modelling instruments. With its
MIDI functionality and sampling on the Skoogmusic OSX, your choice of Skoog
sounds is limitless!
How many notes can I play with one Skoog?
With our standard software you can play 5 notes at a time, with the ability to pitch bend between each to
produce microtones. You can also assign different notes to different parts of the
Skoog. You can also change key or individual notes on the fly.  Our API will allow you to assign notes to corners and edges fur a maximum of 17 notes.
<div>
<div>
<div>
Can it sound like a trumpet?
Yes it can! The main ‘voice’ of the Skoog is generated by physical modelling, with
a range of instrument sounds available including strings, percussions, woodwind,
brass etc.
Can I connect two Skoogs to the same iOS device?
No, only one Skoog at a time on an iOS device I’m afraid! Skoogmusic
OSX/Windows will allow you to connect up to two Skoogs at a time, to the same computer.
What else do I need to play sounds with the Skoog?
Nothing! Just the Skoog, your iPad/computer, and you are good to go!
Does the Skoog need to be tuned? Can it be tuned to acoustic instruments?
By default, the Skoog is tuned to concert pitch with A4=440Hz. You can tune/detune the Skoog with the fine tuner, so that it’s in tune with any acoustic instrument that you might be
accompanying.
HARDWARE
Where does the Skoog get power from?
Skoog 2.0 gets its power via USB when connected to a desktop computer or laptop using a USB cable, or from its internal rechargeable battery (which charges via USB) when operating in wireless mode.
How sensitive is it? If I had to press hard on one side, wouldn’t that just knock the
Skoog over?
Skoog 2.0 is more sensitive than ever, needing just under 100g of pressure to activate - so if you keep knocking it over, you are pushing too hard!
Are those just buttons?
The buttons act as a visual ""lure"" and give you better directional control whilst playing.  The Skoog  is in fact touch sensitive all over (with the exception of the base).
Isn’t it just a MIDI controller?
Definitely not! The Skoog is so much more than a MIDI controller - the core sounds
available are dynamically generated by physical modelling synthesis, which translate your expressive
gestures into musical sounds. The new Mogo software uses dynamic subtractive synthesis to make Skoog 2.0 more expressive than ever!
<div>
<div>
<div>
How is Skoog 2.0 different from the old Skoog?
For this new version of the Skoog, we have completely redesigned our sensor to fully exploit the opportunities for dynamic control, our
manufacturing process, tooling...everything! We have listened to our users, and
are answering some of our most popular requests: it’s wireless, iOS compatible,
and<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

The new sensor has a much higher polling rate than the old Skoog, and the Bluetooth LE  firmware has been reengineered to give the minimum possible  wireless latency (official figure TBC when we have production prototypes in-hand for testing), so Skoog 2.0 is overall much more responsive.  Skoog 2.0 can also  communicate with your Mac/PC using HID.  For those who want to get straight to the source
data,  we'll be releasing an api very soon so you can start using Skoog 2.0 in your own applications.  We can't wait for developers to start exploring different
uses for Skoog 2.0!  If you are interested in getting your hands on the API, please email support@skoogmusic.com.
Oh yeah, and we think the new look is pretty darned awesome as well.
What is the Skoog’s wireless range?
Skoog 2.0 connects wirelessly via Bluetooth, and has a range of approximately
10 metres.
How long is the battery life?
The Skoog can be used for up to 10 hours between charges.
Can the Skoog connect by USB as well as Bluetooth?
It certainly can - your wireless Skoog can also connect to the computer via USB,
the same way as when you connect it to charge up its battery.
LEARNING &
Can I still buy Skoog for education?
Yes you can, and the wired Skoog 1 is still available to buy from our partners
Douglas Stewart and their reseller network.
You can also purchase Skoog 1 from the Apple store online.
<div>
<div>
<div>
Will this teach me how to play a ‘normal’ instrument?
The Skoog helps people new to playing music to learn about music and sound
as they experiment with musical expression - from pitch, timbre and dynamics
through to scales, instruments, recording and editing.
Do I need to be a musician to use the Skoog?
No. The Skoog is really easy to learn and helps people new to playing music to
learn about music and sound as they experiment with musical expression - from
pitch, timbre and dynamics through to scales, instruments, recording and editing.
<div>
What if I don't know what key a piece of music is?
Don't worry, there are loads of websites that can help - check out the Top Tunes section of the Skoogmusic website, Echords or a good old fashioned google search.
MISCELLANEOUS
Can I contribute in USD ($) / other currencies?
Of course!  Our Perk prices are displayed in £GBP but you can make your contribution in USD ($), CAD (C$), AUD (A$), EUR (€) or GBP (£).
What if I can't afford to order a Skoog right now?
No problem. You can still help us realise our vision that 'anyone can play'.
<ul>
• You can order one of our awesome t-shirts.
• You can share this campaign with your friends and work connections, using the Indiegogo share tools at the top of this page.
We want Skoog to be available to as many people as possible and you can help us achieve that, whatever resources you have to hand.
What about international shipping?
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>
Shipping within the UK &
column2: the EU or to the US is free. Anywhere else it's a flat £10.00.

Skoog 2 is now shipping and available to order from www.skoogmusic.com

Skoog is for aspiring musicians, families, electronic musicians, and has a wealth of applications in education.Skoog 2.0 works with the iPad connecting wirelessly via Bluetooth LE. And is available to order now for just £199 from www.skoogmusic.com
Check out the gallery or visit our youtube channel to see more examples of Skoog being played by musicians and young people, including examples of Skoog being used by individuals with disabilities.
Skoog has featured in:
What is Skoog?

Skoog is an uber-cool, app-ready, hands-on musical cube that brings your creativity to life.  Skoog sets the standard for tactile control and redefines the musical landscape for novices and experts alike.
For aspiring musicians it is an easy to learn musical instrument that you can play within seconds.
For families it is a fun way to explore sound and music together with the kids and grandparents with no need to master complicated music theory or playing techniques.
For electronic musicianit is a hackable, real-time, multi-parameter expressive controller that can bring life to your compositions, live sets and synth jams.

For educators Skoog has a range of applications in Special Education and inclusive music provision. Designed with accessibility in mind, Skoog can be used by musicians of all abilities, making it the go-to instrument for music therapists and assistive technologists, too.
There's nothing like Skoog out there. No other digital musical instrument or music software controller is this tactile, flexible or naturally expressive.
How does it work?
The Skoog is like a games controller for making music
column2: it's a squashy foam cube that acts as a controller for our bespoke software running on your iPad, Mac or PC.

column1: The sensor living at the heart of the Skoog detects how you squeeze and deform the foam - its not just sensitive to how hard the Skoog is being touched, but where  and how it's being touched.
This unparalleled sensitivity means that our sensor translates your actions - the things you do to and with the cube - into meaningful musical sounds. It is uniquely expressive.

When you are using it as an instrument, you choose a sound (guitar, say),  it has a different note on each side (giving you the option of 5 notes at a time), and when you touch a side you play the note. The expressive bit comes from how you touch it:  if you touch it gently, it will be a quiet, soft note, press hard and it will be loud and brash.
Whilst you can choose to aim for the buttons, when you're playing the Skoog you don't have to: the whole surface area of the cube is responsive.
When you are using it as a ‘controller’ you can assign different notes, effects and parameters to up to 17 different playable areas of the Skoog so that you can customise to your heart's content.
What sounds can it make?
Skoogmusic software's sounds are made by a processes called 'physical modelling' and 'subtractive' synthesis. That's not sampling, no sir.
Physical modelling captures the nuances of each particular instrument
column2: play the Skoog as a flute and you'll get the different notes, sounds, tones and timbres determined by ""embouchure"" and breath noise, depending on how you physically manipulate your Skoog.  Subtractive synthesis gives a classic analog synth sound with full on bass, crisp mids and highs.

column1: The modelled instruments provided by the application are expressive and sound pretty wonderful"" - Nick Rothwell, Sound On Sound 'On Test'

It connects to MIDI, too. Skoog can also work as a MIDI controller, which means that you can connect to GarageBand, Logic and other compatible MIDI devices and applications to open up a whole new world of sounds.
Check out our ""Skoog Jams"" playlist for examples of the sounds and instruments available: SKOOG JAMS PLAYLIST
Or watch this montage below:
Who is it for?
Skoog can be used by everyone
column2: young and old, from novices right through to music teachers and sound designers.   With a range of easy to use software/apps and a FREE developer kit in the pipeline, Skoog can be a fun introduction to music making
column3: or it can be a serious piece of kit for on the fly-soundscaping.  It's up to you.

column1: Skoog is for aspiring musicians.

Skoog removes the technical barriers to playing an instrument so that you can focus on your sound. You can be expressing yourself musically in less than a minute.  With a different note on each side, Skoog knows its scales so you don't have to - all you have to do is get in key and start jamming.
What can you play?
Skoog lets you play along with your favourite tunes and tracks
column4: create your own parts and your own sounds
column5: set up loops and layer them
column6: add and control effects on the fly
column8: compose and record your own music.

column1: You can take it to the next level by hooking it up to other music apps and software, like Ableton, Logic or Garageband, and using it as a uniquely tactile and flexible multi-touch, multi-dimensional controller.
Skoog is for parents and teachers.
Skoogmusic was honoured to be a finalist at this years Music Teacher Awards for Excellence in the Best SEN Resource category.   Skoog 2.0 brings new opportunities to the classroom.
Kids are musical. They sing and dance without being taught.

But traditional instruments can be intimidating for younger children.  Skoog gives children (of all ages!) a fun, playful way to explore musical creativity and expression without the need for prior instrumental skills or specialised musical knowledge. Tactile, musical, play.

Using the pentatonic presets you can start making music with kids straight away and each of the sides is colour coded (with a ring around the button). You can use colour coded scores and learning materials to help children play tunes and even compose their own music.

Our first product, Skoog 1, was developed in partnership with teachers and it has been successfully put through its paces over the last four years in schools across the world.  We've applied everything we learned over that time to designing a Skoog for everyone: an affordable, wireless, iOS compatible digital musical instrument and controller that lets you start expressing yourself musically from the moment you pick it up.
The Skoog 2.0 Education Bundle - Applications in Special Ed.
Skoog 2.0 (early bird edition) is in production and now we are delighted to announce that our new education bundles are available via Indiegogo as well.

During the course of the last 4 years we have developed a software package and range of resources to help teachers and students get the most form Skoog in the classroom. This bundle, which includes the Skoogmusic PC/Mac software, is now available on this campaign!
The education bundle includes the wireless Skoog 2.0 interface (in black), Skoogmusic PC/Mac software, Skoogmusic App and a range of teaching material and resources which include:
Support for over 150 popular songs and tunes
20 Lesson plans
14 sample packs
Backing tracks/loops
The bundle includes the iPad App and the skoogmusic software for PC and Mac.
To find out more about the features and benefits of Skoog that are relevant to children with special needs visit the Skoogmusic website.  For specific student populations and applications see:
Cerebral Palsy
Autism
PMLD
Speech and language therapy
Music therapy
Inclusion
Down's Syndrome
Visual Impairment

You can support a range of different music making activities using Skoog.  The interface can be customised to suit a wide range of physical abilities. Here is a short film illustrating how the Skoog concept was developed to address the barriers faced by children with physical and learning difficulties.
Skoog is for electronic musicians.

For all the electronic musicians, producers, sound designers and sonic adventurers out there, Skoog 2.0 gives a new hands-on way to manipulate sound.  With it you can vary multiple parameters at once to perform musical gestures that might require a third hand with standard controllers. Powerful sensors detect how and where the body of the Skoog is deformed in 3D.  By mapping sonic parameters to the sensor data, a single gesture can be used to produce complex musical expression.

All Skoog perks come with Skoogmusic software for iPad, Mac and PC included, so you can have fun exploring the musical possibilities with the physical modelling and subtractive synthesis sound engines that we've designed to work with Skoog.

If you'd like to take things further, in May 2015 we'll be launching our Ableton plugin, so you can setup your Skoog to control pretty much anything your imagination can conjure up using Ableton Live.   On top of that we'll be releasing an API in summer 2015 that will mean that you can start integrating Skoog into your own software.

What software is included?

Every Skoog perk comes with Skoogmusic software for iPad, Mac and PC, and access to our Ableton Plugin.  As you develop in skill you can choose to expand your sonic options with Mogo (Mac/PC), or even augment your Skoog performances using eyegaze technology with ii-Music (PC only as per Jan 2015).   We have other music-making apps, games and an API in development, and Android versions in the pipeline, so your Skoog experience will continue to grow:
1. Skoogmusic: this is the sound engine and control room for your Skoog.
It's all you need to connect, customise and play. Available for Mac, PC and iPad.
2. Mogo: a dedicated virtual analogue synth app designed to work
exclusively with the Skoog. Awesome retro-futuristic sounds that you shape and bend - literally.
What've you got for tweakers?

At Skoogmusic we love experimenting with new ways to combine Skoog 2.0's  tactile-sensing capabilities with audio software.  Tactile interfaces connect you directly to your sound in a way that other interfaces simply cannot, and the possibilities are limited only by your imagination.

Use Skoog to control panning in your quadraphonic sound system, for real-time lighting or video editing, for driving your car, or for tactile control of your frickin' toaster if that is what floats your boat.  With Skoog 2.0 we have unlocked a new level of hands-on control and we want to see what you can do with it.

Over the coming months, we'll be putting together a multi-platform API for Skoog 2.0, as well as external objects for Max/MSP and a Max4Live Device for Ableton users.   Want to see what you can do with it?  Check out the initial spec:
Ableton Max4Live & Max/MSP
Skoog 2.0 API
Who are Skoogmusic?
The Skoogmusic team brings together expertise in music learning and performance,

hardware and software design, coding, music technology & psychology, branding and business.   What started as a post-doc research project at the University of Edinburgh has turned into a mission to liberate the musician inside everyone.
The story so far...
We're ready to get tooled up and otherwise prepared for production of Skoog 2.0.

We have talked extensively with potential partners to manufacture our new self-designed electronics and contracted with our preferred supplier. We're about to sign off tooling design for our injection moulded plastic components,  and we've conducted numerous trials on materials and production techniques for our expanded foam parts, have finalised the design of the tools and they are ready to go into production.
Production Timeline:
How You'll Be Helping
By pre-ordering a Skoog, you'll be playing an essential role in helping us fulfil our
mission of enabling anyone to play and make music.  Hardware
products are tricky to get off the ground
column2: they're real, not virtual, so they need to

column1: be manufactured, which means significant sums have to be spent upfront on tooling.  On top of that,  to keep the costs as low as possible they need to be manufactured at volume.

The good news is that we've just received a loan from company shareholders that will cover the initial tooling costs, meaning that all that remains is to find the funds to pay for our first production run and to complete the final CE/compliance testing process. This is where we need your help.

By contributing to our campaign you will be providing the working capital that we need to pay for our first production run.  And the more we raise, the bigger order we can place, meaning that we can keep the end user price as low as possible.
Our work with Skoog 1.0 in education is our proof that we can deliver. We have
already managed the entire production process necessary to produce a Skoog and
manufactured a limited number of instruments for the SEN (Special Educational Needs)
sector. Now we're applying everything we've learned to the fully-realised wireless
iOS-compatible consumer Skoog.
What Could Possibly Go Wrong?
We could fail to reach our funding targeting
We have reached our funding target so it is full steam ahead with the production of Skoog 2.0.  The only question now is how many to make!
We may have underestimated the costs of getting
production up-and-running
iterative prototyping and testing, have costed every single component and process that's
involved and have confirmed quotations from all our suppliers, so we are confident that
our estimates are accurate.
What if we don't have the necessary skills and experience to execute on our plan?
Well, the team has been together for four years and has already successfully designed,
engineered, manufactured, launched and sold its first product. It works.
What is certain is that Skoogmusic is a lean team of talented and skilled individuals
who share a passion for music, technology and for making the tools for creative expression
available to as many people as possible. We couldn't have got this far without passion,
determination and expertise.

What can I do with MIDI?
MIDI is an easy way to connect different electronic musical instruments and allow
them to ‘talk’ to each other. This is also how you can connect the Skoog to other
synth apps on your iPad and record it in Garageband!
What do I need to send MIDI from the Skoog to an external MIDI device?
You can connect your Skoog to an external MIDI device using the Skoogmusic
OSX software, via any sound card that has a MIDI output.
Which iOS audio apps can the Skoog ‘play’?
Skoog can talk to any app that supports MIDI In via Inter-App Audio.
Examples are Garageband, Nanologue, Orphion, ThumbJam...
It is also compatible with Network MIDI, which will allow you to connect your
Skoog to apps on any compatible device via your WiFi network.
How does the Skoog work with a laptop/desktop computer?
Skoog works with laptop/desktop computers, both Windows PCs
and Apple Macs, via the Mogo OSX or Skoogmusic OSX software.
Can I use my own sensor/controller with the app?
No. The Skoogmusic app and the Skoogmusic/Mogo OSX/Windows software only
work with the Skoog.
Does the Skoog only work with Apple devices?
No, our desktop software runs beautifully on Mac and handsomely on Windows.  Linux users, get in touch.
FUNCTIONALITY
What do the different software packages compare?

Skoogmusic is available for iPad, Mac and PC.  Mogo is currently available in desktop version only, with an iPad version available in September 2015.  Version 1.0 of ii-Music launched in January 2015 and lets you set up and add effects to your Skoog performance using eyegaze hardware (purchased separately) or to explore sound and music using just your eyes.
* ii-Music spec as at Jan 2015.  Features in the pipeline for 2015 include backing tracks, looper, custom tunings and analog synth instruments.
What is the hardware specification for Skoog 2.0?
How do I get the Skoog apps?
The Skoogmusic app will be available via the iTunes App Store. The
Skoogmusic and Mogo software for mac and windows will be available for download from
our website.
Does the Skoogmusic app produce its own sounds?
Yes it does. The main ‘voice’ of the Skoog is generated by physical modelling,
with a range of instrument sounds available including strings, percussions,
woodwind, brass etc.
Where does the sound output come from?
The sound from your Skoog will be routed through the audio output of your tablet/laptop/desktop computer. You can of course enhance the sound of your Skoog by connecting
some high quality loudspeakers/headphones.
Can the Skoog be used to record and sample audio through a microphone?
The Skoogmusic OSX offers extensive sampling and audio recording
functionality for the Skoog.
We are working towards providing the same functionality for the Skoogmusic iOS app,
although you can also utilise other readily available sampling apps and connect
your Skoog to it via MIDI.
Can you change the sounds on the Skoog?
You certainly can! Both the Skoogmusic iOS app and Skoogmusic OSX software boast a
range of ultra expressive and dynamic physical modelling instruments. With its
MIDI functionality and sampling on the Skoogmusic OSX, your choice of Skoog
sounds is limitless!
How many notes can I play with one Skoog?
With our standard software you can play 5 notes at a time, with the ability to pitch bend between each to
produce microtones. You can also assign different notes to different parts of the
Skoog. You can also change key or individual notes on the fly.  Our API will allow you to assign notes to corners and edges fur a maximum of 17 notes.
Can it sound like a trumpet?
Yes it can! The main ‘voice’ of the Skoog is generated by physical modelling, with
a range of instrument sounds available including strings, percussions, woodwind,
brass etc.
Can I connect two Skoogs to the same iOS device?
No, only one Skoog at a time on an iOS device I’m afraid! Skoogmusic
OSX/Windows will allow you to connect up to two Skoogs at a time, to the same computer.
What else do I need to play sounds with the Skoog?
Nothing! Just the Skoog, your iPad/computer, and you are good to go!
Does the Skoog need to be tuned? Can it be tuned to acoustic instruments?
By default, the Skoog is tuned to concert pitch with A4=440Hz. You can tune/detune the Skoog with the fine tuner, so that it’s in tune with any acoustic instrument that you might be
accompanying.
HARDWARE
Where does the Skoog get power from?
Skoog 2.0 gets its power via USB when connected to a desktop computer or laptop using a USB cable, or from its internal rechargeable battery (which charges via USB) when operating in wireless mode.
How sensitive is it? If I had to press hard on one side, wouldn’t that just knock the
Skoog over?
Skoog 2.0 is more sensitive than ever, needing just under 100g of pressure to activate - so if you keep knocking it over, you are pushing too hard!
Are those just buttons?
The buttons act as a visual ""lure"" and give you better directional control whilst playing.  The Skoog  is in fact touch sensitive all over (with the exception of the base).
Isn’t it just a MIDI controller?
Definitely not! The Skoog is so much more than a MIDI controller - the core sounds
available are dynamically generated by physical modelling synthesis, which translate your expressive
gestures into musical sounds. The new Mogo software uses dynamic subtractive synthesis to make Skoog 2.0 more expressive than ever!
How is Skoog 2.0 different from the old Skoog?
For this new version of the Skoog, we have completely redesigned our sensor to fully exploit the opportunities for dynamic control, our
manufacturing process, tooling...everything! We have listened to our users, and
are answering some of our most popular requests: it’s wireless, iOS compatible,
and more affordable.

The new sensor has a much higher polling rate than the old Skoog, and the Bluetooth LE  firmware has been reengineered to give the minimum possible  wireless latency (official figure TBC when we have production prototypes in-hand for testing), so Skoog 2.0 is overall much more responsive.  Skoog 2.0 can also  communicate with your Mac/PC using HID.  For those who want to get straight to the source
data,  we'll be releasing an api very soon so you can start using Skoog 2.0 in your own applications.  We can't wait for developers to start exploring different
uses for Skoog 2.0!  If you are interested in getting your hands on the API, please email support@skoogmusic.com.
Oh yeah, and we think the new look is pretty darned awesome as well.
What is the Skoog’s wireless range?
Skoog 2.0 connects wirelessly via Bluetooth, and has a range of approximately
10 metres.
How long is the battery life?
The Skoog can be used for up to 10 hours between charges.
Can the Skoog connect by USB as well as Bluetooth?
It certainly can - your wireless Skoog can also connect to the computer via USB,
the same way as when you connect it to charge up its battery.
LEARNING & EDUCATION
Can I still buy Skoog for education?
Yes you can, and the wired Skoog 1 is still available to buy from our partners
Douglas Stewart and their reseller network.
You can also purchase Skoog 1 from the Apple store online.
Will this teach me how to play a ‘normal’ instrument?
The Skoog helps people new to playing music to learn about music and sound
as they experiment with musical expression - from pitch, timbre and dynamics
through to scales, instruments, recording and editing.
Do I need to be a musician to use the Skoog?
No. The Skoog is really easy to learn and helps people new to playing music to
learn about music and sound as they experiment with musical expression - from
pitch, timbre and dynamics through to scales, instruments, recording and editing.
What if I don't know what key a piece of music is?
Don't worry, there are loads of websites that can help - check out the Top Tunes section of the Skoogmusic website, Echords or a good old fashioned google search.
MISCELLANEOUS
Can I contribute in USD ($) / other currencies?
Of course!  Our Perk prices are displayed in £GBP but you can make your contribution in USD ($), CAD (C$), AUD (A$), EUR (€) or GBP (£).
What if I can't afford to order a Skoog right now?
No problem. You can still help us realise our vision that 'anyone can play'.
You can order one of our awesome t-shirts.
You can share this campaign with your friends and work connections, using the Indiegogo share tools at the top of this page.
We want Skoog to be available to as many people as possible and you can help us achieve that, whatever resources you have to hand.
What about international shipping?
Shipping within the UK & the EU or to the US is free. Anywhere else it's a flat £10.00.",18.0,4,"4 Campaigns
|","Edinburgh, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/skoog-2-0-a-new-kind-of-music-interface/pica
