<h3><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

Hello everyone, we are Birds of a Feather! We're a progressive metal band out of the small town Le Roy, NY. Now we started Birds with the common goal to make amazing music. And with your help, we're going to make sure we do just that.

Shortly after our formation within two weeks we had music ready. Its crazy, technical, and the product of people who eat, breath and obsess over music. We were granted an opportunity that blew our minds
column2:
Matt Dalton of 37 studios (the same studio that has worked with I see stars, Born of Osiris, Attack Attack!, just to name a few) offered us to come into his studio to work along side
Craig Owens of the band Chiodos, who will be co-producing alongside Matt Dalton.
This is a HUGE opportunity!

column1:
Now, with great opportunities like this come a great price. Studio time at such a large studio is NOT cheap. Now, we have raised/saved some funds on our own and have been pretty successful, but, we still could definitely use YOUR help! This means the world to us! YOU would be granting us the opportunity to help us reach our dreams. And we don't believe in getting so something for nothing, so you'll get some goodies in return.

What We Need &

Alright, we have raised as much as we could in the time given but, as life has it, we have expenses. We are but humble college students with tuition, rent, and gas to pay. Such is life. So, we need you fine people to help us out here!
We need $4000 for everything, all together.
We've made a little bit so far and we are still networking as much as we can.

So let's start with where each and every penny will go:

$1000 for getting you amazing people your perks, merch and goodies.
$500-gas and food to get us to and from home to Michigan, where the studio is.
$3000-For the actual studio time.
+________
$4500 all together
-$1,500 we've already made
_________
$3000 total

Here's some of the neat-o stuff you can get when you pledge to our cause:

 $2.00 gets you a custom ""Birds of a Feather"" guitar pick, a token of our deep gratitude for your contribution.
$5.00 gets you a pre-order of our EP!
$7.00 our Birds of a Feather 1"" silicone WRISTBAND.

$20.00 and you get our t-shirt. 

*note: there's going to be a wait for the shirt. And the following are rough rough drafts as we'll commission an awesome design from EZ*

$35.00 and you get our hoodie.
*note: there's going to be a wait for the hoodie like the shirt.*

 
$100 gets you a GOLDEN TICKET! to all our shows for free. Forever. When we headline a show, it is also a backstage pass. :3
*not including festivals, or headlining bands that won't allow it.*




 Now, if we don't reach our goal we are still going to get out all of the merchandise to contributors first. Because, fans come first. Period. Rest, easy there. We have a plan B so, in case we don't make enough from this campaign, we will still be able to record. 
So no matter what, you're getting awesome stuff and helping us out. Win/win for everyone! But, the more you contribute, the less kidneys we have to figuratively sell.

The Impact
We've been studying music for the majority of our lives. Everything from Dream Theater, to Bach.

We will work tirelessly to raise the standard of of music as we know it today. YOU are helping raise the standard of music today by contributing to us.

You are getting awesome stuff starting at the low price of two dollars!

 We have a musical vision and we made sure to have like-minded people (Craig Owens/ Matt Dalton) help us out. They are the best of the best. And so are we! With your help we will make music that won't soon be forgotten with your contributions.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Some of the risks are we won't make enough and won't be able to record. Rest assured that you, the contributor, have not wasted your dime as we have our plan B which involves selling instruments and prolonging the process of playing shows so you can get what you payed for.

If we don't make our goal we already have a lot of the merchandise. And if we don't have enough to accommodate. We will use the some of the funds you contribute to help that out and make sure everyone gets what they paid for before the studio. Again, fans come first. Period.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to help us out, that is fine! We understand financial struggles or we wouldn't be here! Now, if you want to help us out and don't have the money to do so. Then spread the word! Let people know about us!
Share this campaign with your friends!
Like us on Facebook!
Follow us on twitter!
LET EVERYONE KNOW WE NEED HELP! SHARE! SHARE! SHARE!
","https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2IXlPwAXnfU

My Name is Jake Jacobs, AKA, JakeFJ. I'm originally from Hampshire but I now live in London, where I work as a secondary school science teacher. I want to do more with my music, at the moment it is just a hobby but this campaign is about taking the next step.

You, kind people, will be helping me to fund the recording of my first studio EP - four tracks to will demonstrate what I've done so far and to pave the way for future endeavours! Recording in a studio isn't cheap. Your pledges will go towards paying for the studio time and for the time of the team helping me create the finished article. I have some perks to offer in return for your help, this is all about sharing my work with you and including you in the JakeFJ journey. The EP is a piece of work that I will also be able to share with radio stations, labels and potential gig venues. My goal is to play shows and play festivals, this will be the tool I need to get things started.
This isn't the only way that you can help, at this early stage it's about making as much noise as possible online, putting the word about will be an immense boost.
I am extremely grateful for any help you can offer, thank you very much for your support!

The first edition of the AUDIOTRAUMA FEST was set in Prague during December 2015. This event was a unique moment of communion with those who share our artistic sensibility and it encouraged us to continue this tradition.
Next year we are going to celebrate 15 years of cultural activism of audiotrauma and we want to celebrate this anniversary with a special edition of this festival.
A festival without an audience doesn't make any sense, and it would make it impossible to continue this tradition.
That's why we invite you to join this crowd founding campain to make it possible and then we can organize the best festival for you.
If the objective is not reached the deadline, then all the contributors will be refunded and the festival will be cancelled.
All supports are very welcome.
Share it

Hello! I'm Duke Otherwise and I have been entertaining children my entire life — even when I was a kid myself!  I love to write songs that bring joy and feature clever wordplay and ideas. Songs with unexpected twists and turns along the way.

Over the years I’ve found that it’s hard to find music that adults and kids can enjoy together — leaving both parties annoyed and frustrated. I believe adults and children should be able to share the music they enjoy and create a connection while listening to it!
When I compose music and lyrics I always write with these two things in mind:
1.   KIDS ARE SMART!
2.   Adults should be able to enjoy this music just as much as the kids.

I love to challenge children to think outside of the box, introduce them to new words to expand their vocabularies, and package the lyrics in music that doesn't sound ""canned"" or ""kiddie.""  Kids like ""real music,"" and it is my aim to make real music that adults can enjoy with them.   When parents and kids can put on a Duke Otherwise album, laugh together, dance together, and discuss the story and/or wordplay together, I have achieved my goal!
I have never been more excited about a new collection of songs than I am about this one!

We are raising $15,000.  This covers our recording costs, studio musicians, mixing, mastering, artwork, and manufacturing of the first batch of CDs.  When you contribute to the campaign you will receive a perk. The best part is you get to pick what you want:  our brand new album ""Kith and Kin"" on CD,  a personalized song about a child in your life,  a house concert, a guitar once played by Duke, a private Skype concert, and more!
I’m excited that we’re doing this together!

La drummondvilloise qui enregistre son premier EP !!!

Allo allo allo !!! <
column2:
3

C'est avec le coeur débordant de joie et de gratitude que je vous annonce officiellement la production de mon premier EP (YAY!)

J'ai toujours chanté, depuis aussi loin que je me souviennes. Ça me faisait - et encore aujourd'hui - tellement du bien! Petite fille, je voulais être pompière ou chanteuse
column3:
deux métiers qui aident le monde! Mais là, ça fait 5 ans que je me suis mise plus sérieusement à faire de la musique et à composer mes chansons! Ce sont cinq années parsemées de réussites, de refus et de remises en question mais je n'y changerais absolument rien! 

Je me souviens du premier refus que j'ai reçu
column4: celui qui a été le plus déterminant! En secondaire 5, mon application pour un double DEC en sciences humaines/art et lettres (ouais, je saiiiiiiiiis) avait été refusée parce que ma moyenne générale à l'école était trop basse. Ça fait que je me suis inscrite en musique « en attendant ». Depuis, elle et moi [la musique] on ne s'est jamais lâché. Merci au Cégep de Drummondville de m'avoir envoyé un avis de refus et demandé de choisir un DEC simple. Je vous en dois une bonne!
column5:
)

J'ai souvent de la misère à choisir mes kits pour mes shows (lol). Par contre, choisir de faire de la musique pour le reste de ma vie, c'est décidément le choix le plus beau et le plus facile que j'aurai eu à faire de toute ma - jeune - vie!

J'ai vraiment très hâte de vivre cette belle aventure là qu'est l'enregistrement d'un EP et de vous le partager!
CERISE SUR LE GATEAU: j'ai le grand honneur/bonheur de travailler avec Antoine Gratton pour la réalisation et les arrangements!!!!

 

CE QUE VOUS SUPPORTEZ

Tous les fonds iront pour les dépenses reliées à la production du EP

-Le studio et son technicien

-Les musiciens

-Le réalisateur

-Le mixage

-Le graphisme

-La pochette d'album

Il y a plusieurs contreparties (récompenses) différentes, selon le montant que vous voulez donner. Allez y jeter un coup d'oeil! Si le coeur vous en dit, je serai éternellement reconnaissante de votre support!

À bientôt,

Gros bisou

Allyson xox

","La drummondvilloise qui enregistre son premier EP !!!Allo allo allo !!! <3C'est avec le coeur débordant de joie et de gratitude que je vous annonce officiellement la production de mon premier EP (YAY!)J'ai toujours chanté, depuis aussi loin que je me souviennes. Ça me faisait - et encore aujourd'hui - tellement du bien! Petite fille, je voulais être pompière ou chanteuse
column6: deux métiers qui aident le monde! Mais là, ça fait 5 ans que je me suis mise plus sérieusement à faire de la musique et à composer mes chansons! Ce sont cinq années parsemées de réussites, de refus et de remises en question mais je n'y changerais absolument rien! Je me souviens du premier refus que j'ai reçu
column7: celui qui a été le plus déterminant! En secondaire 5, mon application pour un double DEC en sciences humaines/art et lettres (ouais, je saiiiiiiiiis) avait été refusée parce que ma moyenne générale à l'école était trop basse. Ça fait que je me suis inscrite en musique « en attendant ». Depuis, elle et moi [la musique] on ne s'est jamais lâché. Merci au Cégep de Drummondville de m'avoir envoyé un avis de refus et demandé de choisir un DEC simple. Je vous en dois une bonne!
column8: )J'ai souvent de la misère à choisir mes kits pour mes shows (lol). Par contre, choisir de faire de la musique pour le reste de ma vie, c'est décidément le choix le plus beau et le plus facile que j'aurai eu à faire de toute ma - jeune - vie!J'ai vraiment très hâte de vivre cette belle aventure là qu'est l'enregistrement d'un EP et de vous le partager!CERISE SUR LE GATEAU: j'ai le grand honneur/bonheur de travailler avec Antoine Gratton pour la réalisation et les arrangements!!!! CE QUE VOUS SUPPORTEZTous les fonds iront pour les dépenses reliées à la production du EP-Le studio et son technicien-Les musiciens-Le réalisateur-Le mixage-Le graphisme-La pochette d'albumIl y a plusieurs contreparties (récompenses) différentes, selon le montant que vous voulez donner. Allez y jeter un coup d'oeil! Si le coeur vous en dit, je serai éternellement reconnaissante de votre support!À bientôt,Gros bisouAllyson xox",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

Norcal Noisefest 2019 is the 23rd annual Northern California Experimental Music Festival, a national gathering of noise musicians that takes place every year in Sacramento, California. This year's Noisefest is scheduled for October 4, 5 and 6, Friday through Sunday, at Luna's Cafe and Cafe Colonial/The Colony. We are seeking funds in order to pay for pre-event promotion expenses that help to spread the word about the Norcal Noisefest, increase festival attendance, and provide more funds to pay musicians.
Current Noisefest details can always be found at norcalnoisefest.com

Your contributions will help pay the travel expenses of noise musicians from across the United States and around the world. We gather in Sacramento every fall to participate in the Norcal Noisefest, the longest running festival of its kind in North America. Funds are also used to spread the word about Norcal Noisefest throughout the western United States.
Your Contribution Helps Spread the Noise!
We are seeking a total of $1500 in revenue to promote the Noisefest and pay the musicians, to pay a larger number of musicians more money, and reach a wider audience.

We are offering a wide variety of perks--including Noisefest tickets and merchandise, one-of-a-kind artwork, music and experiences, effects pedals provided by our sponsors NOISEFX, reserved tables at Noisefest nights, and even the chance to perform on stage, with your own group or as a member of INSTAGON or UBERKUNST, the only performers to play every single Norcal Noisefst since 1995! This year, we are introducing a new perk--the AVALANCHE OSCILLATOR effects pedal kit, as a way to promote electronics education along with musical education, in the ""do it yourself"" tradition of the Noisefest.

Indiegogo campaign funds will be divided between marketing and performer payment. If we don't reach our funding target, we have that much less to spend on marketing and musician payment. If we exceed our goal, all additional revenue will be used to pay visiting bands more money. We pride ourselves on breaking even on the Fest--all profits beyond basic festival expenses goes to the bands! Our festival also supports two independent, all-ages local music venues
column2: the Noisefest is one of the busiest nights a year for Luna's Cafe, and one of the largest and most consistent annual events at Cafe Colonial/The Colony. Promotion helps bring visitors and music aficionados to these great venues, supporting them and encouraging them to book more outsider and experimental music.

column1: Keep a Sacramento Noise Tradition Alive!

The funding campaign for Norcal Noisefest 2018 was a huge success thanks to our Indiegogo supporters--we raised $1755 with a goal of $1500. After adding the revenue generated at the Noisefest, we spent $1012 on promotion and paid performers $1980.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

Hello everyone!  We are Slyde - an independent rock band based out of Ottawa and Toronto, Canada.  Since late-2009, we have self-released three records, and self-booked and promoted six tours throughout Eastern Canada - comprising almost 100 gigs, including two performances at the high-profile Cisco Ottawa Bluesfest in 2010 and 2011.  We incorporate elements of progressive rock, pop, European metal, and Japanese video game music into our sound, and we are often compared to such bands as RUSH, Dream Theater, and Coheed and Cambria.
Our current story:

Slyde usually works on a write/record/tour cycle.  We are currently in the second stage of this cycle, recording a brand new EP with Ottawa-based musician/producer Eric Disero, who produced our last 2011 concept record, ""Feed The Machine"".

As a 100% independent band, we assume the management, booking agent, promoter/publicist, and distribution roles to ourselves.  In other words, we generally have no financial support from other third parties, and have always funded all band expenses out of our own pockets to date.

This is where you come into the equation.  We need your help in funding this upcoming EP, ""New World Sympathy"", which will be released on June 12th, 2012.  It builds upon the sound achieved in ""Feed The Machine"":  a distinctive form of alternative and progressive hard rock with a pop sensibility, in combination with lyrical content discussing political and enviromental issues.

""New World Sympathy"" focuses on music with lyrical substance, presenting current issues such as the geological destruction of the Alberta tar sands, society neglecting the need for social awareness in environmentalism, and seeking worldwide change in how we negatively treat our world.  With your help and support, you can be a part of this message!
<div>
Slyde's Mission for ""New World Sympathy"":
We are organizing this campaign to raise roughly $2000, which is just a portion of what we need for this new EP to be as successful as it can be.  A rough financial breakdown is as follows:

- Production, tracking, editing, mixing, and mastering of four songs:  $2000
 - Manufacturing of 200 physical copies of the EP, using FSC-certified cardboard slips, CD-Rs, and CD labels:  ~$400
 - Production of 5000 business cards for digital distribution of the EP:  $300
 - Production for a 3-month campus radio campaign across Canada - 80 CDs with jewel cases and spine, CD labels, postage costs:  $350
If you can contribute to this campaign, we will give you:

A ""special thanks"" to you in our online liner notes for ""New World Sympathy"", a pre-release of a digital copy of ""New World Sympathy"", a signed pre-release physical copy of ""New World Sympathy"", signed copies of our back catalog, online piano/guitar lessons by members of Slyde, and much more!  Please see our perks on the right side of the page.

If we do not succeed in reaching our $2000 goal, any contribution will still be put towards the funding of this record, and you will still receive the perk associated with your donation.  So any help is very much appreciated!

If you cannot help us financially, you can still help us spread the word!  Share this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, etc.
Thank you for reading this!  Sincerely,

Slyde
Nathan Da Silva, Sarah Westbrook, Nicholas Favretto, Brendan Soares
For more information on Slyde, please visit:
Slyde Official website - http://www.slyde.ca
Slyde Discography (available for FREE download) - http://slyde.bandcamp.com
Slyde Videos - http://youtube.com/slydetv
Slyde Summer 2012 Tour Dates - http://slyde.ca/shows
Slyde Press - http://slyde.ca/press
